The *Marvelous Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Northern Emperor for Subduing Demons, Spoken by the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy*

**Scripture Title:** *The Marvelous Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Northern Emperor for Subduing Demons, Spoken by the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy*
**Original Attribution:** Transmitted to Ouyang Wen by the Celestial Clerk of the Azure Sky Grotto, Hua Taiyi of the Three Caverns of Supreme Clarity’s Scriptures and Registers.
**Internal References:** As recounted by Perfected Lord Tao and Zheng Siyuan, likely composed between the late Tang and early Song dynasties.
**Ten fascicles.**
**Source Text:** *Daoist Canon of the Orthodox Tradition*, First Section.

**The Marvelous Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Northern Emperor for Subduing Demons, Spoken by the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy, Fascicle the First**
Transmitted to Ouyang Wen by the Celestial Clerk of the Azure Sky Grotto, Hua Taiyi of the Three Caverns of Supreme Clarity’s Scriptures and Registers

**Chapter on the Preface and Discourse**

The Dao speaks:
In the first year of the Dragon-Han era, the *jiawu* year, the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy resided in the Palace of the Upper Primordial, the Celestial Capital of the Eight Effulgences. Seated upon a precious throne of fivefold clouds, he let fall the ten mystic banners of absolute numinosity. Accompanied by the thirty-two Heavenly Emperors, the Perfected Ones of the Ten Poles, jade lads and jade maidens, the Venerable Ones of the Three Luminaries, the demon-subduing Great Kings of Majestic Power, the Great Spirits of the Eight Effulgences, and an innumerable host of flying dragon riders and celestial clerks, the azure vault resounded with celestial hymns, and the music of the heavens swayed and drifted as he expounded the wondrous Dharma of the True Unity.

At that time, the northeastern quarter of the Celestial Capital of the Upper Primordial trembled and quaked. Suddenly, the gates of heaven swung open, and gazing downward, a dense and surging crimson radiance was seen, intermingled with turbid qi. Dark and obscure, it rose from the northeastern realm of the human world, piercing the celestial palaces. Coiling and congealing, it refused to disperse, its vapors reeking of blood and putrid filth.

The assembled multitude was struck with awe and dared not speak. Then, from within the Dharma assembly, a Perfected One named Wondrous Conduct, replete with blessings and virtue, raised his gaze, adjusted his robes, and stepped forward. Drawing in his tablets and pacing with measured steps, he prostrated himself twice, kneeling in reverence, and addressed the Heavenly Worthy:

“Your servant has heard that the realm of the utmost Perfected and wondrous is luminous and free of inauspicious omens, while the land of the formless by nature expels all monstrous anomalies. Though I have attended the Dao Lord for ten thousand kalpas, never before have I witnessed such a strange sight.”

Alas! Today, within this Dharma assembly, we behold this foul congealing of black, poisonous, blood-laden qi surging chaotically toward the heavens. What portent of disaster or fortune is this? I implore the Most Sagely One to once more proclaim the wondrous canon, dispelling the doubts of all and tracing this phenomenon to its source, that those who cultivate the Dao may be moved to reverence and devotion.

Then, the Most High Lord of the Primordial Beginning smiled faintly after a long silence and spoke: "You all must know this—compose yourselves in stillness and quietude, for I shall explain it to you. The beings of the Lower Kalpa all descend from this very realm. Their forms, born of the undifferentiated True Unity, are endowed with thirty-six thousand divine qi. Yet though they are upheld and guarded in purity, they have long been swayed by yin demons, forgetting their origin and losing their root. Now that the reckoning of three nines has reached its end, ghostly demons proliferate. They cling to deviant paths, forsaking the source of the Dao. Their bodies, host to manifold spirits, are confounded by legions of yin demons and malevolent ghosts. Their hearts breed wickedness, and they slaughter the multitudes of living beings, aligning themselves with gods and ghosts to ingratiate themselves and seek spurious blessings. As the appointed cycle nears its close, they grow reckless and dissolute, disloyal and unfilial, unkind and unjust, delighting in perverse ways. Now, the Six Heavens’ ghostly spirits inflict wanton harm. Whether man or woman, old or young, they cut short lives not yet fulfilled, snuffing them out untimely. The souls of the dead, not yet dispersed, coalesce into baleful qi, their resentment and fury ascending in a surge—you ought to take heed of this."

Upon hearing these words, Wondrous Conduct was seized with great dread. He addressed the Heavenly Worthy, saying: "Those ghostly spirits of the Six Heavens—what power and might do they possess? What supernatural abilities? How is it that they roam the mortal realm, inflicting all manner of harm, slaughtering and wounding living beings without fear, defying all dharmas and restraints? I beseech you, deign to elucidate this for your servant. Though I am dull-witted, I would borrow your sagely power to comprehend their origins. Then I might journey there to offer salvation, sparing the beings of the Lower Kalpa from such unjust calamities."

The Heavenly Worthy addressed Wondrous Conduct, saying: "Beyond the due north of this celestial realm, past the boundless expanse of the Great Brine where measure fails, at the uttermost extremity of the northern quarter, there lies a world called the Cavern of Five Qi Mystic Heaven, shrouded in yin’s desolate gloom. Within that land rules an Imperial Lord named the Supreme Yin Fivefold Numinous Mystic Elder Black Thearch Numinous Lord. His attendant and chief minister is the Mystic Nourishment Heavenly Lord. The Supreme Numinous Lord, in his practice of true qi, descended to give birth to a Jade Maiden named the Supreme Mystic Night Radiance Jade Maiden. Together with the Lord and the boundless host of Mystic Numinous Officials of the northern precincts, they unseal the Northern Gate of the Supreme Mystic, called the Gate of Yin’s Vast Numinous Birth. There they expound the *Marvelous Scripture of the Supreme Mystic True Unity*, by which they govern and restrain the yin demons. All who taste this dharma’s savor—even the dead revive, withered bones grow plump again, and none suffer untimely death or unjust calamity.

Beneath that land stretches the Great Void and Vast Wilderness of the Brine’s Abyss, its circumference beyond all measure. Its waters are foul, rank, and black, their depths unfathomable. At its center rises a mighty mountain, its summit piercing the azure vault, its base plunging into the windy springs, named Mount Fengdu Luo. It towers one hundred and six thousand li high, its girth fifty thousand li. Its roots descend ten thousand li into the water. At the water’s edge, where the mountain’s foot meets the deep, lies the Cavern-Heaven Realm of Yin’s Shadow. Its sovereign is the Supreme Yin Water Thearch, the Northern Yin Heavenly Lord. This cavern-heaven spans fifteen thousand li in circumference; its palace is called the Palace of Supreme Yin. His aides and ministers include: the Life-Generating Qi Lord of the Eastern Dipper, the Form-Generating Lord of the Western Dipper, the Prohibitions Overseer of the Southern Dipper, the Life Mandate Overseer of the Northern Dipper, the General Records Keeper of the Central Dipper, the Nine Commanding Subordinate Officers, the Prefects of the Five Marchmounts, the Twenty-Four Yin Officials of the Twenty-Four Governances, the Twenty-Four Yang Officials of the Twenty-Four Governances, the River and Sea Attendants, the Masters of Hills, Mounds, Streams, and Ravines, and a boundless host of lesser officers. The baleful spirits and malevolent gods of the Six Heavens serve as his guards. To his left and right stand thirty-six prisons, each fifty li in circumference."

Within these prisons, grasses and trees all bear the baleful, venomous qi of nature, their growth forming blades and sword-points. Abounding in myriad poisons, fierce beasts, and raging flames, they are shrouded in black smoke and howling winds that never cease. Murky darkness and toxic vapors, blood-red miasmas and foul stenches fill the air. Chariots of fire and rivers of ash, iron rods and bronze hammers—tortures and torments resound with wails that shake the heavens. Here dwell the flesh-bound mortals of the Lower Realm, the sinful ghosts and dead souls.

Beyond the cavern-heaven of Supreme Yin, to its left and right, lie three lesser palaces, each fifty *li* in extent, each governed by its own overseer. The first is called the Palace of Heavenly Officials, the second the Palace of Earthly Officials, and the third the Palace of Water Officials—all critical bureaus for the summoning of life and death.

Within these mountains stand six cavern-palaces, known as the Six Cavern-Palaces of the Supreme Yin Cavern-Heaven. Each spans five thousand *li* in circumference, and together they form the Six Ministries of the Nether Bureau. Each palace is presided over by a great demon-king, who commands a host of thirty-six myriad lesser officers—all monstrous and malevolent spirits of grotesque forms, some assuming the shapes of fish and dragons, serving as his guards. Their cavern-gates lie hidden in the boundless obscurity of the Great Void, perpetually veiled by swirling mists. Without the supreme power of the Heavenly Emperor, none may approach. These are the Six Palaces of the Demon-Kings of the Six Heavens, whose ghosts descend into the mortal realm to bewilder and confuse. They devour the blood and essence of pregnant women, inducing nightmares and evil thoughts. Some take the forms of cats or dogs to startle women, causing pallor, blood depletion, madness, and wasting illnesses. They feast upon the lives of mortal children, from infancy to ten years of age, cutting short those whose allotted span is not yet exhausted. The foolish and deluded, unable to cultivate spirit or prolong life, fall prey to these demonic forces and forfeit their destined years. These demons also bind the Nine Ancestral and Seven Generational kin of the living, interrogating them by name and entangling them in shared suffering—afflicting them with all manner of ailments: emaciation, sores, ulcers, festering wounds, scabies, leprosy, madness, blindness, deafness, and blockages. They bring calamities of wind and water, wandering souls, and nightmares; they bind with willow fetters, whip and beat, and impose extraordinary restraints, inflicting countless diseases too numerous to recount. They falsely seize the living’s years, fate, Three Hun, and Seven Po, submitting them to the Six Palaces, erasing their names from the register of the living and inscribing them in the ledger of the dead. Bedridden for years, their bodies transformed, they seek blood and sustenance. Some become the uncanny apparitions of female shamans, shaking bells and drums in ancient trees; others take the forms of the Three Sovereigns, Five Emperors, or ancient kings, adorned with tassels and sashes. Some appear as demon-maidens of the Six Heavens, richly dressed and alluring; others as fierce generals or treacherous ministers of past dynasties, wielding halberds and swords. Some manifest as great generals of the heavens, riding the qi of the sun, moon, and stars through the mortal realm; others as the likenesses of the living’s seven generations of buried ancestors. Some assume the shapes of wild beasts, riding flying birds or driving serpents and rats, their five-colored radiance bewitching youths and maidens. Some possess strange trees or uncanny stones; others lurk in ancient caves or springs. A thousand forms, a hundred transformations—all to slaughter and harm the living. When pressed, they may seek arcane methods of restraint or suppression, but if their power proves insufficient, they retreat into their caverns, beyond pursuit. Against such evils, those without great might cannot prevail. Some possess the power to move mountains, uproot trees, summon clouds, and stir rain—unrestrainable forces.

Then, Miao Xing addressed the Heavenly Venerable, saying: "Though I am dull-witted, I humbly beseech your sacred power. Today, I request to lead the True Immortals, Flying Immortals, and Dragon-Riders of the Three Heavens to descend into the mortal realm and subdue these demons, that the living of the Lower Realm may be spared their torment."

The Heavenly Venerable replied to Miao Xing: "I do not send you forth to test your sincerity. Since you seek to subdue these evil spirits and perform a virtuous deed, you shall proceed."

Thereupon, Miao Xing arose from the Dharma assembly, leading the Three Heavenly Elders, the Ten Ultimate True Immortals, their celestial riders and flying generals, with heavenly music guiding the way. They journeyed due north, following the dense black qi until, several *li* above the mortal realm, their dragon-cranes ceased to advance, their cloud-chariots stalled, and their retinue of attendants recoiled, unable to press forward.

Then, from among the assembly, a True Lord of the White Chariot and White Horse spoke to Miao Xing: "The mortal realm below is thick with the stench of corpses and the foul qi of ghosts. We are the purest of the Three Clarities, beings of golden form and jade substance, companions of purity. To encounter such filth is unbearable—we cannot descend. We must return to heaven; to proceed further is impossible."

Thereupon, Miao Xing led the Daoist assembly back to the Heaven of Supreme Yang, where they prostrated before the Heavenly Venerable, kneeling to address him: "Yesterday, I accompanied the Three Heavenly Elders, the Ten Ultimate True Immortals, and their celestial retinue to descend into the mortal realm and subdue the demonic spirits, to save and protect the living. Yet upon reaching the place, mere *ren* above the earth, our dragon-cranes would not advance, and our attendants and true followers all recoiled, overwhelmed by the foul and toxic miasma of the demonic spirits. I do not know by what method or art the living may be spared this devastation."

The Heavenly Venerable then said to Miao Xing: "At the summit of Mount Fengdu, on the northern frontier of the Void Origin, resides the Divine Lord of the North, who commands an innumerable host of mighty demon-kings, celestial soldiers, and thunderous storm spirits of the yin realm—possessing immense power. Without the Divine Lord of the North, none can subdue them."

Miao Xing then addressed the Heavenly Venerable: "By what Daoist power may we summon this Divine Lord of the North, to save the living and spare them from the stench of corpses and daily harm?"

At that moment, the Heavenly Venerable clicked his teeth and remotely visualized the Supreme Yin Northern Emperor within the Five Qi Heavens of the North. Thereupon, the Northern Emperor, perceiving from afar, led the Ten Heavenly Demon-Kings, the Eight Radiant Great Spirits, the Thirty-Six Cavern Heaven Ding Warriors, the Three-Five Great Generals, the Lofty Banner Five Lakes Great General, the Valiant Northern Dipper Seven Primes Great General, the Guarding Spirits, the Innumerable Flying Thunder and Lightning Officers, the Mighty Beasts and Poisonous Dragons, and all lesser spirit-officers, along with the Great Power Flying Heavenly Ghost Hosts of the Northern Yin—all assembling at once at the appointed gathering place. There, girded with swords and jade pendants, holding tablets and pacing with measured steps, he twice bowed and knelt, saying: "Since I last attended your sacred banquet, barely ten kalpas have passed. Today, I remotely receive your secret decree and am granted the honor of beholding your holy countenance. I do not know what command or task the Most Sacred One has summoned me to perform."

Then the Heavenly Venerable addressed the Northern Emperor: "The yin ghosts and demons of the Northern Darkness have emerged into the human realm, wrongfully slaughtering more than half of the living. Now, in this year of the Three Nines and Seven Fives, the living are benighted, and the harm wrought by ghosts and demons is especially severe. Their allotted lifespans unfulfilled, countless numbers are cut down untimely. Their yin souls do not disperse, lingering and coalescing in the dark paths. Innumerable grieving spirits surge upward, shaking heaven. You, together with the Ten Cavern Demon-Kings and the Three-Five Generals and officers, must descend to the human world and restrain these yin ghosts. When your merit is complete and your virtue aligned, you shall ascend into the formless and naturally attain the true ultimate."

Thereupon, the Northern Emperor twice bowed and received the command. He assembled the Ten Heavenly Great Demon-Kings, the Three-Five Great Generals, the soldiers and officers under the Three Masters, the Heavenly Peng Killing Lads, the Northern Dipper Killing Officers, the Mighty Beast Flying Officers, the Owl-Hooked Lasso Flying Officers, the Supreme Perfected Spirits, the Heavenly Ding Warriors, the Heavenly Couriers and Armored Soldiers, the Southern Dipper Demon-Slaying Envoys, the Northern Dipper Torch-and-Chariot Divine Officers, with purple qi surging forth and flowing fire stretching for ten thousand miles, descending into the human realm. Before the yin ghosts had even glimpsed the heavenly troops, ten days prior, they had already all encountered the Northern Emperor’s Supreme Mystery Killing Qi, which first shattered their brains, killing more than half. As the Northern Emperor descended, the skies and earth were swept asunder. Above, the Heavenly Net was spread; below, the Earthly Web was laid. The Heavenly Couriers and fierce beasts charged forth with gnashing teeth. The Heavenly Ding Flying Officers severed and smashed, crushing all. Some, not yet transformed in shape, had no place to hide. Some became dragons or serpents; others took the form of demonic maidens. Within seven days, all were restrained and destroyed.

Thereupon, the Northern Emperor led the heavenly troops back to the Upper Prime Heaven. In the Eight Radiant Jade Palace, he paid homage to the Heavenly Venerable: "I, having received your sacred decree, descended to the lower realm and subdued the yin demons. Within seven days, I have broken the Six Cavern Ghost Palaces of Mount Fengdu in the North. I have assigned one Great Power Demon-King to each cavern, commanding them to guard and suppress it firmly."

Then the Northern Emperor addressed the Heavenly Venerable: "In the lower realm, during the Three Nines and Seven Fives of the human world, many have accumulated great wickedness and transgressions. Deeply deluded and heavily burdened, they have summoned the cavern demons, who remotely exploit their depletion and secretly emerge into the human world. Some may not have been fully restrained, or when a person’s allotted lifespan nears its end, the yin caverns open of their own accord. If not forbidden and controlled, they will spread throughout the human world—across the Four Seas and Five Lakes, the Seven Marshes and Nine Rivers, the Five Peaks and Twenty-Four Grotto-Heavens, the mountains and rivers, pits and caves—becoming disasters for humanity. I have dispatched three hundred thousand troops to constantly patrol the human realm, rescuing the living from dire straits. If one recites my divine name and chants this incantation once, upon hearing it, the demon-ghosts will all have their brains shattered."

The Northern Emperor said: "In the lands of the lower realm’s living, should there be years of famine and grain scarcity, the Three Disasters of warfare, or pestilence spreading widely, causing the people of the nation to perish and blood to flow like rivers, one must purify oneself and seek the Three Cavern Daoist Masters. At the northern gate of the nation, establish and erect a Northern Dipper Seven Primes altar, light lamps, scatter flowers, perform the Daoist rites, and submit memorials. Recite my Six Heavenly Spirit Incantations, circumambulating for seven days, fourteen days, or forty-nine days. At that time, I shall lead the Three-Five Great Generals, the Heavenly Peng Division, the Ten Heavenly Demon-Kings, the innumerable hosts, the Great Power Heavenly Ding Warriors, the Flying Thunder and Lightning Cavalry, the Owl-Hooked Lasso Cavalry Divine Kings, the Ten-Thousand-Zhang Mighty Sword Southern Dipper Great Spirits, the Northern Dipper Envoys, with purple qi and flowing fire, to conceal and protect that place, sweeping away demon-ghosts, pestilence, bloodshed, and the foul, turbid miasma, rendering all pure and clear."

The Northern Emperor said: "In the lower realm, when women are pregnant and suffer miscarriage or death, their descendants fail to thrive in nineteen out of twenty cases. Some carry a child for one or two months, or even to term, but the fetus perishes in the womb, or the child grows to seven or ten years old before dying untimely. This is all because the woman’s blood and impurity attract the Six Cavern Heaven Demon-Mothers and Ghost-Mothers, who fly after the woman, consuming her essence and qi, repeatedly harming the fetus and blood. This causes the woman to become emaciated, sallow, and weak, plagued by nightmares and terrifying visions. These ghosts transform into cats, rats, civets, or dogs, devouring the woman’s offspring in her dreams. One must purify the halls and chambers, seek out Daoist masters, and according to the rites, establish an altar to worship the Northern Dipper Seven Prime Lords. Burn incense, light lamps, recite my divine incantations, perform the Daoist rites, and offer repentance. For one to seven days, I shall dispatch the Twelve Supreme Mystery Night-Luminous Jade Maidens to guard the woman, ensuring no harm befalls her and all comes to fruition. If, during a difficult childbirth, the Ghost-Mother obstructs and the Northern Yin’s impure ghosts seek to feed, devouring the birthing mother’s blood, causing her excruciating pain for a day or seven days—suffering unbearable agony, moaning day and night—one must purify the courtyard, establish an altar, perform the rites, and recite the incantations. I shall send the Nine Mystery Killing Lads and the Six Ding Jade Maidens to protect the birthing mother, sparing her from pain. The children she bears, whether male or female, will all be extraordinary in appearance, upright, intelligent, noble, and successful."

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan encounter celestial calamities and pestilential epidemics, or suffer from raging febrile toxins that confine all to bed, with misfortunes arising unbidden—whether malevolent ghosts seize their dwellings, or false disasters afflict their fate and natal stars, bringing cangues, fetters, imprisonment, and years of confinement, blocking all four directions; or long illness binds their souls, held captive by demonic spirits in the nether bureaus; or wasting ghosts obstruct their fortunes, scattering wealth and diminishing destiny, rendering all endeavors futile—then, in accordance with the ritual statutes, they must submit memorials and petitions, perform jiao offerings to the Seven Primordial Lords of the Northern Dipper and the Five Planets and Twenty-Eight Constellations, practice the Dao, recite incantations, light lamps, and scatter flowers for one, three, seven, or forty-nine days. I shall command the Life-Recording Lord of the Northern Dipper to expunge their names from the Black Register, and the Custodian Lord of the Southern Dipper to amend their entries in the Book of Life. Their years shall be extended, their lives prolonged, and disasters transformed into blessings. All mad and perverse demonic spirits shall be driven away and slain by the Great Demon Kings of the Six Heavens and the Generals of the Three and Five, preventing them from causing further harm.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan seek to study the Dao yet fail midway, becoming lost, confused, and unable to progress, they must purify themselves through fasting and bathing, then recite my divine incantation—seven times or up to a hundred—whether walking, standing, or resting, regardless of defilement. As long as the heart holds the recitation, the Seven Primordial Lords of the Northern Dipper shall descend, infusing their hearts with pure qi, dispelling inner demons, fortifying the body with a hundred spirits, stabilizing their inner sanctuary, unblocking the heart’s orifices, and invigorating the spirit. Thus, their studies shall bear fruit.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan traverse great seas, rivers, or lakes and encounter storms with thunder, lightning, and crashing waves, or journey through perilous mountains, forests, and valleys at dusk, spending nights in the wilderness amid the terrors of wolves, tigers, dragons, serpents, and spectral horrors—they must purify their hearts, sit upright, and silently recite this incantation twenty-one times. Then, the Demon Kings of the Six Heavens, the Great General Tianpeng, and their divine hosts, along with the deities of the wilds, the Eight Radiant Spirit Kings, the gods of the Five Peaks, Four Waterways, rivers, streams, and valleys, and the local earth spirits shall descend in response, encircling and protecting them. Fear shall vanish, safety ensured, their spirits calmed, and all malevolent forces dispersed.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan remain childless, it is because the Cavern-Heaven Demon Maidens and Ghost-Mothers, along with the Celestial Wolf and the Greedy Dog, devour their essence, severing their lineage. To conceive a child, they must set up a Northern Dipper lamp altar in their chamber, follow a master in practicing the Dao, burn incense, scatter flowers, recite my divine incantation ten thousand times, and offer morning jiao rites to the Northern Dipper. Then, the Twelve Jade Maidens of the Azure Waist shall descend to guard their womb, fulfilling their wish for offspring—children of exceptional appearance, intelligence, and longevity, whether male or female.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan purify their bodies and minds, reciting this incantation seven times or up to a hundred daily, whether in motion or at rest, morning or evening, all their endeavors shall succeed. Even in gambling or seeking profit, or when meeting nobles and rulers, they shall always find joy, their wishes harmonized.

The Northern Thearch said: Should the five grains sown in the fields of the Lower Yuan be ravaged by locusts or other disasters, they must erect an altar in the field and recite the incantation seven or forty-nine times in accordance with the ritual statutes. I shall command the Earth Lords of the Nine Provinces and the Earth Thearch to enforce a three-day prohibition, and all pestilent insects shall vanish of their own accord.

The Northern Thearch said: These are the Six Demon Kings of the Six Cavern-Heavens, who perpetrate six harms upon those born in the Lower Yuan. The First Palace harms wealth, causing depletion and dissipation. The Second Palace harms life, obstructing success and causing official rank to decline. The Third Palace harms rank and emolument, blocking all four directions. The Fourth Palace harms fields, dwellings, and households, bringing frequent deaths, disasters, and spectral disturbances, rendering habitation unstable. The Fifth Palace harms wives and concubines, causing repeated deaths, from one to seven. The Sixth Palace harms children, preventing their birth or causing illness and extinction. These six harms are perpetrated by the demonic spirits of the Six Heavens, who conspire with the Six Bureaus of the Caverns to obstruct and afflict mortals. Those of resolve who wish to eliminate them must do so in a pure wilderness or a quiet chamber of an ancient altar, erecting an altar and practicing the Dao according to the ritual statutes for three, seven, or up to forty-nine days. They must submit a memorial, called the "Six Harms Memorial Jiao," to the Six Jia Spirits, the Five Planets, the Twenty-Eight Constellations, and the Palaces of the Sun and Moon. They must also wear the Great Register for Dissolving the Six Harms of the Three and Five. Then, the One Hundred Twenty Jade Lads of the Nine Palaces shall descend, along with the Great Generals for Dissolving Harms, the great spirits within the Northern Dipper, and the hosts of Tianpeng. They shall traverse the Six Yin Palaces of the Caverns, investigating and resolving each source of harm, permanently severing the calamities so they no longer entangle mortals.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan be conscripted by kings or nobles for battle, they must wear the Great Register of the Nine Palaces for Warding Off the Six Palaces and Averting Corpses, offer sacrifices to the Seven Primordial Lords of the Northern Dipper, and inscribe this incantation within the register, wearing it on the left arm. When facing the enemy in battle, they must silently recite the divine incantation seven times. Then, the Demon Kings of the Six Heavens, the Great General Tianpeng, the Envoys of the Northern Dipper, and the Great Generals of the Three Primordials shall secretly protect them, preventing injury and ensuring safety, forever averting the misfortune of violent death.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan face harm from evil persons, they must visualize the malefactor beneath their left foot and recite this incantation one hundred thirty times. The evil person shall then turn misfortune into fortune.

The Northern Thearch said: Those born in the Lower Yuan who know the names of the Six Heavenly Offices of Fengdu shall find that the hundred ghosts dare not harm them. Whenever one wishes to sleep, one must first face north, click the teeth seven times, and recite the incantation thrice in a soft voice, saying:

I am a minister of the Thearch,
my name inscribed in Jade Purity,
governing the Six Heavens below.
The ghostly palaces of the Northern Thearch
are all within my command.
Of those under my jurisdiction,
what ghost dare arise?
On my left hangs the *huoluo* blade,
on my right the fire-bell.
I hurl fire ten thousand leagues,
my might subduing the thousand spirits.
Those who offend shall be slain,
those who trespass shall be punished.
By the Thearch’s decree,
their capture shall not cease.
Heavenly light shakes in terror,
the host of demons takes flight to the east.
Ghosts and demons are annihilated,
and I attain long life.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Thearch’s decree and ordinance command.

According to the *Heavenly Pass Three Charts, Highest Clarity Scripture*: Mount Fengdu lies in the north, in the *gui* region, thus the northeast is the Ghost Gate, the root of dead *qi*. The mountain rises two thousand six hundred *li* high, with a circumference of thirty thousand *li*. Its cavern-palaces lie beneath the mountain, with a circumference of fifteen thousand *li*. Above and below, there are ghostly and divine halls. Atop the mountain are twelve palaces governing ghosts, and below are twelve palaces ruling spirits. Each palace spans a thousand *li* in circumference. Above, six palaces lie to the left and six to the right; below, six lie to the left and six to the right—thus twenty-four palaces in all.

The names of the upper six palaces are:
1. The Palace of Zhou’s Absolute Yin
2. The Palace of Tai’s Punitive Judgment
3. The Palace of Bright Dawn’s Enduring Offense
4. The Palace of Serene Illumination’s Sinful *Qi*
5. The Palace of Ancestral Numinosity’s Seven Transgressions
6. The Palace of Daring Governance’s Boundless Connections

The names of the lower six palaces are:
1. The Palace of Restful Clarity’s General Numinosity
2. The Palace of Mysterious Governance’s Weighty Rectitude
3. The Palace of Uniting Immortals’ Ascendant Subtlety
4. The Palace of Upright Perfection’s Lingering Governance
5. The Palace of Cloudy Storehouses’ Jade Records
6. The Palace of Lofty Emptiness’ Crimson Radiance

Reciting this incantation once shall first strike terror into heaven and earth, binding the myriad demons. Reciting it twice shall annihilate ghosts and demons, severing the dead names of the Six Heavens. Those who study the Dao yet do not know the names of the Fengdu palaces—the domains of gods and ghosts—shall be unable to cut off the root of death, rendering all later learners incapable of success.

The Northern Thearch said: Those born in the Lower Yuan, whether man or woman, when traveling at night or lying down to sleep, who recite the names of the Six Heavenly Palaces shall cause all ghostly demons to hear and dissolve into bloody pulp. They must not recite loudly, for this harms ghosts all the more. If one recites the incantation without affliction, one must first make a vow: "I recite the names of the Six Heavenly Gates to pacify the hun and settle the po, without harming the netherworld." This incantation reads:

Zhou’s Absolute marks the Thearch’s dawn,
Judgment’s weight constructs the second.
Flaming as clouds in the sky,
bursting like radiant splendor.
A divine peak at Martial City,
Serene Illumination swallows the Azure River.
The Gate of Heaven looms over the Cinnabar Well,
Cloud Gate rises in towering majesty.
Seven Transgressions link the wondrous canopy,
Boundless Connections spread their demonic sway.
The Six Heavens cross the northern path—
this is the home of gods and ghosts.

Expel the Poisonous Tiger King,
the Six Heavenly Ghost Kings,
the Thunderclap and Gathered Bells,
the Northern Thearch’s Demon Kings,
the Four Heavenly Luminaries,
the Fengdu Ghost Ministers,
Ba Yuan’s Ugly Earl,
the Nine Heavens’ Registers—
all great demons under my command,
dare you not obey?

The Northern Thearch said: This incantation I have spoken is called the Northern Thearch’s Divine Incantation, for it crushes and devours the ghostly gods of the Six Heavens. Those born in the Lower Yuan—whether old or young, man or woman, poor or humble—who recite this divine incantation while walking, sitting, or resting shall find all their desires fulfilled. All demonic ghosts shall retreat and disperse, and one’s spirit and *qi* shall flourish. With single-minded resolve and steadfastness, all obstacles shall be removed, and all one seeks shall align with the Dao.

The Northern Black Thearch’s Five Numinous Mysterious Elder Divine Incantation—whenever one holds and recites it, first visualize the Heavenly Peng Divine General: four-faced, six-armed, each hand wielding a halberd, sword, bow and arrow, golden spear, *yinmou*, and halberd, his body fifty *zhang* in height, clad in golden spear armor, radiant for ten thousand *li*, his roar shaking the earth. Leading a divine host of three hundred thousand, clad in black robes and dark crowns, they descend to suppress and extinguish evil spirits. Strike the left teeth thirty-six times, then the right teeth thirty-six times, then sound the Heavenly Drum twenty-four times. Then turn to face north, sit facing the *Wang* direction to break the earth, and softly intone the incantation:

Heavenly Peng, Heavenly Peng,
these are the four-faced heavenly soldiers,
each leading forty thousand men,
their voices like the roar of tigers.
Nine Mysteries Slaying Youth—
this is the Shangqing Yu Yu Heaven Great Crimson Heaven’s method,
the Shangqing Three Caverns method’s Three Heavenly Soldiers talisman,
commanding the Heaven-Slaying Great Gods of a hundred million myriad worlds.
Five Ding Commanders—
these are the Six Ding divine maidens at the Three Heavenly Gates,
reciting aloud, with thirty-six bureaus each dispatching sixty thousand to slay swiftly.
Northern Thearch’s Three Slaying Divine Soldiers, one hundred ten thousand strong.
High Di, Northern Gong—
these are the Northern Thearch’s Three Slaying Divine Soldiers in the Northern Thearch’s One Cavern Heaven, one hundred ten thousand strong.
Seven Governances, Eight Numinous Ones—
these are the Northern Thearch’s Seven Stars Perfected, seven thousand four hundred,
ever at the master’s left and right, listening to good and evil.
Supreme Lord Vast Ferocity—
these are the Three Generals of the Supreme Lord, thirty million strong,
standing before the master’s presence to dispel and scatter evil spirits.
Long-Skulled Mighty Beasts—
these are the Four Seas Dragon Kings, four thousand four hundred,
seizing and capturing mountain spirits and wild ghosts to execute them.
Hand Grasping the Thearch’s Bell—
these are the Five Marchmounts, Four Streams, rivers, and seas’ great gods,
each with fifty thousand, employed in altar rites and purification fasts.
Three Pale Owl Gods, Sternly Mounting Kui Dragons—
these are the Three Heavenly Demon Kings, with three thousand troops,
ever in the human realm, listening in the void to human good and evil.
When in the purification hall doubts arise, visualize these gods to stabilize the place.
Mighty Sword Divine King, Slaying Evil and Erasing Traces—
these are the Wind Gods and Sea Lords, each with eight thousand,
to be visualized when praying for rain.
Purple Qi Riding the Heavens—
these are the Marshal Kings of the Hosts of Demons,
commanding the slaying of evil in this world’s people; recite in a low voice.
Cinnabar Clouds Blazing Surge—
these are the Dark Capital’s Great Gods of the Jade Purity Edict,
a hundred million myriad strong, visualized in spirit-official petitions, ever at one’s side.
Devouring Demons and Feeding on Ghosts, Body Bared to Drink the Wind—
these are the twenty-four heavenly ghost gods,
ever seizing the false to execute them; visualize when summoning.
To cure illnesses, epidemics, public and private disputes, visualize these—sixty thousand strong.
Green-Tongued, Green-Teethed, Four-Eyed Elder—
these are the Kings of the Sun, Moon, and Stars, each with eight thousand,
to be visualized when moving mountains and damming seas.
Heavenly Ding Warriors, Ferocious Southward Guardians—
Heavenly Couriers, Fierce Northward Chargers—
these are the generals of the Shangqing method, each with one thousand two hundred,
ever following when the master recites scriptures; visualize them.
Three hundred thousand soldiers, guarding my ninefold layers,
warding off corpses for a thousand *li*, dispelling misfortune.
These are the Six Ding and Eight Scribes Great Gods, each with eighty-five thousand,
visualized when reciting scriptures and transmitting talismans.
Dare any petty ghost approach to witness this?
Cauldron of Heaven’s Great Axe, slaying the five forms of ghosts—
these are the Three Caverns Heavenly Officials of the Five Thearchs’ troops, thirty million strong,
ever at the master’s left and right; visualize when cultivating the Real.
Blazing Thearch Splitting Blood, Northern Thearch Burning Bones—
Four Luminaries Shattering Skeletons, Heavenly Plan Annihilating Species—
these are the Four Luminaries’ Merit Officers, three thousand six hundred,
ever at the master’s side, listening to good and evil.
One must always visualize good deeds, never harbor evil thoughts.
With one stroke of the divine blade, ten thousand ghosts scatter—
this is the Northern Thearch’s Black Slaying Great Divine King; visualize to slay ghosts.
In the void, all hear the cries of ghosts.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Supreme Venerable Lord’s ordinance commands.

These thirty-six lines, four characters each, are recited with one strike of the teeth.

The Northern Thearch said: Recite my divine incantation, practice my Way, and uphold my precepts and prohibitions. I shall command the Thirty Cavern Lords of the North, the Heavenly Peng Great General, the Ten Poles and Eight Sceneries’ Great Flying Divine Beasts, and hidden ferocious beasts, never leaving the living, encircling and guarding them, so that all attachments and desires encounter no obstacles. Recite this incantation either seven times, or up to forty-nine times, or one hundred twenty times, then strike the teeth, sound the Heavenly Drum, and strike the Heavenly Chime, each thirty-six times. Then recite this subsequent incantation three or seven times before retiring; there is no harm in doing so outside. This is called the Heaven and Earth Purification Incantation. For any defilement in one’s dwelling, constantly recite the Defilement-Dispelling, Corpse-Averting Incantation:

As the scripture states, strike the teeth so that inner and outer are emptied and resonant, as if heard by the ear.
Within the Cavern’s Mysterious Void, radiant and vast is the Great Primordial.
The mighty gods of the eight directions make me natural.

The Numinous Treasure Talisman’s Decree universally proclaims to the Nine Heavens:
*Qianluo Danna*, penetrating the Firmament’s Great Mystery.
Severing demons, binding evil, slaying ten thousand ghosts.
The Central Mountain’s divine incantation, the Primordial Jade Scripture’s text.
I recite it once, and demons retreat while years extend.
Traversing the Five Peaks, the Eight Seas take heed.
Demon kings submit, guarding my chamber.
Malevolence and defilement disperse, the Dao’s qi eternally abides.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance.

The Dao states: This incantation is the Northern Emperor’s esoteric method. Should one in the world obtain it and constantly practice it, one may subdue all evils, augment fortune and lifespan, prolong years and avert calamities, dispel disasters and repel misfortunes, protect the living, and prevent unjust harm. Both men and women, young and old, may all uphold it.

Master Tao of the Pottery said: Long ago, when I studied the Dao at Tiantai but had not yet attained accomplishment, I was constantly harassed by mountain ghosts—appearing in bodily form, unclothed, startling and terrifying me. Though I had often heard of this Dao, I had never practiced it. After observing the precepts and practicing for seven days, I walked through my dwelling’s surroundings, and a hundred paces beyond the chamber, I saw blood flowing across the ground, the stench of corpses and foul odors filling the valley. I heard the sound of weeping, its words piteous and sorrowful.

They cried out: "Tao Hongjing, Tao Hongjing, you have seized our dwelling and harmed our lives!" Thereafter, they never again raised their voices in such clamor. With prolonged recitation, one may wander in the company of the hundred spirits, and long life may be attained.

Master Wang the Perfected said: My former teacher, Celestial Master Zhang, by the command of the Most High, battled to seize the twenty-four demonic encampments of Shu Prefecture, rescuing and protecting the living. In a single battle against the great demonic chieftains of the twenty-four encampments, he subdued them all at once, confining their underlings and officers beneath the encampments. Now they have become the twenty-four mountain prisons for demons, utterly unable to escape. All this was achieved by the Most High’s transmission of this Divine Incantation of the Northern Emperor. When my teacher confronted the demons with a single recitation, the celestial soldiers and the three to five great generals of the Tianpeng host descended at once. None failed to submit—this is the ninth stellar spirit of Tianpeng.

Zheng Siyuan said: I once heard that the Northern Flower Immortal of the Most High taught this Dao to novice Daoists, instructing them to recite it ten thousand times. First, it extinguishes inauspicious specters and malevolent spirits, and the true Dao is immediately revealed. I longed for this but could not obtain it. Later, on Eastern Flower Mountain, I encountered the Left Immortal Elder, who said to me: "If you wish to receive the talismanic charts and divine incantations of the Great Emperor of Mount Fengdu in the Northern Feng, to perform rituals, dispel evil, and expel demons, thereby attaining the Dao of cultivating truth, you must offer silk, incense, and oil as a pledge of sincerity. Only then will I transmit this to you—this is the Dao of the Primordial Lady of the Great Simplicity, the Mysterious Mother. It must not be recklessly passed to deluded and disordered men, or to those who are but walking corpses and wandering bones. If one fails to revere it, calamity will extend to one’s ancestors." I received it and thereby beheld the true Dao.

These subtle and secret matters are not fully recorded here. Many derive from the *Upper Clarity Jade Emperor’s Scripture of Divine Wisdom for Dispelling Demons and Concealing the Jade Clarity*. The rituals and methods follow those in the lower scroll.

The Northern Flower Immortal said to Zheng Siyuan: "Whenever reciting this divine incantation, one must tap the teeth once for each phrase as a regular practice—this is the ritual for cultivating truth. If reciting it day and night without pause, the tapping of teeth may be omitted. Should a living person encounter demonic affliction, sit upright according to the method and follow the four-syllable rhythm for tapping the teeth. Alternatively, first tap the teeth seven times, then recite the incantation three times. Tap the teeth seven times again, recite it three more times, and once more tap the teeth seven times. Then state the wish in your heart, and the demonic spirits causing harm will all go blind, their eyes fester, and they will die. This divine incantation comprises the names of the demon-slaying offices, the secret words of the Northern Emperor. If one masters this method and practices it regularly, abstaining from meat, impure foods, and miscellaneous indulgences, one may repel all evils, increase blessings and longevity, prolong life and avert calamities, dispel disasters and ward off misfortune, and protect the living from untimely harm.

As the scripture states: When tapping the teeth, the sound should resonate internally, clear enough to be heard by the ear."

The Heavenly Worthy said to the Northern Flower Immortal: "In recitation, one must purify the heart and focus the mind, avoiding all杂事 and heterodox methods. Do not share the same chamber, for these are guarded by the malevolent spirits of the Six Heavens. If worldly people treat this as mere casual recitation or entertainment, failing to revere it with devotion and slighting the true words, the Heavenly Venerable of the North will be enraged, and boundless calamities will follow. Be cautious and reverent."

At that time, the assembly of celestial sages and great worthies, upon hearing this scripture’s method of salvation and protection, all rejoiced and leapt for joy. They awakened the supreme Dao-mind, advanced in rank by natural progression, and, bearing the majestic power of the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Original Beginning, bowed their heads in reverence and pledged to uphold it.

Thus concludes the *First Scroll of the Wondrous Scripture of the Northern Emperor’s Demon-Subduing Incantation, Spoken by the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Original Beginning*.

**Second Scroll of the Wondrous Scripture of the Northern Emperor’s Demon-Subduing Incantation, Spoken by the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Original Beginning: The Secret Teachings of the Seven Primes**

At that time, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy journeyed through the celestial realms, establishing domains and delivering the people, broadly proclaiming the wondrous Dao. Observing the mortals of the Lower Realm beset by calamities, demonic influences, and malevolent qi, with the Nine Uglies’ spirits unjustly harming the good and virtuous, he reflected: "The Three Realms turn like a wheel, with grievances and enmities multiplying endlessly. Lands are unsettled, and warfare arises—how may salvation be brought to protect the multitudes?"

Thereupon, he summoned the Perfected Lord of the Northern Emperor and expounded the method of deliverance. The Northern Emperor replied: "By the decree of Fengdu, I subdue ghosts and dispel demons through the altar of the Seven Primes, safeguarding households and pacifying nations. As the Great Sage commands, I shall descend with true numinosity."

Hearing the Northern Emperor’s secret and essential response, the Heavenly Worthy assented and pledged to uphold it. The Northern Emperor declared: "This incantation is most wondrous. One should maintain a prolonged fast and recite it diligently to attain longevity and ascend through the void."

The Northern Emperor’s Incantation of Division-Body states:
I solemnly command the five true officials within my body:
My *hun*-soul is the Heavenly Father,
My *po*-soul is the Earthly Mother,
My head is Lord Thunder,
My hair is black clouds,
My crown is the Bright Star,
My brain is the Vermilion Bird,
My eyebrows are the Qilin,
My eyes are the sun and moon,
My nose is the Mighty Tiger,
My upper lip is the Earl of Wind,
My lower lip is the Master of Rain,
My tongue is the Governor of the Nine Provinces,
My throat is the Jade Armillary,
My left arm is the Jade Balance that repels foes,
My right arm is the Jade Balance that shatters enemies,
My palms are fire chariots,
My fingers are armored soldiers,
My two breasts are immortal youths,
My skull is Mount Heng,
My spine is Mount Peng,
My ribs are the famed mountains,
My belly is a golden fortress,
My liver is the Azure Emperor,
My kidneys are the Black Emperor,
My spleen is the Yellow Emperor,
My heart is the Crimson Emperor,
My lungs are the White Emperor,
My gallbladder is the Great One,
My intestines are dragons and tigers,
My armpits are forbidden prisons,
My navel is the rivers and lakes,
My testicles are the Weaving Maiden,
My bladder is the River Earl,
My blood is river water,
My vessels are the Flying Serpents,
My stomach is the Curved Array,
My skin is the Heavenly Net,
My flesh is the Earthly Web,
My buttocks are *zhūn* (sound),
My yin is the Eight Barbarians,
My thighs are the Twin Lads,
My knees are *kūn* (sound),
My shins are lions,
My feet are white horses,
My hands are the Three Generals,
Each leading seventy million troops.
The soldiers draw blades and unsheathe swords,
Mounting fire chariots to emerge from my body.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

This incantation subdues all ghosts and spirits.
For madness or possession, recite it thrice.
For minor afflictions, do not recite it, lest it harm the child’s *hun* and *po*.
Beware.

The Celestial Canopy Incantation for Entering the Chamber and Dispelling Illness:
Hark! I am the son of the Celestial Thearch and the Most High,
Sent by the Venerable Lord.
My head bears the sun and moon,
My body is girded with the Northern Dipper.

I command the celestial troops of the Qian spirit, a hundred million strong, arrayed at my left and right. Before me boil cauldrons of ten thousand *shi*, behind me gleam axes of yellow gold. I attend upon the Most High when suddenly divine generals appear, teaching me the method to slay ghosts and bestowing upon me the formula to behead spirits. I bear the Great Simplicity talisman upon my person, gathering and seizing all inauspicious forces. I proclaim to the Celestial Thearch, summoning the officers and soldiers. My head wears the flowered canopy, my feet tread upon the *kuigang*. What spirit does not flee? What ghost dares stand before me? Bound, you shall surely be; punished, your wanton harm shall cease.

The afflicted bear no guilt—how dare you rashly assail the worthy and good? I contain the upright *qi* of Heaven and Earth; my incantation shatters the misfortune of wayward ghosts. When I incant against spirits, spirits self-destruct; when I incant against ghosts, ghosts perish of themselves. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

Upon completion, hold water in the mouth and spray the afflicted.

Then recite again:
Eastern wayward spirits, southern wayward spirits, western wayward spirits, northern wayward spirits, central wayward spirits—hark! You are the fish of *yangli*, or the floating duckweed’s grass, or the worm steeped in stagnant waters: soft-shelled turtles, alligators, tortoises, stingrays, eels, and carp. You are the essence of trees and wood, demons and specters, *wangliang*. Assuming human form, you cling to bodies, bewitching men and women. The Northern Thearch hears of this and flies into a great rage. Thus he dispatches me, leading generals, a thousand troops and ten thousand cavalry, to slay you, the hundred wayward ghosts—why do you not flee at once? Swiftly, swiftly, by the might of the Northern Thearch’s sacred sword and the divine king’s statutes and ordinances!

Upon completion, hold water in the mouth and spray the afflicted thrice.

Then recite again:
I am the son of the Celestial Master’s divine *qi* and the Most High, roaming the world. If illness arises in the East, I can cure it. If illness arises in the South, I can cure it. If illness arises in the West, I can cure it. If illness arises in the North, I can cure it. If illness arises in the Center, I can cure it. I possess the method to cure illness and the formula to heal it. My head wears the crown that pierces the heavens, my body is clad in the robes of the Vermilion Sun. In my hands I grasp the dragon-headed jade-cutting sword, beheading ghostly bandits by the thousands, regardless of their crimes. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

Spray water thrice, then proceed to the five directions. With seven steps and the Seven Primes’ *gang*, face and turn to shatter and establish, reciting the Celestial Canopy Incantation. With a single breath, recite it thrice. For every four words, click the teeth once—this is the method of the art. It subdues all wayward ghosts. Ordinarily, do not click the teeth, lest it harm the spirits. Upon completion, form the palm seal. After sealing, recite:

Hark! Radiant essence, central king, your might shakes the Nine Heavens. Golden tigers obscure the sun, flying dragons coil about Qian. The Yellow Spirit wields the battle-axe, Green Teeth brandishes the whip. The *jihen* balances the Five Dipper stars, the Seven Primes are harmonized. The Nine Shameful Ones are captured, the Six Heavens are annihilated. In my hands I hold the Three Luminaries, my feet tread upon the Nine Mysteries. The Eight Awesomenesses spew venom, the Celestial Soldiers lead the way. I hunt and examine demonic essences, dispatching them to the Crooked Springs. The Ten Heavens protect the state, the myriad companions are secure.

Then recite again:
Heavenly fire falls in torrents, its light illuminating the eight directions. The *Nüqing* ghostly statutes execute and behead wayward misfortune. I now restrain you—what demonic ghost dares stand before me? Depart swiftly, swiftly! Submit, ghostly *kuigang*. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

Next, the incantation to command the five directions:

**East:**
I rebuke the ghost of the East, essence of rotting wood. The old *qi* of the Nine Yi, born of spring’s transformation. The spirit fails to nurture within and manifests as wayward essence without. The *qi* of the Five Poisons enters the human form, causing alternating chills and fever, the whole body restless. The Nine Shameful ghosts know your name. The Northern Thearch’s divine incantation captures and records your essence. The Four Luminaries shatter your bones, the Northern Dipper blazes bright. With a single stroke of the divine blade, the ten thousand ghosts punish themselves. Chills and headaches, feverish pains—you shall not recklessly arise. The metal *qi* of the West extinguishes your form. Subdued within the liver, you shall not stir or topple. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

**South:**
Red ghost of the South, essence of scorching fire. The old *qi* of the Eight Barbarians, born of summer’s transformation. The spirit fails to nurture within and manifests as wayward essence without. The *qi* of the Five Poisons enters the human form, causing alternating chills and fever, the whole body restless. The Nine Shameful ghosts know your name. The Northern Thearch’s divine incantation captures and records your essence. The Four Luminaries shatter your bones, the Northern Dipper blazes bright. With a single stroke of the divine blade, the ten thousand ghosts punish themselves. Chills and headaches, feverish pains—you shall not recklessly arise. The fire *qi* of the South extinguishes your form. Subdued within the lungs, you shall not stir or topple. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

**West:**
White ghost of the West, essence of dead metal. The old *qi* of the Six Rong, born of autumn’s transformation. The spirit fails to nurture within and manifests as wayward essence without. The *qi* of the Five Poisons enters the human form, causing alternating chills and fever, the whole body restless. The Nine Shameful ghosts know your name. The Northern Thearch’s divine incantation captures and records your essence. The Four Luminaries shatter your bones, the Northern Dipper blazes bright. With a single stroke of the divine blade, the ten thousand ghosts punish themselves. Chills and headaches, feverish pains—you shall not recklessly arise. The fire *qi* of the South extinguishes your form. Subdued within the lungs, you shall not stir or topple. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

**North:**
Black ghost of the North, essence of yin water. The *qi* of the Five Di, born of winter’s transformation. The spirit fails to nurture within and manifests as wayward essence without. The *qi* of the Five Poisons enters the human form, causing alternating chills and fever, the whole body restless. The Nine Shameful ghosts know your name. The Northern Thearch’s divine incantation captures and records your essence. The Four Luminaries shatter your bones, the Northern Dipper blazes bright. With a single stroke of the divine blade, the ten thousand ghosts punish themselves. Chills and headaches, feverish pains—you shall not recklessly arise. The earth *qi* of the Center extinguishes your form. Subdued within the kidneys, you shall not stir or topple. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

Yellow ghost of the Center, essence of dung and earth. Born of the four seasons and eight solar terms through the transformations of the kingly *qi*. The spirit fails to nurture within and manifests as wayward essence without. The *qi* of the Five Poisons enters the human form.

Chills and fever wrack the body, leaving no peace. The Nine Ugly Ghosts know your name. The Northern Thearch’s divine incantation captures and records your essence. The Four Luminaries shatter your bones, the Northern Dipper blazes bright. With a single stroke of the divine blade, the ten thousand ghosts punish themselves. Chills and headaches, feverish pains—you shall not recklessly arise. The wood *qi* of the East extinguishes your form. Subdued within the spleen, you shall not stir or topple. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

Once the Rite of Slaying Pestilence is complete, first recite the Heavenly Peng’s upper incantation. When daily practice is fulfilled on the *jiazi* day, wear the Great Register and establish the Seven Primes Altar. First recite my command to the Five Marchmounts’ Water Incantation:

I am a minister of the Most High, my name inscribed in Jade Clarity, supreme over the Six Heavens. The Northern Thearch’s Ghostly Palace is entirely my domain. All under my command—what ghost dares arise? On my left hangs the *huoluo* blade, on my right the Fire Bell. Casting fire ten thousand leagues, my might subdues a thousand spirits. Those who offend are slain, those who resist are punished. The Imperial Lord commands: seize and capture without cease. Heavenly light and thunderous roars—move, and the myriad evils bind themselves. Ghosts and demons perish utterly; I attain long life. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

The Imperial Lord says: Upon finishing the incantation, immediately recite my summons to the Ten Heavenly Demon Kings, the Eight Radiant Great Spirits, the Thirty-Six Grotto-Heavens’ Mighty Powers, the Heavenly *Ding* Warriors, the Generals of the Three-Five Forbidden *Qi*, the Guardians of the Numinous, and the Flying Thunderbolt Cavalry Incantation:

Beasts of the Poisonous Heavens, guard the four gates. Divine soldiers by the myriad, the Nine Ugly by the ten thousand. Throats gape to split the sky, fierce steeds gallop high. Poisonous dragons brandish claws, golden heads devour sideways. Mighty warriors by the countless thousands receive the talisman and examine the immortals. The Six Heavens unrestrained, banding malevolence into hordes. Demons, goblins, and specters—foul *qi* swirls in chaos. Hollow songs echo, incense clouds scatter in disarray. Lesser ghosts assume false forms, blocking the Gate of Human Life. What the Divine Kings proclaim, none fail to hear. Above, they seize the Six *Qi*; below, they inspect the river sources. The Five Marchmounts and Four Waterways swiftly distinguish good from evil. By the thousands, by the ten thousands, come before me. The Five Thearchs record merits—those with merit are pardoned. Malevolent demons and spirits are bound and lashed. Dare disobey, and none escape execution. Livers are hacked, gall crushed, heads severed, forms annihilated. Northward, the *jue* cleaves the clear broth; southward, fire burns at Nanshan. The Golden Perfected slays *qi*, the Flowing Bell captures souls. No demonic essence remains; all evil sources are swept away. Bearing the Heavenly Script, the Dao’s true writ is followed. The Nine *Qi* are cleansed, the Three Primes made clear. The Mysterious Numinous ascends in truth, uniting with the natural. None dare test me—after the slaying, report to Heaven. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

The Northern Thearch says: After reciting the Southern Guardian Incantation, then recite the Altar-Binding Incantation:

The Vermilion Bird’s radiance presses inward, divine might expands within. The four mountain sources are guarded; ghostly wells flee in terror. The spirit pool exhales *qi*, evil essences hide within. The Soul Terrace’s Four Luminaries, the jade doors gleam. The Jade Perfected stands majestic, seated to guard the Hall of Light. Hands wield the purple aurora, head crowned with divine radiance. Reciting the Grotto Scriptures, thirty-nine chapters. Within lies the demon-expelling, dragon-tiger slaying *gang*. Fierce beasts and charging oxen, blades in jaws, swallowing metal. Uplifting mountains, cauldrons overturning the sky, divine birds and poisonous dragons. Six jaws spew fire, devouring the King of Ghosts. Lightning boars and thunder fathers, dragging stars in streaks. Owls and blazing hybrids, moving crosswind. Heavenly birds arrayed in formation, all beside me. Spewing fire ten thousand fathoms to dispel misfortune. Spirits open the Dao, sealing and casting into mountain villages. A thousand spirits, ten thousand numina, all bow with clasped hands. Marsh wardens hold censers, burning incense for me. Wherever I go, the myriad spirits welcome. Heavenly beasts come to guard, a thousand essences tremble and submit—none dare disturb my *qi*. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

Exit the chamber and stand again.

**Talisman for Eradicating Locust Plagues in the Realm**
The Northern Thearch says: If a state, prefecture, or county suffers a locust plague, causing the people distress and preventing them from their livelihood, simply establish a Seven Primes Altar before the northern gate of the prefecture. Perform the Dao and cast my two spirit talismans. One talisman, inscribed on raw iron, is thrown into the prefecture’s river, where it transforms into black *qi* piercing the sky, and sweet dew descends. Another talisman, inscribed on catalpa wood with realgar, is buried in the Earth God’s temple, one foot two inches deep—then the locusts will instantly perish.

Then the Seven Perfected shall descend, spirit generals shall secretly assist, and every wish shall be fulfilled without fail.

If one receives and upholds this method with an impure heart or insincere devotion, they waste gold and jade in vain, and no divine efficacy shall manifest.

The **Northern Emperor** declares:
I dispatch the Six Ding officers and generals to seize and execute ghosts and spirits, driving away demonic fiends. Those born in the Lower Yuan who seek to learn but have not yet attained my supreme Dao must first employ talismans and seals to subdue external demons and cure all illnesses. Summon the officials of the Fengdu Ghost Register to advance their immortal ranks, their names inscribed on jade slips. Beware of recklessly transmitting this to the unworthy, lest the seven generations of ancestors in Fengdu be seized and tormented, and the living have their lifespan stolen.

At that time, the Four Directional Emperor Lords, hearing the Northern Emperor expound the divine incantations, talismans, seals, and secret methods for subduing demons, praised the Five Numinous Emperor Lords—whose divine power is subtle and wondrous, beyond comprehension. The great assembly paid reverence, the Six Heavens trembled, and the teachings were entrusted to true disciples.

**The Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s Scripture on the Northern Emperor’s Subduing Demons Divine Incantation, Wondrous Scroll Three, concludes.**

**The Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s Scripture on the Northern Emperor’s Subduing Demons Divine Incantation, Wondrous Scroll Four: The Chapter on Warding Off Calamities**

At that time, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy was in the Fragrant Grove Garden, expounding the Dharma and reciting the precepts to the assembly of heavenly youths. When the discourse concluded, the Most High Dao Lord approached, bowed, and addressed the Heavenly Worthy:
Today, seated in attendance, I have heard the twenty-four articles of the luminous true precepts, the karmic retribution of good and evil, and my heart rejoices, my mind is liberated, with no lingering obstructions. Moreover, I have been graciously instructed on the karmic connections of sin and fortune, the Dharma of deliverance through purification rites, and the salvation of suffering souls in the long night, ascending to the Hall of Blessings where clothing and sustenance arise naturally. This Dharma is vast and universal; the deceased all rely upon it.

Yet, the men and women of this world and the next, who have not encountered the scriptures and precepts, are weak in *qi* and strength, unable to uphold them, and thus lack means to ward off calamities. Many are harmed by worldly malevolent ghosts and demons, their lives cut short, failing to complete their natural lifespan. Since the Heavenly Worthy has opened the transformation of great compassion, benefiting both the living and the dead, the living and the deceased alike bear this grace. I humbly beseech your mercy to further reveal the methods for men and women of future generations to protect their bodies and preserve their lives, that they may escape calamities. In this world, they face the Three Disasters and Nine Adversities, the Five Pestilences and Seven Afflictions, the *qi* of illnesses and epidemics, and the perils of myriad demons and specters. May their lives be preserved, free from harm. If your compassion is moved, I shall reverently receive this sacred grace.

Then, the Heavenly Worthy rejoiced and replied: "Excellent, excellent! What you have requested is indeed of utmost importance. I now take pity on all beings as parents cherish their children. I shall now speak for you—listen carefully, hold fast to these words in your heart, and never forget my teaching."

At that moment, the assembly of sages rejoiced and, with single-minded devotion, prostrated in reverence.

The Heavenly Worthy declared: "In the distant past, the people were simple and honest. They suffered no harm, their lifespans unfolding as destined. They fulfilled their natural years without premature death, and no ghosts inflicted wanton injury. But now, in this degenerate age of shallowness, the human heart is corrupted. The five emotions are in turmoil, giving rise to doubt and confusion. Deeds lack sincerity, and only perverse conduct is pursued. They turn from truth to embrace falsehood, forsaking righteousness and benevolence. They defy Heaven and rebel against Earth, severing roots and felling trunks. They are neither loyal nor filial, devoid of love and compassion. They deceive the multitudes and tyrannize the common folk. They slaughter living beings and destroy the lives of creatures, accumulating boundless transgressions and karmic enmity.

Thus, in this present life, calamities arise at every turn. Some are slain by bandits, others destroyed by malevolent ghosts. Some are harmed by venomous snakes, tigers, wolves, or the stings of poisonous insects. Official and private disputes arise without cause, leading to imprisonment, flogging, or exile. Families may be struck by pestilence, bodies afflicted by toxic *qi*, great and small illnesses, or the death of kin, severing the six relations.

All such sufferings arise from the *qi* of the Six Heavens. The King of the Northern Feng, the Eight Divisions of Ghostly Masters, the Generals of the Dead in the human realm, and the Spirits of the Five Weapons roam the world, seizing upon transgressions to unleash their toxic *qi* and slay the wicked. Year after year, month after month, countless suffer these fates, entangled in one another’s doom, leading to death. The surviving people cannot escape such agonies—how grievous and pitiable!"

Here now is the Northern Emperor’s Fearless Divine Incantation, together with the names of the Six Palaces. Should you place faith in it and recite it with single-minded devotion, you shall surely escape all calamities, remain free of affliction throughout your life, and obtain blessings such as these.

The incantation reads:
I am a disciple of the Most High, ruling below over the Six Heavens.
The Six Heavenly Palaces are my domain—
not only my domain, but the charge of the Most High.
I know the names of the Six Heavenly Palaces, and thus I attain long life.
Should any dare transgress, the Most High shall strike them down.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

First: the Palace of Zhòu-Jué-Yīn.
Second: the Palace of Tài-Shā-Liàng-Shì-Zōng.
Third: the Palace of Míng-Chén-Nài-Fàn-Wǔ-Chéng.
Fourth: the Palace of Tián-Zhào-Zuì-Qì.
Fifth: the Palace of Zōng-Líng-Qī-Fēi.
Sixth: the Palace of Gǎn-Sī-Lián-Wǎn-Lǚ.

The Northern Emperor declares: He who knows the names of the Fengdu Ghost-Kings and the Six Palaces shall command the submission of all hundred ghosts.
When facing outward, focus your mind and silently invoke them.
Upon hearing this, demonic spirits shall all dissolve into blood.

First face north, lower your voice—do not speak loudly—and recite:
Hū! My head bears the Vermilion Bird, my feet tread the Dark Warrior.
To my left, the Azure Dragon lends support; to my right, the White Tiger crouches.
Before me boil cauldrons of ten thousand *shí*; behind me gleam axes of yellow gold.
Heavenly couriers and armored soldiers stand before and behind me.
Pestilential evil and the hundred ghosts flee ten thousand *lǐ* from me.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

Another incantation reads:
Within the cavern, profound and void; radiant and bright, the Great Origin.
The mighty spirits of the eight directions empower me by nature.
The talismanic writ of the Numinous Treasure proclaims to the Nine Heavens.
Qián-Luó-Dá-Nà, the penetrating power of the Great Mysterious.
Slay demons, bind evil, annihilate ten thousand ghosts.
The divine incantation of Zhongshan, the Jade Scripture of the Primordial Beginning.
Reciting it once repels ghosts and extends years.
Treading the Five Marchmounts, the Eight Seas take heed.
The Demon-Kings submit, guarding my chariot.
Malevolence and filth disperse; the *qi* of the Dao abides forever.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

Heaven’s light trembles, grass-demons bind their forms.
Ghosts and fiends are extirpated—thus I attain long life.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

Above, I summon the Jade Maidens to seize and capture misfortune.
Ascending mountains, I bear the left tally; at my waist, the seal of command.
My head wears the floral canopy, my feet tread the *Kuigang*.
To my left, the Six *Jia* spirits lend support; to my right, the Six *Ding* spirits crouch in wait.
Before me stands the Yellow Spirit; behind, the *Yuezhang*.
The divine masters execute judgment, sparing not even the mad.
First slay the lesser ghosts, then the night-shining ones.
What spirit does not submit? What ghost dares stand against me?
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

Heavenly *Peng*, Heavenly *Peng*, Nine Mysteries’ Slayer of Youth.
Five *Ding* Commanders, *Gaodiao* of the Northern Merit.
Seven Governances, Eight Numinous Ones, the Most High’s Radiant Might.
Long-skulled giant beasts wield the Emperor’s Bell.
Three White Owls, Three Spirits, sternly ride the *Kui* dragons.
The Divine King of the Mighty Sword slays evil and eradicates traces.
Purple *qi* ascends the heavens, cinnabar clouds surge forth.
Devouring demons, consuming ghosts, the body traverses the winds.
Green-tongued, green-toothed, four-eyed Old Man.
Heavenly *Ding* warriors, mighty in the South, repel misfortune.
Heavenly *Zou* rages fiercely, mighty in the North, biting down.
Three hundred thousand soldiers encircle and guard my ninefold layers.
Expelling corpses a thousand miles, dispelling all ill fortune.
Should any lesser ghost dare approach to behold my form,
The Heaven-Splitting Great Axe hews its fivefold shape.
The Flame Emperor severs its blood, the Northern Emperor burns its bones.
The Four Luminaries shatter its remains, the Heavenly Plan annihilates its kind.
One stroke of the divine blade—ten thousand ghosts scatter.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

Should a year of pestilence arise, when ghostly soldiers roam unchecked,
In every land, province, county, village, and ward, plague and pestilence surge forth, nowhere to hide.

Fear nothing—all diseases and demonic harms shall be powerless to harm.

Should one persist in recitation, in this life, peril shall turn to safety, sickness to health, poverty to wealth.
No disaster shall touch them; all desires shall be fulfilled, all wishes granted.

First visualize the spirits, nurture their roots, circulate their *qi*, invoke their names.

The mighty spirit-kings within the incantations, observing your pure resolve, shall secretly guard your body—all your prayers shall be fulfilled.

The Twin Symbols revolve, the essence of the Mysterious One.

Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

At that moment, the Most High Dao Lord and the immeasurable host of sagely beings in the heavens, upon hearing the Northern Emperor’s true incantation for warding off calamity, were filled with boundless joy.
