The Emperor declared: I now wish to broadly proclaim this essential Dharma to save the celestial and human realms, severing their groans and agonies. Hearken well, all of you.

At that moment, the assembled divine officials, hearing the Emperor’s intent to reveal the wondrous scripture, rejoiced as one, wholeheartedly submitting in devotion.

The Northern Emperor said: The secret arts of the Northern Palace are not lightly disclosed. They heal illness, avert calamity, pacify households, and secure the realm. I know the people of the Lower Realm suffer deeply, their agonies unbearable. Unable to bear the sight of their ignorance and deafness, I now resolve to enact their salvation.

The Northern Emperor said: The Eight-Character Spirit Script is treasured in the Upper Palace. Through ten thousand kalpas, it has not been transmitted—such is its divine secrecy. Yet I see the ignorant and vulgar of the Lower Realm endure grievous suffering. Were I not to bestow it, they would wither without escape. Now I entrust it to you, that you may accumulate merit and treasure it. In times of calamity, practice it according to the method. Deliver the celestial and human realms, sparing them from sorrow and peril.

Upon hearing the Emperor’s intent to proclaim the Eight Characters, the entire assembly prostrated themselves, five limbs to the earth, and joyfully recited this verse:
*The sagely Emperor’s grace flows wide,*
*Broadly opening the golden oral transmission.*
*To save the people of the Lower Realm,*
*Let their sufferings be utterly dispelled.*

The assembly, hearing the Dharma sound, rejoiced with every limb. The deaf regained hearing, the mute could speak. On that day, the Six Palaces trembled, and evil demons knew their fate. The great radiance was bestowed, and deep gloom met the bright sun.

The Northern Emperor said: Perfected disciples here present, if you wish to practice my Eight-Character Spirit Script, face north and bow twice. I shall witness your sincere devotion.

The Northern Emperor said: For those among the Lower Realm’s people afflicted with internal illness, write the characters in ink, swallow one with water, and recite the divine incantation. Upon reaching the eighth character, the illness shall disperse. For external afflictions, calmly invoke the divine power, write the characters in ink upon the flesh, beginning with the first. If it does not disperse, write the second beside it. In most cases, no more than three characters are needed for the illness to retreat. Remember this well, perfected disciples, and uphold it.

The Northern Emperor said: For men and women of the Lower Realm whose livelihoods falter, who suffer poverty and hardship, are assailed by ghosts and demons, or endure chronic illness—merely wear this Eight-Character Spirit Text, and malevolent afflictions shall vanish. Livelihoods shall flourish, calamities and demonic influences cease, and the Six Harms be dispelled.

The Northern Emperor said: If the people of the Lower Realm suffer discord among kin, frequent quarrels, marital strife, or unrest among sons and daughters, they should devoutly and earnestly write the Eight Characters on plain silk on a day of harmonious conjunction, wear and venerate them. With utmost sincerity, divine youths shall attend them day and night, preventing strife. Sons and daughters shall grow in peace, or dreams may reveal matters, ensuring ten thousand harmonious unions.

The Northern Emperor said: For those born of the Lower Realm who traverse rivers and seas or enter mountain forests, or who march in military campaigns—merely bathe body and mind during the hours of *hai* and *zi*, and wear these Eight Characters inscribed on plain silk upon the person. Divine dragons shall guard and protect, the Wind Earl shall lend aid, battles shall be won and paths made clear, with none failing to achieve victory.

The Northern Emperor said: For those born of the Lower Realm whose fields yield no harvest year after year, or whose five grains suffer blight—merely receive and wear these Eight Characters of the True Text upon the body, and all cultivated plantings shall yield ten thousandfold profit. If, at the onset of summer, one prays for grace and makes a vow, pledging to uphold it until winter’s harvest, offering wine, dried meats, cakes, fruits, silver, and coin as tokens of faith, and follows the rites in presenting the memorial, then in gratitude for my divine power, pestilence shall be subdued, the Earth Duke’s heart shall be harmonized. The merit of the Eight Characters is beyond all reckoning.

The Northern Emperor said: For those born of the Lower Realm who hold office, from the lowest ranks to the highest promotions, constrained by public duties and charged with the care of others’ children—let them ensure that grace and authority are balanced, that all four directions are judged with fairness, that the path of impartiality is followed, and that harm is minimized while benefit is maximized. Let them receive this scripture and wear the Eight Characters of the True Text, and none shall fail to attain their desires.

The Northern Emperor said: For those born of the Lower Realm who seek immortality and study the Dao, who visit friends in search of truth, who refine elixirs and concoct medicines, or who conceal themselves in mountain forests—it is essential to receive this scripture, contemplate this wondrous Dao, and wear these Eight Characters. Without this text, efforts shall be in vain.

The Northern Emperor said: For those born of the Lower Realm, even perfected beings, who receive and wear this True Dao of mine—when intending to perform its rites, they must first purify themselves with ablutions, strike their teeth thrice, hold their breath for three cycles, and only then may they take up the brush to inscribe it. They should also visualize the spirits, recite the incantation, pass incense through the smoke, and sprinkle consecrated water, whereupon the divine response shall manifest.

**Rites for Offering to the True Lord**
When the Supreme Tenuity Emperor Lord resides in the Palace of Mystic Radiance, within the Chamber of Nine Dragons, a seven-jeweled palace naturally arises, its thrones fashioned of crystal, jasper, lapis lazuli, and true pearls, adorned with ornaments rare in the world. Beneath the throne, an innumerable host of attendants, each bearing incense and flowers, offer reverent devotion. Those who come from the ten directions all approach before the Emperor, listening to the exposition of wondrous truths.

Then the Emperor Lord smiled faintly and addressed the four assemblies, saying: "From this time onward, the people of the Lower Realm shall be beset by confusion, with demonic spirits spreading unchecked, good and evil indistinguishable, their numbers beyond reckoning. You who seek learning must refine your bones and cultivate the true, not merely to guide yourselves but to deliver others, rescuing them from peril and relieving their distress. You must purify yourselves through fasting and abstinence, meditate upon the wondrous mysteries of the True Lords of the Northern Dipper, and rescue both heaven and humanity. Thus shall future generations universally attain peace, and the calamities and dangers of this world gradually dissipate. Such blessings are beyond all reckoning."

The Northern Emperor declared: "When the people of the Lower Realm perform these rites, they must always do so during the hours of *hai* and *zi*, offering libations to the Seven True Lords of the Stars. They shall execute the *Yu* step, grasp the sword, and face north, burning incense with a sincere and pure heart, never treating the rites with disdain. If the libation is performed with merit, after a thousand days, the spirits shall appear in person—sometimes as a woman of surpassing beauty, sometimes as a beggar. When they appear, you must not speak to them but only bow your head in reverence and present the wishes of your heart. After the spirit has descended for some time, it shall suddenly depart; you must then send it off with a devoted farewell. Take the wine and broth from the altar and consume them, whereupon the spirit’s *qi* shall enter your heart, and you shall naturally possess heaven-born wisdom, knowing future events. You may discern the advance and retreat of armies, the rise and fall of households and states, and receive the illumination of sun and moon within your heart, your body born of water and fire. The spirits may appear as an old man or a youth, entering your dreams to reveal fortune or misfortune.

If one encounters the inauspicious conjunction of malevolent stars—when prayers go unanswered, official rank does not advance, illness and misfortune abound, the heart and spirit are restless, and strange dreams disturb the night—if cursed by evil men or when the household and state are unsettled, simply practice this method, and no harm shall befall you. You shall prolong your years, extend your life, and forever preserve your place in the world."

The Northern Emperor declared: "If the land is unsettled, the four directions in turmoil, with roving armies, bandits, tigers, wolves, venomous snakes, and the perils of blades and weapons, simply perform the libation rites to the Seven True Lords of the Stars as prescribed in the scripture. Within two or seven days, the evil shall retreat, and the weapons of war shall fall silent."

The Northern Emperor declared: "True disciples of the Lower Realm who offer libations to the Seven Stars, cultivate the true, seek immortality, prolong life, and aid the imperiled must await an auspicious day. On the third day of the Dragon’s movement, the fifth day of the Horse’s halt, the seventh day of the Pheasant’s flight, or the ninth day of the Dog’s establishment, perform the libation to the Northern Controller. When the True Lords descend, the blessings shall be ten thousandfold, enabling one’s name to enter the Pure Palace and one’s lifespan to be extended."

The Northern Emperor declared: "At the time of the libation, present white silk and state: 'I, your humble servant [Name] of [State], respectfully address the Supreme Primordial August One, the Nine Heavens’ Venerable Elder, the Prime Minister of the Immortal Capital, the Envoys of the Nine Heavens, the Azure Dragon and White Tiger of the Left and Right, and the Supervisory Envoys, beseeching your grace to witness and affirm my humble offering. On this day of profound rites, I reverently receive the divine *qi* and humbly invoke: the Azure Emperor of the East, riding the Azure Dragon; the Vermilion Emperor of the South, riding the Vermilion Dragon; the White Emperor of the West, riding the White Dragon; the Black Emperor of the North, standing with the Black Dragon; and the Yellow Emperor of the Center, riding the Yellow Dragon. I beseech each to attend the Mystic Altar, affirm my supplications, and bring all to fulfillment. May my heart be illuminated, my Way sought and attained, immortality sought and achieved, old age reversed, youth restored, and my being merged with the Dao.'"

The Northern Emperor declared: "When performing the rites, take the incense, make your vows, bow your head in reverence, and present your words: 'I, your humble servant, today invoke the Divine Officials, beseeching the descent of great compassionate grace. I reverently invite the true *qi* of the Azure East to enter my body. I reverently invite the true *qi* of the Vermilion South to enter my body. I reverently invite the true *qi* of the White West to enter my body. I reverently invite the true *qi* of the Black North to enter my body. I reverently invite the true *qi* of the Yellow Center to enter my body. I reverently invite the Five Dragon Kings and the five-colored true *qi* of the Five Directions to enter my body. I, your humble servant, now invoke the true *qi* of the Dipper and dare to practice the arts of the immortals. I beseech the Heavenly *Ding* Warriors to execute and slay demonic spirits, and the Venerable Elder of the Nine Heavens to gather and suppress calamitous *qi*. After presenting these supplications, I shall gain the power of spiritual penetration and perceive heaven-born wisdom. I shall ascend to the imperial palaces above and enter the Hall of Blessings. The Nine Worms shall not arise, and the Three Corpses shall be eradicated. Through sincere devotion to the profound Dao, I shall reach the state of non-action.'

The Northern Emperor declared: "Benevolence pertains to Wood, its color azure, and it sweeps away misfortune. Righteousness pertains to Metal, its color white, and it subdues all spirits. Propriety pertains to Fire, its color vermilion, and it dispels ten thousand ills. Wisdom pertains to Water, its color black, and it washes away old *qi*. Trust pertains to Earth, its color yellow, and it supports all phenomena, capturing and subduing death. I tell you, future true disciples: those who understand the Five Phases and revere the Five Stars shall not be afflicted by calamity. If you further refine your cultivation of the star corresponding to your birth, know its name and designation, and invoke it at the brink of death, you may also extend your years.

Those born in *zi* belong to the first star, governing Celestial Radiance and Yang Brightness, named *Tanlang* (Greedy Wolf), true name *Ge*, styled *Lushen-zi*. Those born in *chou* and *hai* belong to the second star, governing Celestial Inner Yin Essence, named *Jumen* (Great Gate), true name *Zheng*, styled *Zhenwen-zi*. Those born in *yin* and *xu* belong to the third star, governing Celestial Impulse and the True Person, named *Lucun* (Salary Store), true name *Ji*, styled *Weifu-zi*. Those born in *mao* and *you* belong to the fourth star, governing Celestial Assistance and Mystic Darkness, named *Wenqu* (Literary Brilliance), true name *Guang*, styled *Zihui-zi*. Those born in *chen* and *shen* belong to the fifth star, governing Celestial Bird and Cinnabar Prime, named *Lianzhen* (Upright Integrity), true name *Heng*, styled *Ziheng-zi*. Those born in *si* and *wei* belong to the sixth star, governing Celestial Heart and the Northern Culmen, named *Wuqu* (Martial Brilliance), true name *Wei*, styled *Dache-zi*. Those born in *wu* belong to the seventh star, governing Celestial Pillar and Heavenly Pass, named *Pojun* (Breaking Army), true name *Xing*, styled *Taibin-zi*."

The Northern Thearch said: The *Hetu* Treasure Script uniquely bestows the title of True Lord, capable of transmitting great power and aligning with the celestial spirits. If those of the Lower Realm’s walking corpses revere and conceal it, they shall naturally attain the True Dao.

The Northern Thearch addressed the Perfected One of Wondrous Conduct, saying: Of all that is most revered, Heaven holds the highest place. That which governs and orders human relations is the Northern Dipper. Thus, the Northern Dipper serves as the Celestial Court. All who seek immortality and cultivate the Dao, harmonize Heaven and stabilize Earth, pursue prominence and manage affairs, or arrange marriages—all these depend on the power of the Northern Dipper. Even in the mundane world, every drink and every meal is recorded by the Northern Dipper before it may be received. If one wishes to avert disaster and eliminate misfortune, to dispel the ghosts of the walking dead, nothing surpasses offering sacrifices to the Seven Ancestors as the finest act.

Always on the day of one’s native *qi*, the day of the Six Harmonies, or during the *xu* and *hai* hours, in a pure and clean place, sweep the ground and make offerings to Heaven. Present white silk according to the nation’s customs, saying:

*"[Nation’s name], a humble subject, respectfully invokes the Celestial Thearchs, the Divine Lord of the Northern Culmen, and the Perfected Persons of the Northern Dipper. This humble subject, following the secret canon, reverently offers fruits to the spirits, beseeching the Lord Who Governs Destiny, the Lord Who Augments Fortune, the Immortal Who Advances Blessings, and the Perfected Who Delivers Across the World. May my name enter the Pure Palace, the realm know peace, the four directions be tranquil, the five grains abundant, and the Two Radiant Ones shine eternally. With utmost sincerity, I perform this rite."*

The Northern Thearch said: Regularly practice the secret canon of the Seven Stars, and each time recite the incantation of the Northern Dipper:

*"I am the Heavenly Eye, moving in accord with Heaven.
My gaze flashes like thunder and lightning, illuminating the Eight Extremities.
It pierces through all within and without—nothing remains unsubdued.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!"*

The Northern Thearch said: Upon completing the recitation of the divine incantation, visualize the Northern Dipper hovering above your head, its handle pointing forward. Then envision the Northern Thearch gazing upon you, strike your teeth twenty-four times, and softly recite the incantation:

*"Great Unity governs life, the Three Qi merge with the true primordial womb of the Upper Radiance.
Father Mysterious and Mother Primordial,
You engender my five viscera and gather my spirit.
Below, you irrigate with jade liquid; above, you ascend to the Muddy Pellet.
At dusk, you summon the seven po; at dawn, you call forth the three hun.
To the right, command the Jade Flower; to the left, whistle to the Metal Spirit.
Grant me ascent to immortality, command spirits and employ deities.
Ever preserve my advantage and uprightness, soaring through the Ten Heavens.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!"*

The Northern Thearch said: Upon finishing the incantation, visualize me enthroned in the Fengdu Palace, then recite the Heavenly Vanguard Divine Incantation, striking your teeth once for each line. Thus, the myriad calamities shall not afflict you, your merit shall be perfected, the Dao accomplished, and you shall mount the radiance to ascend to Heaven. If cultivated by a true adept of the Lower Prime, this becomes a method to protect the world. Wherever applied to deliver and rescue, ghosts shall be transformed into blood. The divine breath widely bestows salvation—none shall fail to respond.

*"Heavenly Vanguard, Heavenly Vanguard,
Ninefold merit slays the youth,
Five Ding Governors command,
Lofty and fierce, Northern Mystery.
Seven Governances, Eight Spirits,
Supreme Lord quells the baleful.
Long-skulled, colossal beast,
Wielding the Emperor’s Bell.
White Owl, Three Spirits,
Sternly driving the Kui-dragon chariot.
Mighty Sword Divine King,
Severing evil and eradicating traces.
Purple Qi ascends to Heaven,
Cinnabar clouds blaze and surge.
Devouring demons, consuming ghosts,
Body poised to drink the wind.
Azure tongue, green teeth,
Four-eyed Elder.
Heavenly Ding warriors,
Mighty in the South, repelling the baleful.
Heavenly Couriers, fierce and wrathful,
Mighty in the North, bearing blades.
Three hundred thousand soldiers,
Guard my ninefold enclosure.
Expelling corpses a thousand leagues,
Dispelling misfortune and averting ill.
Should any petty ghost
Dare approach to behold my form,
The Heaven-Splitting Great Axe
Shall hew the five forms of ghosts.
Flame Thearch rends their blood,
Northern Thearch burns their bones.
Four Luminaries shatter their remains,
Heavenly Strategist annihilates their kind.
One stroke of the divine blade—
Ten thousand ghosts scatter in rout.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!"*

The Northern Thearch said: For those born in the Lower Prime who diligently uphold my incantation, at the hour of *chou* each day, strike your teeth thirty-six times, sit facing the *ren* direction, and visualize the divine incantation:

*"On the left, the Azure Dragon, named Mengzhang of Jia-yin.
On the right, the White Tiger, named Guardian of the Army of Jia-shen."*

Above the head, the Vermilion Bird, Lingguang of Jia-wu.
Below the feet, the Dark Warrior, Zhiming of Jia-zi.
The spleen as the youngest child enters the Central Palace of Jia-chen and Jia-xu.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!

Next, visualize the Northern Dipper incantation:
*"I am the Heavenly Eye, pursuing the heavens.
My gaze like thunder and lightning, radiance illuminating the eight extremities.
Piercing to see both without and within—
No being remains unsubdued.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!"*

At that time, the Northern Thearch, with skillful means and expedient methods, expounded these scriptural secrets.
All the devas and sagely hosts rejoiced greatly and spoke in verse:
*"Wondrous is the Northern Thearch,
Who reveals the *Scripture for Protecting the State*.
Should one practice this sublime canon,
The great earth shall be suffused with light.
Delivering those of future kalpas,
This is the seed of blessed karma.
Guiding the children of the Lower Prime,
Misfortune vanishes and truth is realized.
Countless immortals and officials,
Riding the void on six unicorns,
Can annihilate the nine grotesque kinds,
Eradicating the hundred demonic forms.
Protecting the state and pacifying the people,
Aiding the imperiled and sojourning guests.
Below, no evil dares stir;
Above, even dust is commanded by decree.
Warm evil enters pure rectitude,
Merit grows day by day anew.
Naturally attaining great sagacity,
Ascending and descending into formlessness."*

The Northern Thearch said: The sacred power of this scripture shines with divine efficacy.
Above, it governs the Six Palaces; below, it commands the Nine Lands.
No spirit remains unsubdued; no ghost fails to submit.
Diligently practice and reverently recite—
The true Dao stands majestic and towering.

The Northern Thearch said: This text and its divine incantations share a single source with the Dao.
The constellations divide their ranks, each returning to its luminous mandate.
These ten scrolls of scripture broadly deliver devas and humans,
Serving as the great guiding principles of heaven and earth,
Bringing harmony and tranquility to the realm.

Should any faithful scholar or perfected worthy of the great transformation seek to transmit this Dharma of mine,
They must purify themselves for seven days, dispel impurity, and still the spirit.
With reverence, invoke the Northern Thearch, never ceasing for even a moment.
Pray for numinous response to descend in dreams, revealing what is permissible for the practitioner.
Only then may one undertake cultivation—
Do not casually transmit or initiate others. Be cautious, be cautious!

The Northern Thearch said: For those born in the Lower Prime who wish to transmit this Dharma,
First obtain a numinous response.
This may be done at the hours of *hai* and *zi*, on the days of *yin* and *mao*,
During the cyclical signs of *wang*, when stems and branches harmonize.
First establish the altar of the Seven Primes, and perform the Dao according to ritual.
Enter the purified chamber to kindle the incense burner,
Offer prayers and present incense,
Submit memorials and perform the jiao offering.
First empower the divine soldiers, then distribute the covenanted tokens of faith:
Forty-nine feet of green silk,
Five feet of five-colored silk for each of the five directions,
Forty feet of white silk,
One blade,
One pure mat,
One *shi* and two *dou* of rice,
One *zhang* and six *chi* of green cloth with a woven pattern,
One *zhang* and two *chi* of green silk thread,
Bathing decoctions of a hundred herbs, and the five fruits—
All must accord with the regulations.
Only then may transmission proceed; do not lightly divulge it.
The scriptural text and divine incantations must be recited personally,
Never concealed or obscured.
Furthermore, three masters must bear witness,
Recording the true covenant.
Establish the mysterious regulations and tokens of faith—
Do not leak them, do not deceive, and do not transmit to the unworthy.

The Northern Thearch said: Those born in the Lower Prime are greedy for advancement and forgetful of retreat.
Their minds dwell on the dissemination of the Dharma, yet their thoughts lack single-minded focus.
They do not savor the refinement of bones and cultivation of the true,
The exhalation and swallowing of numinous fluids,
Or the visualization of the Six Perfections.
Thus, ascent to the ranks of immortals remains unanswered,
Earthly deities remain unsummoned,
Meritorious fruition remains incomplete,
And the path of cultivation remains unfulfilled.
Now, I specifically instruct you all:
Simply empty your minds and sincerely invoke,
Reciting morning and evening.
The immortal officials of the direct day will then inscribe your names in the register of the living,
Your body will soar to the Great Ultimate,
And you will merge with the Dao in unity.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Prime receive the Dao,
Yet fail to perfect their dignified bearing,
Deviate from the proper covenant,
Neglect the jiao offering,
Or omit the recording of the Four Ministries—
The transmission of incantations and scriptures must be meticulously verified,
Allowing no errors in talismans, seals, or written characters.
One must understand their origins.
Should there be discrepancies, the Dharma will not be transmitted.

The Northern Thearch said: On days of impending misfortune for those born in the Lower Prime,
They may solely receive the *Great Incantation of the Five Numinous Ones* and the *Great Register for Averting Corpse-Evil*,
To dispel the hundred demonic influences—
There is no need to receive the scriptures in their entirety.

The Northern Thearch said: When those born in the Lower Prime receive scriptures and incantations,
Upon completion, they must perform the jiao offering rites without negligence.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Prime receive the Dao and study this scripture,
They must establish altars for its veneration.
Why? Because the names of the mighty divine kings reside therein.

The Northern Thearch said: Those born in the Lower Prime who receive my scriptures and incantations must keep them secret and hidden.
Do not urge or instruct the foolish,
Nor privately transmit them—
The divine soldiers will hold the transgressor accountable.

The Northern Thearch said: Those born in the Lower Prime who receive this Dao of mine and recite my divine incantations
Must not face south with their backs to the north.

At that time, the great assembly in attendance,
Having heard the Dharma of transmission and initiation,
Each followed the scripture and put it into practice.

*Thus concludes the Ninth Scroll of the* Wondrous Scripture of the Northern Thearch’s Incantations for Subduing Demons, *spoken by the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy.*
*The Tenth Scroll of the* Wondrous Scripture of the Northern Thearch’s Incantations for Subduing Demons: *The Chapter on Divine Soldiers Protecting the State.*

The Dark Thearch of the Northern Quarter, the Heavenly Lord of Mysterious Virtue, at that time dwelt in the World of Abyssal Springs, within the Jade Mound Mountain of the Cold Land in the divine mound above the Pool of Still Waters beside the withered-rush tree. There, he convened with his retinue of attendants, the Youths in Attendance, and the Perfected of the Dark and Profound, an assembly of boundless multitudes. Thrice daily, they offered incense, scattered flowers, and lit lamps in reverent devotion, cultivating purification rites. They extolled the spontaneous and made offerings as their hearts dictated, fulfilling all in accord with their aspirations. Thus did they cultivate with diligence for over a thousand years, their merit yet incomplete, their vows unwavering. They revealed the secret methods of salvation and protection, expounded the mysterious rituals of expiation and thanksgiving, bringing peace to the state and the household, and delivering both the hidden and the manifest.

The Northern Thearch addressed all future true disciples: "Follow the Dharma in practice, and you shall attain the true Dao."

The Northern Thearch said: "In performing my essential methods, you must offer jiao rites and sacrifices to the great officials of Fengdu and all spirit-officials to manifest merit and reward. Establish a Seven Primes Altar, light lamps and burn incense, prepare exotic broths and the five fruits, and make offerings according to the state’s customs. Use silver coins and pure water to ensure abundance. Upon entering the altar to commence the rites, invoke the spirits with incense and summon the deities.

"Summon the Thirty-Two Heavenly Thearchs, the Ten Ultimate Perfected, the Immortal Officials and Jade Maidens, the Venerable Ones of the Three Realms, the Ten Great Mighty Demon Kings of Awesome Power, the Eight Radiant Great Spirits, the Lords of the Thirty-Six Grotto-Heavens, the Flying Dragon Riders, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Venerable Ones of the Three Heavens, the Riders of the Ten Ultimate Perfected Immortals, the True Lords of the White Chariot and White Horse, the Most High and Utmost Perfected, the Thunder and Lightning Officials of the Dark Radiance, the Heavenly Ding Warriors, the Three Qi Great Generals, the Great Generals of the Five Lakes under Lofty Banners, the Seven Primes Great Generals of the Vast and Expansive Northern Dipper, the Great Spirits of Guarding the Numinous, the Riders of Mighty Beasts and Poisonous Dragons, the Flying Heavenly Ghost Hosts of the Great Power of the North, the Three-Five Great Generals, the Soldiers and Officers under the Three Masters, the Heavenly Peng Slayer Youths, the Flying Heavenly Hook-and-Lasso Riders, the Most High True Spirits, the Heavenly Ding Warriors, the Heavenly Couriers and Armored Soldiers, the Southern Dipper Envoys for Slaying Ghosts, the Northern Dipper Officials of the Flaming Furnace and Ritual Chariot, the Great Spirits of the Wilderness, the Eight Radiant Spirit-Kings, the Great Spirits of the Five Peaks and Four Streams, the Local Earth Deities, the Jade Maidens of the Azure Waist, the Jade Maidens of Supreme Harmony—each leading their legions of hundreds of thousands and millions, descending to the altar site, arraying themselves in ranks and positions to receive the offerings of this day.

The Northern Thearch said: "The Heavenly Lord of the Mysterious Five Qi of the Dark and Profound Northern Ultimate World, the Sovereign of the Land of Solitary Gloom in the Northern Feng Luo Mountain beneath the Great Void and Great Flower Sea of the Northern Ultimate World, the Dark Thearch of the Five Qi and Five Spirits of the Supreme Yin, the Black Thearch of Numinous Might, the Heavenly Lord Assisting in the Mysterious Nourishment, the Supreme Numinous Lord, the Jade Maidens of Night Radiance Born of Qi through Cultivating the True and Embracing the Primordial—along with the Heavenly Lord of the Supreme Yin Water, the Lord of Vital Qi Born in the Eastern Dipper, the Lord of Form Born in the Western Dipper, the Lord Who Governs Prohibitions in the Southern Dipper, the Lord Who Governs Destiny in the Northern Dipper, the Subordinate Officials of the Nine Commands, the Lords of the Five Peaks, the Yin Officials of the Twenty-Four Treatments, the Yang Officials of the Twenty-Four Treatments, the Clerks of Rivers and Seas, the Masters of Hills, Streams, and Ravines—an innumerable host, the malevolent ghosts of the Six Heavens as their guards, arrayed to left and right, the suffering souls of the Thirty-Six Prisons, the Seven Ancestors, and the Nine Mysteries. When disciples perform the jiao rites, summon them all to take their seats."

The Northern Thearch said: "The Three Officials outside the Supreme Yin Grotto—the Pursuers of Life and Death, the Essential Controllers of Summons—the Heavenly Official, the Earthly Official, the Water Official, the Six Palace Officials of the Yin Mansion of Fengdu Mountain, the Six Departments of the Netherworld, the thirty-six myriad lesser demon-kings who inflict the hundred diseases upon the world of humans and confuse the living—all these are to be summoned to take their seats outside the altar."

The Northern Thearch said: "The Great Generals of the Northern Thearch’s Divine Incantations: the Great General Who Commands Water, the Great General Who Pacifies Heaven, the Great General Who Commands Fire, the Great General Who Commands Disease, the Great General Who Binds Ghosts, the Great General Who Commands Corpse-Vexing, the Great General Who Summons Souls, the Great General Who Commands Pestilence, the Great General Who Commands Poison, the Great General Who Destroys Temples, the Great General Who Commands Ships, the Great General of Primordial Yang, the Great General Who Binds Disease, the Great General Who Binds Serpents and Insects, the Great General Who Breaks Springs, the Great General Who Binds Wolves and Tigers, the Great General of Gambling, the Great General Who Commands Stones, the Great General Who Commands Knives, the Great General Who Repels Force—when rewards and offerings are made, summon them to descend and take their seats within the central altar."

The Northern Thearch said: "The First □ Star, the Second □ Star, the Third □ Star, the Fourth □ Star, the Fifth □ Star, the Sixth □ Star, the Seventh □ Star—these Seven Star Lords.

"The Lords of the Dipper’s Departments Who Extend Life and Support Destiny, the Kings of the Dipper’s Departments Who Sever Evil and Slay Ghosts, the Jade Lads of the Dipper’s Departments Who Deliver from Calamity and Increase Lifespan, the Kings of the Dipper’s Departments Who Sever Evil Ghosts, the Jade Maidens of the Dipper’s Departments Who Dispense Medicinal Arts, the Perfected of the Dipper’s Departments Who Support the Declining and Dispel Disasters, the Spirit-Kings of the Dipper’s Departments Who Descend and Capture Demons, the Lads of the Dipper’s Departments Who Deliver from Calamity and Increase Lifespan, the Left and Right Generals of the Dipper, the Left and Right Warriors of the Dipper, the Left and Right Merit-Officials of the Dipper, the Heavenly Couriers and Armored Soldiers of the Dipper, the Left and Right Heavenly Soldiers of the Dipper, the Left and Right Envoys of the Dipper, the Heavenly Ding Warriors of the Dipper, the Divine Soldiers of the Dipper.

"The Daoists among the Stars, the Immortals among the Stars, the Perfected among the Stars, the Officers and Soldiers among the Stars. The above eight divisions of the great assembly, totaling two hundred fifty-two ranks, amounting to twenty-one million nine hundred nineteen thousand ninety-eight in number. When disciples make offerings to perform state exorcisms, summon them all in their ranks to take their seats, and reverently honor them with sincerity."

The Northern Thearch said: "The profound and wondrous principles of my Fengdu, the mighty spirit-kings of black form, can ascend to eliminate celestial disasters and avert the calamities of the five weapons and war."

When facing battle, visualize them and perform the sacrificial rites, steadfastly recite the scriptures, and employ talismans, seals, and wondrous incantations to break evil. Follow the ritual protocols, prostrate upon the ground in visualization, all clad in black robes and vermilion crowns, wielding blades, halberds, bows, arrows, dagger-axes, and pole-axes. As they take their seats, none shall fail to respond—rise then and perform the rites of reverence.

The Northern Thearch said: "When invoking the incantations, address each by their proper title."

Your humble servant respectfully invokes the assembled deities within and beyond the altar: the Heavenly Thearchs, the Perfected, the Ten Poles Elders, the Immortals, the Vajras, the Spirit-Kings, the Black Thearch Generals, the Great Might Demon-Kings, the Northern Culmen Fengdu Luoshan’s Six Cavern-Heavens, the Three Primes, the Six Ministries’ Lords, the tribal hosts, and the great deities of the Seven Primes within the Dipper.

From the day your humble servant received the Daoist precepts, a covenant was made with the Northern Thearch and the Three Officials—every movement and thought is bound to this pact. Internally, it governs the body; externally, it saves all beings. With the mind fixed upon the true *qi*, blessings descend and disasters dissolve. The ritual prohibitions are strict, and none dare act recklessly. Yet I reflect upon my own duty, extolling the majesty of the Dao’s transformative power, widely benefiting heaven and humanity. For any who make supplications, I dare not refuse. Now, for the sake of the land’s calamities and epidemics, or the chaos of war and the ravages of marauders across the wilds—when the solar cycle’s *yang* nine has run its course and the hundred-six disasters arise—we beseech the Mysterious Bureau, reverently offering libations and viands to dispel calamity, resolve peril, and pacify the state and household.

May the Northern Metropolis’ Thearch-Kings with their three hundred thousand troops, the Merit-Officials and Spirit-Generals, the Six *Jia* Generals, the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens, the Day-Officials and Decade-Officials, the Direct-Command Envoys, descend with the invoked Celestial Immortals and Great Sages, the Three-Five Generals, the Eighty Thousand Mighty Warriors, the Three Divisions’ Generals, the Dipper’s *Xi* and *Ci* Generals, the Dipper’s Punitive and Destructive Generals, the Revolving Mechanism Generals who repel foes, the *Xi* Generals who dissolve disasters, the Execution Generals who scatter misfortune, the Life-Sustaining Generals who resolve peril—enter your humble servant’s body, follow and shield me. For the state and the household, above, dispel celestial disasters; below, scatter earthly misfortunes. Water and fire’s harms, the hundred poisons and pestilences, the thousand spirits and myriad demons, the brandishing of weapons and war—all are beseeched for deliverance.

The Northern Thearch said: "In the Northern Culmen’s Hall resides the Most High Jade Thearch, the Purple Tenuity Emperor-Lord, the Immortals’ Envoys, and the Nine Heavens’ Executive Officers. They can descend to the world to eliminate all disasters—water, fire, blades, and weapons. If there are men or women of the land whose punishments and harms reside in the Greedy Wolf star of the Northern Dipper, invoke the Venerable Lord of the Radiant Yang Mansion to resolve and deliver them. If men or women of the land suffer calamities, demonic harms, or misfortunes in the Northern Dipper’s Great Gate star, invoke the Venerable Spirit of the Yin Essence Star to resolve and deliver them. If men or women of the land suffer punishments, disasters, or destructive forces in the Northern Dipper’s Wealth Star, invoke the Perfected Lord to resolve and deliver them. If men or women suffer punishments or misfortunes in the Northern Dipper’s Literary Star, invoke the Lord of the Mysterious Darkness to resolve and deliver them. If men or women of the land or within the astrological regions suffer punishments or misfortunes in the Northern Dipper’s Integrity Star, invoke the Cinnabar Prime Lord to resolve and deliver them. If men or women of the land or within the astrological regions suffer punishments or misfortunes in the Northern Dipper’s Martial Star, invoke the Northern Culmen Lord to resolve and deliver them. If men or women of the land suffer punishments or misfortunes in the Northern Dipper’s Ruined Army star, invoke the Heavenly Pass Lord to resolve and deliver them. May water, fire, blades, weapons, venomous creatures, and fierce beasts all dissolve of themselves. May the state and household attain peace, the living and the dead rejoice in prosperity. With the supreme elixir and numinous cinnabar, forever dispel disasters and epidemics, and attain longevity and enduring vision. The power of the Northern Asterism is beyond comprehension."

The Northern Thearch said: "For those born in the Lower Prime, let this Dao be their constant practice in movement and stillness. I shall send the Perfected of the Dipper, the Three Terraces’ Assistants, the attendants of the True Assembly of Sages, to descend among humanity, to save and protect the living, to erase death and restore life, to gather souls and nurture destiny, to sever the *qi* of death, and to deliver them from the Three Disasters. If the land’s regional lords and the ten virtuous ministers encounter demonic calamities in their domains, or within the astrological regions of famous mountains and great marshes, let them practice this Dao daily. Heavenly dragons shall descend, warrior-spirits shall march, the *yin* and *yang* officials shall both come to the rescue. With sincere devotion and resolve, the Jade Maidens shall manifest, enabling the self-dissolution of war, and the world’s tranquility."

At that time, the Northern Thearch, having spoken these words, addressed the assembled multitude, urging them to diligently practice and recite, that they might gain blessings in this life. Transgressions shall disperse, good karma shall form, merits shall be fulfilled, and the Dao shall be attained. Ascend into the formless and natural, join the company of the True Ultimate, and clasp hands with the Highest Immortals. In the methods of salvation and deliverance, rescue comes first.

In verse, it is proclaimed:
With devotion, rely upon the incense’s pledge,
Its rising smoke shrouds the purple court.
With single-minded resolve, follow the cinnabar will,
The Mysterious Heaven descends in emerald chariots.
Transgressions vanish across ten thousand kalpas,
Blessings extend for a thousand ages.
In the Southern Palace, life’s allotment is recorded,
In the Northern Bureau, death’s names are erased.
Souls and spirits rest in their palaces and organs,
The *qi* of the passes attains purity and peace.
With divine power, mount the Great Mystery,
With wondrous traces, ascend to the Highest Clarity.
Nine generations ascend to the celestial gates,
And humanity preserves its longevity.

The Northern Thearch said: "This is called *The Scripture of the Divine Soldiers Protecting the State*. If the land suffers calamities, simply hold to its recitation—bandits and weapons shall vanish, and the Three Luminaries shall shine brightly. If a household suffers from demonic epidemics or pestilences, practice exorcism and retreat, and merely recite and perform the sacrificial rites—no spirit-official shall fail to respond. When reciting the scripture, the divine soldiers descend. If, within the ritual arena, there is fear, or the banners and lamps’ shadows stir as if in wind, know that the divine soldiers have descended from the north, and all evil shall scatter in flight."

At that time, all the mighty warriors in the assembly, the Perfected, the Jade Maidens, and the true numina of the nine lands, having heard *The True Scripture for Protecting the State*, universally leapt for joy and vowed with utmost resolve: "In future ages, should anyone speak our names or depict our forms, we shall hasten to that person’s sincere devotion, deliver them from disasters and illnesses, bring peace to their state and household, fulfill their merits, and enable all beings to together realize the Dao of Non-Action."

As the ritual nears its conclusion, bow in reverence and uphold its teachings.

*Thus concludes the Tenth Scroll of The Wondrous Scripture of the Northern Emperor’s Divine Incantations for Subduing Demons, as Spoken by the Supreme Primordial Heavenly Venerable of the Origin.*

**Lamp Altar Diagram**

**Mystic Instructions for Reciting the Scripture:**
According to the method of recitation, one must purify and establish an altar. At its center, set a high table for the Great Emperor of the Northern Culmen and Purple Tenuity, facing south to the east. To the east, arrange tables for the Heavenly Vanguard and the Sagely Wing-Protector; to the west, tables for the Heavenly Strategist and the Sagely Guardian. The five tables correspond to the five directions, each adorned with small banners of the five colors, along with wine and fruit.

Within the purification hall, arrange the lamp altar, placing tablets of the Four Heavenly Kings at its four corners to guard the altar. Offerings of blessed rice, scissors, a ruler, mirror, scale, lamp bowls, tea, wine, and fruit are made to the northwest. Atop the altar, set a high table for recitation.

At dawn, invite the Dharma Master to first present the written petition, then proceed as desired with scripture recitation and repentance rites. In the afternoon, follow the ritual protocol to establish the altar, ascend the seat, and expound the scripture. By evening, conclude with the offering of the completed rite.

For devout and faithful practitioners, it is also fitting to meticulously arrange the five tables within their own homes, reciting with utmost sincerity. The essence lies in reverent devotion and steadfast observance—neglect or carelessness must be avoided.

chunks.original_text: 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经 经名：太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经。 原题上清三洞经箓碧霄洞华太乙史欧阳雯受。 内引陶真人、郑思远说，当出於唐末至宋初。 十卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》正一部。 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第一 上清三洞经箓碧霄洞华太乙吏欧阳雯受 叙议品 道言：昔於龙汉元年甲午之岁，元始天尊居上元之殿、八景天都，安五云宝座，垂十绝灵旛。 与三十二天帝，十极真人，玉童玉女，三景丈人，侍卫大威力魔王，八景大神，飞龙骑吏无鞅数众，碧落空歌，天乐摇曳，演说真一妙法。 是时，上元天都东北方振动，天门忽开，下观乃有郁勃血光参杂之气，幽幽冥冥，从人间东北方上冲天宫，盘结不散，其气皆腥膻臭秽。 大众咸惊，默然不敢发问。 是时，法会中有一真人，名日妙行，福德充备，瞻仰整顿而出，敛简局步，再拜长跪，上白天尊：臣闻至真妙域，明绝非祥。 无何之乡，本除怪异。 臣侍道君已经万劫，未尝有此异见。
chunks.translated_text:
The *Marvelous Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Northern Emperor for Subduing Demons, Spoken by the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy*

**Scripture Title:** *The Marvelous Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Northern Emperor for Subduing Demons, Spoken by the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy*
**Original Attribution:** Transmitted to Ouyang Wen by the Celestial Clerk of the Azure Sky Grotto, Hua Taiyi of the Three Caverns of Supreme Clarity’s Scriptures and Registers.
**Internal References:** As recounted by Perfected Lord Tao and Zheng Siyuan, likely composed between the late Tang and early Song dynasties.
**Ten fascicles.**
**Source Text:** *Daoist Canon of the Orthodox Tradition*, First Section.

---

**The Marvelous Scripture of the Divine Incantations of the Northern Emperor for Subduing Demons, Spoken by the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy, Fascicle the First**
Transmitted to Ouyang Wen by the Celestial Clerk of the Azure Sky Grotto, Hua Taiyi of the Three Caverns of Supreme Clarity’s Scriptures and Registers

**Chapter on the Preface and Discourse**

The Dao speaks:
In the first year of the Dragon-Han era, the *jiawu* year, the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy resided in the Palace of the Upper Primordial, the Celestial Capital of the Eight Effulgences. Seated upon a precious throne of fivefold clouds, he let fall the ten mystic banners of absolute numinosity. Accompanied by the thirty-two Heavenly Emperors, the Perfected Ones of the Ten Poles, jade lads and jade maidens, the Venerable Ones of the Three Luminaries, the demon-subduing Great Kings of Majestic Power, the Great Spirits of the Eight Effulgences, and an innumerable host of flying dragon riders and celestial clerks, the azure vault resounded with celestial hymns, and the music of the heavens swayed and drifted as he expounded the wondrous Dharma of the True Unity.

At that time, the northeastern quarter of the Celestial Capital of the Upper Primordial trembled and quaked. Suddenly, the gates of heaven swung open, and gazing downward, a dense and surging crimson radiance was seen, intermingled with turbid qi. Dark and obscure, it rose from the northeastern realm of the human world, piercing the celestial palaces. Coiling and congealing, it refused to disperse, its vapors reeking of blood and putrid filth.

The assembled multitude was struck with awe and dared not speak. Then, from within the Dharma assembly, a Perfected One named Wondrous Conduct, replete with blessings and virtue, raised his gaze, adjusted his robes, and stepped forward. Drawing in his tablets and pacing with measured steps, he prostrated himself twice, kneeling in reverence, and addressed the Heavenly Worthy:

“Your servant has heard that the realm of the utmost Perfected and wondrous is luminous and free of inauspicious omens, while the land of the formless by nature expels all monstrous anomalies. Though I have attended the Dao Lord for ten thousand kalpas, never before have I witnessed such a strange sight.”

chunks.original_text: 奈何。 今日法会之中，睹此秽结黑毒血光之气，纷杂冲天。 是何灾祥？ 恩惟至圣，重宣妙典。 令破众疑，得究其源。 令学道之者，咸生敬向。 是时，元始天尊良久微笑发言：汝等当知，静默安神，而为汝说。 下元生人，皆从此界降下。 氤氲真一之形，皆备三万六千神气。 清净扶卫，久为阴魔，忘源失本。 今三九数终，鬼魔流行。 信着邪道，不依道源。 为诸神杂体，为诸阴魔邪鬼所乱。 心生凶恶，杀害群生。 以同神鬼，謟求余福。 历数将终，颠狂淫乱，不孝不忠，不慈不义，好乐邪道。 今为六天鬼神，枉有所伤。 若男若女，若老若少。 未尽天年，横被夭伤。 死魂未散，结成恶气，怨怒上冲，卿当省知。 是时，妙行闻是说，己心大惊怖。 上白天尊言：彼六天鬼神，不审备何威力，有何神通？ 得於人间行种种刑害。 杀伤生人，无所畏惧，诸法皆不能禁止。 唯愿为臣，分别解说。 臣虽聋愚，愿假圣力，知其所始？ 往彼救护。 令得下元生人，免遭非横。
chunks.translated_text:
Alas! Today, within this Dharma assembly, we behold this foul congealing of black, poisonous, blood-laden qi surging chaotically toward the heavens. What portent of disaster or fortune is this? I implore the Most Sagely One to once more proclaim the wondrous canon, dispelling the doubts of all and tracing this phenomenon to its source, that those who cultivate the Dao may be moved to reverence and devotion.

Then, the Most High Lord of the Primordial Beginning smiled faintly after a long silence and spoke: "You all must know this—compose yourselves in stillness and quietude, for I shall explain it to you. The beings of the Lower Kalpa all descend from this very realm. Their forms, born of the undifferentiated True Unity, are endowed with thirty-six thousand divine qi. Yet though they are upheld and guarded in purity, they have long been swayed by yin demons, forgetting their origin and losing their root. Now that the reckoning of three nines has reached its end, ghostly demons proliferate. They cling to deviant paths, forsaking the source of the Dao. Their bodies, host to manifold spirits, are confounded by legions of yin demons and malevolent ghosts. Their hearts breed wickedness, and they slaughter the multitudes of living beings, aligning themselves with gods and ghosts to ingratiate themselves and seek spurious blessings. As the appointed cycle nears its close, they grow reckless and dissolute, disloyal and unfilial, unkind and unjust, delighting in perverse ways. Now, the Six Heavens’ ghostly spirits inflict wanton harm. Whether man or woman, old or young, they cut short lives not yet fulfilled, snuffing them out untimely. The souls of the dead, not yet dispersed, coalesce into baleful qi, their resentment and fury ascending in a surge—you ought to take heed of this."

Upon hearing these words, Wondrous Conduct was seized with great dread. He addressed the Heavenly Worthy, saying: "Those ghostly spirits of the Six Heavens—what power and might do they possess? What supernatural abilities? How is it that they roam the mortal realm, inflicting all manner of harm, slaughtering and wounding living beings without fear, defying all dharmas and restraints? I beseech you, deign to elucidate this for your servant. Though I am dull-witted, I would borrow your sagely power to comprehend their origins. Then I might journey there to offer salvation, sparing the beings of the Lower Kalpa from such unjust calamities."

chunks.original_text: 天尊告妙行曰：从此天界正北方，过此太溟无鞅里数，穷北方之极，有一世界。 名曰五气玄天洞，阴朔单郁绝之。 国中有帝君，名曰太阴五灵玄老黑帝灵君。 侍佐助理，名曰玄滋天君。 太上灵君侍真行气，降生玉女，名曰太玄夜光玉女。 当与灵君北乡无鞅太玄诸灵官，开太玄北门，名曰阴生广灵之门。 说《太玄真一妙经》，制御阴魔。 闻是法味，一国人民，死者更生，枯骨重肥，人无夭伤，不至非横。 其国下界有太虚太荒溟渤，周回无鞅里数，海水皆恶腥秽黑色，无测边际。 中有一大山，上参碧落，下入风泉，名曰酆都罗山。 山耸十万六千里，周回五万里。 山下入水深一万里，水际山脚下有大洞阴景天国。 中有主者，名曰太阴水帝北阴天君。 其洞天周回一万五千里，其宫名太阴宫。 左右助理，名日东斗斗中生气君，西斗斗中生形君，南斗斗中司禁君，北斗斗中司命君，中斗斗中总录君，下吏九令主者，五岳府君，二十四治阴官，二十四治阳官，河海掾吏，丘陵溪涧主者，下吏无鞅之众。 六天异鬼恶神，以为侍卫。 左右列三十六狱，周回各五十里。
chunks.translated_text:
The Heavenly Worthy addressed Wondrous Conduct, saying: "Beyond the due north of this celestial realm, past the boundless expanse of the Great Brine where measure fails, at the uttermost extremity of the northern quarter, there lies a world called the Cavern of Five Qi Mystic Heaven, shrouded in yin’s desolate gloom. Within that land rules an Imperial Lord named the Supreme Yin Fivefold Numinous Mystic Elder Black Thearch Numinous Lord. His attendant and chief minister is the Mystic Nourishment Heavenly Lord. The Supreme Numinous Lord, in his practice of true qi, descended to give birth to a Jade Maiden named the Supreme Mystic Night Radiance Jade Maiden. Together with the Lord and the boundless host of Mystic Numinous Officials of the northern precincts, they unseal the Northern Gate of the Supreme Mystic, called the Gate of Yin’s Vast Numinous Birth. There they expound the *Marvelous Scripture of the Supreme Mystic True Unity*, by which they govern and restrain the yin demons. All who taste this dharma’s savor—even the dead revive, withered bones grow plump again, and none suffer untimely death or unjust calamity.

Beneath that land stretches the Great Void and Vast Wilderness of the Brine’s Abyss, its circumference beyond all measure. Its waters are foul, rank, and black, their depths unfathomable. At its center rises a mighty mountain, its summit piercing the azure vault, its base plunging into the windy springs, named Mount Fengdu Luo. It towers one hundred and six thousand li high, its girth fifty thousand li. Its roots descend ten thousand li into the water. At the water’s edge, where the mountain’s foot meets the deep, lies the Cavern-Heaven Realm of Yin’s Shadow. Its sovereign is the Supreme Yin Water Thearch, the Northern Yin Heavenly Lord. This cavern-heaven spans fifteen thousand li in circumference; its palace is called the Palace of Supreme Yin. His aides and ministers include: the Life-Generating Qi Lord of the Eastern Dipper, the Form-Generating Lord of the Western Dipper, the Prohibitions Overseer of the Southern Dipper, the Life Mandate Overseer of the Northern Dipper, the General Records Keeper of the Central Dipper, the Nine Commanding Subordinate Officers, the Prefects of the Five Marchmounts, the Twenty-Four Yin Officials of the Twenty-Four Governances, the Twenty-Four Yang Officials of the Twenty-Four Governances, the River and Sea Attendants, the Masters of Hills, Mounds, Streams, and Ravines, and a boundless host of lesser officers. The baleful spirits and malevolent gods of the Six Heavens serve as his guards. To his left and right stand thirty-six prisons, each fifty li in circumference."

chunks.original_text: 狱中草树，皆禀自然恶毒之气，所生为刀剑锋铓。 多饶众毒、猛兽、炎火，烟黑风飘，日夜不停。 冥昏毒气，血光熏臭音臭。 火车灰河，铁棒铜锤。 拷打楚痛，呻吟振天。 皆是下元肉人，罪鬼死魂之所处也。 其太阴天洞外，左右有三小宫，各五十里，各有主者居焉。 第一宫名天官宫，第二宫名地官宫，第三宫名水官宫，皆是生死追呼之要司也。 其山中有六洞宫，其洞宫是太一阴洞天宫，每宫周回五千里，此六宫亦阴府之六曹也。 每官直主者役士，各一大魔王，每一魔王下小吏三十六万人，皆异状凶怪鬼神，或鱼龙之形，以为侍卫。 其洞门在太虚杳冥之中，常为烟雾蒙郁所蔽。 若非天帝至力，不可及也。 名为六天魔王宫，其鬼乘生人迷乱，下降人间。 啖食女人怀胎血孕精气，令非梦恶想。 或为猫犬之形，令女人惊怪。 痿黄色顿，血精断绝，狂病衰患伤，食生人子息。 或一岁至十岁，枉遭夭折。 下元生人，大限未终。 愚迷不能添神益算延生，请命遭逢魔鬼，枉折天年。 又与生人九玄七祖拘年，考问生人姓名，延累共行，诸恶病瘨尰，焦瘦涕唾，脓血恶疮，疥癞癫狂，盲聋闭塞。 或为风水作难，游魂恶梦，柳锁鞭挞，禁系非常，行种种疾病，不可具载。 妄将生人行年本命、三魂七魄，上送六宫，落生名，上死籍。 病困床枕，积岁经年。 改易形骸，以求血食。 或为女巫摇铃鼓吹之怪，据於大木古树。 或为三皇五帝古先帝王形像，垂旒带佩。 或为六天魔女，盛服艳妆。 或为九州前代猛将凶臣，持戟把剑。 或为诸天大将军，驭骑日月星辰光气，游行人间。 或为生人七代填墓祖考仪貌。 或为野兽，乘骑飞鸟，驾驭蛇鼠，五色光明，妖童艳女。 或托异木怪石为主。 或为古穴泉源。 百形千变，杀害生人。 苦遭逼逐，或求异法禁卫，镇压追捉。 其鬼力不能加，即反入洞中，不可寻逐。 诸邪不禁，力不加敌。 及有大威力，移山拔树，兴云动雨，不可禁制。 卿等当知。 是时，妙行启天尊言曰：臣虽聋愚，愿假圣力。 今日请将三天真仙飞仙龙骑，往下人间，降禁是鬼。 令得下元生人，免遭茶毒。 是时，天尊告妙行曰：吾不令卿往，夺卿诚悃。 既摄伏邪精，以求善功，即当行矣。 是时，妙行从法会起，将领三天丈人、十极真仙、骑吏飞将，天乐导引，正北而行，寻其黑气结勃之所。 去人间数里，龙鹤不行，云舆不进，所领侍卫悉有触缩之状，不能前进。 是时，众中有一素车白马真君，告妙行曰：下元人间，尸臭秽气，鬼毒流行。 吾等皆三清至真金姿玉质，清诤之俦。 遭此秽触，不能降下，愿却归天，往不可也。 是时，妙行引诸道众，却反上元天中，朝谒天尊，再拜长跪，上白天尊言曰：臣昨与三天丈人、十极天真仙官眷属，下降人间，降伏鬼魔，救护生人。 至其方所，去地数仞，龙鹤不进，侍卫真从悉皆有触缩之状，为鬼魔秽毒所熏。 不审以何方术，得其生人，免是残害。 是时，天尊告妙行言曰：是酆都罗山绝顶之上，虚元北界有北帝灵君，统领北方无鞅大力魔王、天丁力士、阴景飞雷电吏，甚有威力。 若非北帝，不可摄伏。 是时，妙行启天尊言曰：不审以何道力召命得是北帝，以救生人，免为尸臭、日有所害。
chunks.translated_text:
Within these prisons, grasses and trees all bear the baleful, venomous qi of nature, their growth forming blades and sword-points. Abounding in myriad poisons, fierce beasts, and raging flames, they are shrouded in black smoke and howling winds that never cease. Murky darkness and toxic vapors, blood-red miasmas and foul stenches fill the air. Chariots of fire and rivers of ash, iron rods and bronze hammers—tortures and torments resound with wails that shake the heavens. Here dwell the flesh-bound mortals of the Lower Realm, the sinful ghosts and dead souls.

Beyond the cavern-heaven of Supreme Yin, to its left and right, lie three lesser palaces, each fifty *li* in extent, each governed by its own overseer. The first is called the Palace of Heavenly Officials, the second the Palace of Earthly Officials, and the third the Palace of Water Officials—all critical bureaus for the summoning of life and death.

Within these mountains stand six cavern-palaces, known as the Six Cavern-Palaces of the Supreme Yin Cavern-Heaven. Each spans five thousand *li* in circumference, and together they form the Six Ministries of the Nether Bureau. Each palace is presided over by a great demon-king, who commands a host of thirty-six myriad lesser officers—all monstrous and malevolent spirits of grotesque forms, some assuming the shapes of fish and dragons, serving as his guards. Their cavern-gates lie hidden in the boundless obscurity of the Great Void, perpetually veiled by swirling mists. Without the supreme power of the Heavenly Emperor, none may approach. These are the Six Palaces of the Demon-Kings of the Six Heavens, whose ghosts descend into the mortal realm to bewilder and confuse. They devour the blood and essence of pregnant women, inducing nightmares and evil thoughts. Some take the forms of cats or dogs to startle women, causing pallor, blood depletion, madness, and wasting illnesses. They feast upon the lives of mortal children, from infancy to ten years of age, cutting short those whose allotted span is not yet exhausted. The foolish and deluded, unable to cultivate spirit or prolong life, fall prey to these demonic forces and forfeit their destined years. These demons also bind the Nine Ancestral and Seven Generational kin of the living, interrogating them by name and entangling them in shared suffering—afflicting them with all manner of ailments: emaciation, sores, ulcers, festering wounds, scabies, leprosy, madness, blindness, deafness, and blockages. They bring calamities of wind and water, wandering souls, and nightmares; they bind with willow fetters, whip and beat, and impose extraordinary restraints, inflicting countless diseases too numerous to recount. They falsely seize the living’s years, fate, Three Hun, and Seven Po, submitting them to the Six Palaces, erasing their names from the register of the living and inscribing them in the ledger of the dead. Bedridden for years, their bodies transformed, they seek blood and sustenance. Some become the uncanny apparitions of female shamans, shaking bells and drums in ancient trees; others take the forms of the Three Sovereigns, Five Emperors, or ancient kings, adorned with tassels and sashes. Some appear as demon-maidens of the Six Heavens, richly dressed and alluring; others as fierce generals or treacherous ministers of past dynasties, wielding halberds and swords. Some manifest as great generals of the heavens, riding the qi of the sun, moon, and stars through the mortal realm; others as the likenesses of the living’s seven generations of buried ancestors. Some assume the shapes of wild beasts, riding flying birds or driving serpents and rats, their five-colored radiance bewitching youths and maidens. Some possess strange trees or uncanny stones; others lurk in ancient caves or springs. A thousand forms, a hundred transformations—all to slaughter and harm the living. When pressed, they may seek arcane methods of restraint or suppression, but if their power proves insufficient, they retreat into their caverns, beyond pursuit. Against such evils, those without great might cannot prevail. Some possess the power to move mountains, uproot trees, summon clouds, and stir rain—unrestrainable forces.

Then, Miao Xing addressed the Heavenly Venerable, saying: "Though I am dull-witted, I humbly beseech your sacred power. Today, I request to lead the True Immortals, Flying Immortals, and Dragon-Riders of the Three Heavens to descend into the mortal realm and subdue these demons, that the living of the Lower Realm may be spared their torment."

The Heavenly Venerable replied to Miao Xing: "I do not send you forth to test your sincerity. Since you seek to subdue these evil spirits and perform a virtuous deed, you shall proceed."

Thereupon, Miao Xing arose from the Dharma assembly, leading the Three Heavenly Elders, the Ten Ultimate True Immortals, their celestial riders and flying generals, with heavenly music guiding the way. They journeyed due north, following the dense black qi until, several *li* above the mortal realm, their dragon-cranes ceased to advance, their cloud-chariots stalled, and their retinue of attendants recoiled, unable to press forward.

Then, from among the assembly, a True Lord of the White Chariot and White Horse spoke to Miao Xing: "The mortal realm below is thick with the stench of corpses and the foul qi of ghosts. We are the purest of the Three Clarities, beings of golden form and jade substance, companions of purity. To encounter such filth is unbearable—we cannot descend. We must return to heaven; to proceed further is impossible."

Thereupon, Miao Xing led the Daoist assembly back to the Heaven of Supreme Yang, where they prostrated before the Heavenly Venerable, kneeling to address him: "Yesterday, I accompanied the Three Heavenly Elders, the Ten Ultimate True Immortals, and their celestial retinue to descend into the mortal realm and subdue the demonic spirits, to save and protect the living. Yet upon reaching the place, mere *ren* above the earth, our dragon-cranes would not advance, and our attendants and true followers all recoiled, overwhelmed by the foul and toxic miasma of the demonic spirits. I do not know by what method or art the living may be spared this devastation."

The Heavenly Venerable then said to Miao Xing: "At the summit of Mount Fengdu, on the northern frontier of the Void Origin, resides the Divine Lord of the North, who commands an innumerable host of mighty demon-kings, celestial soldiers, and thunderous storm spirits of the yin realm—possessing immense power. Without the Divine Lord of the North, none can subdue them."

Miao Xing then addressed the Heavenly Venerable: "By what Daoist power may we summon this Divine Lord of the North, to save the living and spare them from the stench of corpses and daily harm?"

The baleful spirits and malevolent gods of the Six Heavens serve as his guards. To his left and right stand thirty-six prisons, each fifty li in circumference."

chunks.original_text: 时天尊叩齿，遥存北方五炁天中太阴北帝。 尔时，北帝遥知，将领十天魔王，八景大神，三十六洞天丁力士，三五大将军，高麾五湖大将军，豁落北斗七元大将军，卫灵大神，无鞅飞雷电吏，巨兽毒龙诸小神吏，及北阴大力飞天鬼众，一时同会，至其会所。 时理剑佩玉，敛简局步，再拜长跪言：臣自违侍筵，以仅十劫。 今日遥奉密旨，得拜圣颜，不审至圣召臣，有何指役？ 是时，天尊告北帝曰：北阴鬼魔，出行人间，枉杀生民太半。 今当三九七五之岁，生人昏迷，遭逢鬼魔杀害尤甚。 大限未终，横折无数。 阴魄不散，托结幽途。 茫茫冤魂，上冲震天。 卿可与十洞魔王、三五将吏，下降人间，禁伏阴鬼。 功成德合，升入无形，自然真极。 是时，北帝再拜受命。 总统十天大魔王，三五大将军，三师门下吏兵，天蓬杀童，北斗杀吏，巨兽飞吏，枭钩索飞吏，太上真神，天丁力士，天驺甲卒，南斗杀鬼使者，北斗火炬科车神吏，紫气前冲，流火万里，下降人间。 是时，阴鬼未睹天兵，十日已前，悉皆遭北帝太玄杀气，先冲脑裂，死向太半。 北帝将降，横天刮地。 上张天罗，下布地网。 天驺猛兽，纵横音窄，齿也。 齿。 天丁飞吏，斩破锤断。 或未变其形，隐藏无处。 或为龙蛇。 或为女童妖状，七日悉皆禁断。 是时，北帝将领天兵，归赴上元天中。 八景玉殿，朝拜天尊：臣奉圣旨下界，摄伏阴魔。 七日之内，应断北酆都罗山六洞鬼宫。 臣各使一大力魔王，专令守固镇压。 是时，北帝启天尊言：下元生人三九七五之岁，生人多积凶恶衅欣去声。 深惑重，招延洞中魔鬼，遥乘其虚耗，潜出人间。 或有收禁未尽。 或生人历数将终，阴洞自开。 不令禁制，流行人间。 四海五湖，七泽九江，五岳二十四治山川，坑坎洞穴隐没，为人灾难。 臣令三十万兵，常在人间巡行，捕逐生人急难。 诵臣此神名，咒一遍，魔鬼闻之，悉皆脑裂。 北帝曰：下元生人国土，或有岁凶谷俭，三灾刀兵，瘟疫流行，国人伤死，血光漂流。 即当清净，求请三洞道师，於国北门建竖北斗七元坛场，然灯散花，行道申表，诵吾六天神咒，旋绕七日、二七日，及四十九日。 北帝此时统领三五大将，天蓬部落，十天魔王，无鞅数众，大力天丁，飞雷电骑，枭钩索骑吏神王，威剑万丈南斗大神，北斗使者，紫气流火，隐□其所，扫除魔鬼，瘟疫血光、秽气氛氲，悉令清诤。 北帝曰：下元生世女人，怀孕死损，系嗣十九不成。 或怀胎一月二月，或至得生，或於胎中消死，或长成至七岁至十岁，无端夭伤。 此皆女人怀此血秽，为六洞天魔女鬼母飞随女人，食女人精气，胎血频遭损伤。 令女人痿黄恶瘦，梦想惊怪。 其鬼变形为猫鼠狸狗，梦中食人子息。 即当清净堂宇，求诸道师，依科置坛，醮北斗七元君，烧香然灯，诵吾神咒，行道忏谢。 或一日至七日，吾当使太玄夜光玉女一十二人侍卫女人，令不伤损，一一成就。 若有产死急难之时，为鬼母障闭，北陆阴秽鬼求食，啖产母之血，令产母楚痛，一日或七日，受苦难忍，呻昤昼夜。 当须清净庭院，建坛作法，诵咒行道。 吾当使九玄杀童、六丁玉女拥护产母，无令楚痛，所生男女皆异相，端好聪明贵达。
chunks.translated_text:
At that moment, the Heavenly Venerable clicked his teeth and remotely visualized the Supreme Yin Northern Emperor within the Five Qi Heavens of the North. Thereupon, the Northern Emperor, perceiving from afar, led the Ten Heavenly Demon-Kings, the Eight Radiant Great Spirits, the Thirty-Six Cavern Heaven Ding Warriors, the Three-Five Great Generals, the Lofty Banner Five Lakes Great General, the Valiant Northern Dipper Seven Primes Great General, the Guarding Spirits, the Innumerable Flying Thunder and Lightning Officers, the Mighty Beasts and Poisonous Dragons, and all lesser spirit-officers, along with the Great Power Flying Heavenly Ghost Hosts of the Northern Yin—all assembling at once at the appointed gathering place. There, girded with swords and jade pendants, holding tablets and pacing with measured steps, he twice bowed and knelt, saying: "Since I last attended your sacred banquet, barely ten kalpas have passed. Today, I remotely receive your secret decree and am granted the honor of beholding your holy countenance. I do not know what command or task the Most Sacred One has summoned me to perform."

Then the Heavenly Venerable addressed the Northern Emperor: "The yin ghosts and demons of the Northern Darkness have emerged into the human realm, wrongfully slaughtering more than half of the living. Now, in this year of the Three Nines and Seven Fives, the living are benighted, and the harm wrought by ghosts and demons is especially severe. Their allotted lifespans unfulfilled, countless numbers are cut down untimely. Their yin souls do not disperse, lingering and coalescing in the dark paths. Innumerable grieving spirits surge upward, shaking heaven. You, together with the Ten Cavern Demon-Kings and the Three-Five Generals and officers, must descend to the human world and restrain these yin ghosts. When your merit is complete and your virtue aligned, you shall ascend into the formless and naturally attain the true ultimate."

Thereupon, the Northern Emperor twice bowed and received the command. He assembled the Ten Heavenly Great Demon-Kings, the Three-Five Great Generals, the soldiers and officers under the Three Masters, the Heavenly Peng Killing Lads, the Northern Dipper Killing Officers, the Mighty Beast Flying Officers, the Owl-Hooked Lasso Flying Officers, the Supreme Perfected Spirits, the Heavenly Ding Warriors, the Heavenly Couriers and Armored Soldiers, the Southern Dipper Demon-Slaying Envoys, the Northern Dipper Torch-and-Chariot Divine Officers, with purple qi surging forth and flowing fire stretching for ten thousand miles, descending into the human realm. Before the yin ghosts had even glimpsed the heavenly troops, ten days prior, they had already all encountered the Northern Emperor’s Supreme Mystery Killing Qi, which first shattered their brains, killing more than half. As the Northern Emperor descended, the skies and earth were swept asunder. Above, the Heavenly Net was spread; below, the Earthly Web was laid. The Heavenly Couriers and fierce beasts charged forth with gnashing teeth. The Heavenly Ding Flying Officers severed and smashed, crushing all. Some, not yet transformed in shape, had no place to hide. Some became dragons or serpents; others took the form of demonic maidens. Within seven days, all were restrained and destroyed.

Thereupon, the Northern Emperor led the heavenly troops back to the Upper Prime Heaven. In the Eight Radiant Jade Palace, he paid homage to the Heavenly Venerable: "I, having received your sacred decree, descended to the lower realm and subdued the yin demons. Within seven days, I have broken the Six Cavern Ghost Palaces of Mount Fengdu in the North. I have assigned one Great Power Demon-King to each cavern, commanding them to guard and suppress it firmly."

Then the Northern Emperor addressed the Heavenly Venerable: "In the lower realm, during the Three Nines and Seven Fives of the human world, many have accumulated great wickedness and transgressions. Deeply deluded and heavily burdened, they have summoned the cavern demons, who remotely exploit their depletion and secretly emerge into the human world. Some may not have been fully restrained, or when a person’s allotted lifespan nears its end, the yin caverns open of their own accord. If not forbidden and controlled, they will spread throughout the human world—across the Four Seas and Five Lakes, the Seven Marshes and Nine Rivers, the Five Peaks and Twenty-Four Grotto-Heavens, the mountains and rivers, pits and caves—becoming disasters for humanity. I have dispatched three hundred thousand troops to constantly patrol the human realm, rescuing the living from dire straits. If one recites my divine name and chants this incantation once, upon hearing it, the demon-ghosts will all have their brains shattered."

The Northern Emperor said: "In the lands of the lower realm’s living, should there be years of famine and grain scarcity, the Three Disasters of warfare, or pestilence spreading widely, causing the people of the nation to perish and blood to flow like rivers, one must purify oneself and seek the Three Cavern Daoist Masters. At the northern gate of the nation, establish and erect a Northern Dipper Seven Primes altar, light lamps, scatter flowers, perform the Daoist rites, and submit memorials. Recite my Six Heavenly Spirit Incantations, circumambulating for seven days, fourteen days, or forty-nine days. At that time, I shall lead the Three-Five Great Generals, the Heavenly Peng Division, the Ten Heavenly Demon-Kings, the innumerable hosts, the Great Power Heavenly Ding Warriors, the Flying Thunder and Lightning Cavalry, the Owl-Hooked Lasso Cavalry Divine Kings, the Ten-Thousand-Zhang Mighty Sword Southern Dipper Great Spirits, the Northern Dipper Envoys, with purple qi and flowing fire, to conceal and protect that place, sweeping away demon-ghosts, pestilence, bloodshed, and the foul, turbid miasma, rendering all pure and clear."

The Northern Emperor said: "In the lower realm, when women are pregnant and suffer miscarriage or death, their descendants fail to thrive in nineteen out of twenty cases. Some carry a child for one or two months, or even to term, but the fetus perishes in the womb, or the child grows to seven or ten years old before dying untimely. This is all because the woman’s blood and impurity attract the Six Cavern Heaven Demon-Mothers and Ghost-Mothers, who fly after the woman, consuming her essence and qi, repeatedly harming the fetus and blood. This causes the woman to become emaciated, sallow, and weak, plagued by nightmares and terrifying visions. These ghosts transform into cats, rats, civets, or dogs, devouring the woman’s offspring in her dreams. One must purify the halls and chambers, seek out Daoist masters, and according to the rites, establish an altar to worship the Northern Dipper Seven Prime Lords. Burn incense, light lamps, recite my divine incantations, perform the Daoist rites, and offer repentance. For one to seven days, I shall dispatch the Twelve Supreme Mystery Night-Luminous Jade Maidens to guard the woman, ensuring no harm befalls her and all comes to fruition. If, during a difficult childbirth, the Ghost-Mother obstructs and the Northern Yin’s impure ghosts seek to feed, devouring the birthing mother’s blood, causing her excruciating pain for a day or seven days—suffering unbearable agony, moaning day and night—one must purify the courtyard, establish an altar, perform the rites, and recite the incantations. I shall send the Nine Mystery Killing Lads and the Six Ding Jade Maidens to protect the birthing mother, sparing her from pain. The children she bears, whether male or female, will all be extraordinary in appearance, upright, intelligent, noble, and successful."

Mount Fengdu, on the northern frontier of the Void Origin, resides the Divine Lord of the North, who commands an innumerable host of mighty demon-kings, celestial soldiers, and thunderous storm spirits of the yin realm—possessing immense power. Without the Divine Lord of the North, none can subdue them."

Miao Xing then addressed the Heavenly Venerable: "By what Daoist power may we summon this Divine Lord of the North, to save the living and spare them from the stench of corpses and daily harm?"

chunks.original_text: 北帝曰：若有下元生人，或遇天灾流行，瘟役病死，炎毒炽盛，人人困伏床枕，非横竞起。 或邪鬼侵夺住止屋宅。 或於生人行年本命之上，妄作灾衰，枷锁刑狱，执系禁锢，累岁经年，窒塞四方不通。 或久病在床，魂为魔鬼禁系幽司。 或为耗鬼拥塞，钱财流散，禄命衰微，所为不成。 当依科法，申奏章表，醮祭北斗七元君、五星二十八宿，行道诵咒，然灯散花，一日三日，七日四十九日。 吾当令北斗司命君削除黑簿，南斗司禁君移易生籍。 添年益寿，回灾转厄。 所有狂邪妖鬼，当使六天大魔王、三五大将军，驱除斩决，不令为难。 北帝曰：或有下元生人，求学道业，中道不成，退散迷忘，昏暗不通。 当清净斋沐，诵吾神咒。 或七遍至百遍，行住所止，不论秽触，但心存诵念，当降北斗七元君，清气入人心中，祛除心魔，外备百神，安稳吾藏，通畅心窍，开爽神情，所学克获。 北帝曰：下元生人，或泛大海江湖，遭遇风雷电掣，惊怖沉溺。 或山行林谷崄隘，晦暝夜行野止，豺狼虎兽龙蛇鬼怪种种恐怖。 当净心端坐，密诵吾此咒三七遍。 是时，六天魔王，天蓬大将，领本部神兵，及旷野大神，八景神王，五岳四渎江河溪涧大神，土地主者，应心下降围绕，不令惊怖，安稳无他，神色怡悦，众邪消散。 北帝曰：下元生人，有身无子孕。 此为洞天魔女鬼母与天狼贪狗食其精华，令绝种裔。 若求男女，当於堂房中置北斗灯坛，随师行道，烧香散花，诵吾神咒万遍，朝醮北斗，当降青腰玉女一十二人侍卫子藏，应愿得生，上相聪明，男女寿考。 北帝曰：下元生人，若能清挣身心，每日行住起止，常诵此咒七遍，或至一百遍。 晨昏念诵，所为无不成，就博戏求利，或见侯王贵人，常获欢喜，愿念和合。 北帝曰：下元田土所种五谷，为蝗虫众灾所损。 当须於田中作坛，依科诵咒七遍，或四十九遍。 吾当勑九州社令、后土土王，禁断三日，灾虫皆自消灭矣。 北帝曰：此是六洞天魔王，常为下元生人六害。 第一宫，害人财物，能令虚耗，钱财流散。 第二宫，害人生命，能令人身名不达，官爵衰退。 第三宫，害人爵禄，能令人窒塞，四方不通。 第四宫，害人田宅家舍，频有死亡灾害鬼怪，住止不安。 第五宫，害人妻妾，能令人频频丧死，或一至七。 第六宫，害人男女，能令不成，病死绝灭。 是此六害，常为六天魔鬼经营，生人与洞中六司掩塞，作生人害难。 若有志人，当欲除之。 但於清净山野外，或古坛静室之中，结坛行道，依科作法，三日七日至四十九日讫，当申表一通，名日六害表醮，六十囗#1六甲及五星二十八宿、太阳太阴宫，当须佩三五解六害大箓一品。 当降九宫玉童一百二十人，解害大将军及北斗斗中大神、天蓬部，行案六洞阴宫，检勘为害之所，一一分解，永断其殃，更不复缠绕生人。 北帝曰：下元生人，或为王侯征战阵敌。 当须佩九宫捍□六宫辟尸大箓，祭北斗七元君，及写此咒於箓中，佩於左膊音博。 临阵对敌，心密诵神咒七遍，六天魔王、天蓬大神、北斗使者、三元大将，密卫生人，令不伤损，得保清吉，永却血光非命之厄。 北帝曰：下元生人，或为恶人若欲侵害。 当存恶人於左足下，诵此咒一百三十遍恶人，自反凶为吉。
