The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan encounter celestial calamities and pestilential epidemics, or suffer from raging febrile toxins that confine all to bed, with misfortunes arising unbidden—whether malevolent ghosts seize their dwellings, or false disasters afflict their fate and natal stars, bringing cangues, fetters, imprisonment, and years of confinement, blocking all four directions; or long illness binds their souls, held captive by demonic spirits in the nether bureaus; or wasting ghosts obstruct their fortunes, scattering wealth and diminishing destiny, rendering all endeavors futile—then, in accordance with the ritual statutes, they must submit memorials and petitions, perform jiao offerings to the Seven Primordial Lords of the Northern Dipper and the Five Planets and Twenty-Eight Constellations, practice the Dao, recite incantations, light lamps, and scatter flowers for one, three, seven, or forty-nine days. I shall command the Life-Recording Lord of the Northern Dipper to expunge their names from the Black Register, and the Custodian Lord of the Southern Dipper to amend their entries in the Book of Life. Their years shall be extended, their lives prolonged, and disasters transformed into blessings. All mad and perverse demonic spirits shall be driven away and slain by the Great Demon Kings of the Six Heavens and the Generals of the Three and Five, preventing them from causing further harm.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan seek to study the Dao yet fail midway, becoming lost, confused, and unable to progress, they must purify themselves through fasting and bathing, then recite my divine incantation—seven times or up to a hundred—whether walking, standing, or resting, regardless of defilement. As long as the heart holds the recitation, the Seven Primordial Lords of the Northern Dipper shall descend, infusing their hearts with pure qi, dispelling inner demons, fortifying the body with a hundred spirits, stabilizing their inner sanctuary, unblocking the heart’s orifices, and invigorating the spirit. Thus, their studies shall bear fruit.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan traverse great seas, rivers, or lakes and encounter storms with thunder, lightning, and crashing waves, or journey through perilous mountains, forests, and valleys at dusk, spending nights in the wilderness amid the terrors of wolves, tigers, dragons, serpents, and spectral horrors—they must purify their hearts, sit upright, and silently recite this incantation twenty-one times. Then, the Demon Kings of the Six Heavens, the Great General Tianpeng, and their divine hosts, along with the deities of the wilds, the Eight Radiant Spirit Kings, the gods of the Five Peaks, Four Waterways, rivers, streams, and valleys, and the local earth spirits shall descend in response, encircling and protecting them. Fear shall vanish, safety ensured, their spirits calmed, and all malevolent forces dispersed.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan remain childless, it is because the Cavern-Heaven Demon Maidens and Ghost-Mothers, along with the Celestial Wolf and the Greedy Dog, devour their essence, severing their lineage. To conceive a child, they must set up a Northern Dipper lamp altar in their chamber, follow a master in practicing the Dao, burn incense, scatter flowers, recite my divine incantation ten thousand times, and offer morning jiao rites to the Northern Dipper. Then, the Twelve Jade Maidens of the Azure Waist shall descend to guard their womb, fulfilling their wish for offspring—children of exceptional appearance, intelligence, and longevity, whether male or female.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan purify their bodies and minds, reciting this incantation seven times or up to a hundred daily, whether in motion or at rest, morning or evening, all their endeavors shall succeed. Even in gambling or seeking profit, or when meeting nobles and rulers, they shall always find joy, their wishes harmonized.

The Northern Thearch said: Should the five grains sown in the fields of the Lower Yuan be ravaged by locusts or other disasters, they must erect an altar in the field and recite the incantation seven or forty-nine times in accordance with the ritual statutes. I shall command the Earth Lords of the Nine Provinces and the Earth Thearch to enforce a three-day prohibition, and all pestilent insects shall vanish of their own accord.

The Northern Thearch said: These are the Six Demon Kings of the Six Cavern-Heavens, who perpetrate six harms upon those born in the Lower Yuan. The First Palace harms wealth, causing depletion and dissipation. The Second Palace harms life, obstructing success and causing official rank to decline. The Third Palace harms rank and emolument, blocking all four directions. The Fourth Palace harms fields, dwellings, and households, bringing frequent deaths, disasters, and spectral disturbances, rendering habitation unstable. The Fifth Palace harms wives and concubines, causing repeated deaths, from one to seven. The Sixth Palace harms children, preventing their birth or causing illness and extinction. These six harms are perpetrated by the demonic spirits of the Six Heavens, who conspire with the Six Bureaus of the Caverns to obstruct and afflict mortals. Those of resolve who wish to eliminate them must do so in a pure wilderness or a quiet chamber of an ancient altar, erecting an altar and practicing the Dao according to the ritual statutes for three, seven, or up to forty-nine days. They must submit a memorial, called the "Six Harms Memorial Jiao," to the Six Jia Spirits, the Five Planets, the Twenty-Eight Constellations, and the Palaces of the Sun and Moon. They must also wear the Great Register for Dissolving the Six Harms of the Three and Five. Then, the One Hundred Twenty Jade Lads of the Nine Palaces shall descend, along with the Great Generals for Dissolving Harms, the great spirits within the Northern Dipper, and the hosts of Tianpeng. They shall traverse the Six Yin Palaces of the Caverns, investigating and resolving each source of harm, permanently severing the calamities so they no longer entangle mortals.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan be conscripted by kings or nobles for battle, they must wear the Great Register of the Nine Palaces for Warding Off the Six Palaces and Averting Corpses, offer sacrifices to the Seven Primordial Lords of the Northern Dipper, and inscribe this incantation within the register, wearing it on the left arm. When facing the enemy in battle, they must silently recite the divine incantation seven times. Then, the Demon Kings of the Six Heavens, the Great General Tianpeng, the Envoys of the Northern Dipper, and the Great Generals of the Three Primordials shall secretly protect them, preventing injury and ensuring safety, forever averting the misfortune of violent death.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan face harm from evil persons, they must visualize the malefactor beneath their left foot and recite this incantation one hundred thirty times. The evil person shall then turn misfortune into fortune.

chunks.original_text: 北帝曰：下元生人，有知酆都六洞天官名，则百鬼不敢为害。 凡欲卧时，常先面向北，叩齿七通，诵咒三遍，微其音曰： 吾是帝君之臣，名书玉清，下统六天。 北帝鬼宫，悉是我营。 我之所部，何鬼敢生。 左佩豁落，右带火铃。 掷火万里，威制千灵。 有犯者戮，有干者刑。 帝君有命，收捕不停。 天光骇动，群魔东#2形。 鬼妖灭种，我得长生。 急急如帝君勑律令。 谨按《天关三图上清经》曰：酆都山在北方癸地，故东北为鬼户，死气之根，山高二千六百里，周回三万里。 其山之洞宫，在山之下，周回一万五千里。 其上下并有鬼神宫室，山上有十二宫领鬼，山下有十二宫统神。 每一宫周回千里，上宫左右各六宫，下官左右各六宫，故二十四宫也。 上六宫名： 第一宫名纣绝阴天宫。 第二宫名泰杀谅事宗天宫。 第三宫名明晨耐犯武城天官。 第四宫名恬照罪气天官。 第五宫名宗灵七非天官。 第六宫名敢司连宛屡天官。 下六宫名： 第一宫名休明总灵洞天宫。 第二官名玄司重正宗灵天宫。 第三宫名统仙升灵希微天宫。 第四宫名正真邵灵宛司天官。 第五宫名云娄玉纪明天宫。 第六宫名崇虚赤映云田天宫。 一咒则天地先骇，万魔束形。 二咒则鬼妖灭种，六天绝人死名。 世人学道，不知酆都宫名，神鬼所治。 不能断塞死根，使后学者万无得成也。 北帝曰：下元生人，或男或女，夜中经行及睡卧之时，诵六天宫名者，诸鬼魔闻之，皆自成血糜音迷。 散不得高声，损鬼尤甚。 若无患害诵咒，先发愿者，吾所诵六天门名咒，用安魂定魄，不损阴冥。 尔咒曰： 纣绝标帝晨，谅事构重二。 炎如霄中姻，勃若景耀华。 武城一神峰，恬照吞青河。 阊阖临丹井，云门郁嵯峨。 七非通奇盖，连宛亦敷魔。 六天横北道，此是鬼神家。 辟虎毒王，六天鬼王，震拾罗铃，北帝魔王，四天皛晶，酆都鬼相，巴元丑伯，九天都录，总领大魔，敢不从命。 北帝曰：臣所说此咒者，名北帝神咒，皆是摧斩啖食六天鬼神也。 下元生人； 若老若少，若男若女，贫贱困卑，当行坐止息，诵此神咒，所求无不克者。 诸魔鬼退散，即生神气。 专志坚固，无诸滞碍。 所求合道。
chunks.translated_text:
The Northern Thearch said: Those born in the Lower Yuan who know the names of the Six Heavenly Offices of Fengdu shall find that the hundred ghosts dare not harm them. Whenever one wishes to sleep, one must first face north, click the teeth seven times, and recite the incantation thrice in a soft voice, saying:

I am a minister of the Thearch,
my name inscribed in Jade Purity,
governing the Six Heavens below.
The ghostly palaces of the Northern Thearch
are all within my command.
Of those under my jurisdiction,
what ghost dare arise?
On my left hangs the *huoluo* blade,
on my right the fire-bell.
I hurl fire ten thousand leagues,
my might subduing the thousand spirits.
Those who offend shall be slain,
those who trespass shall be punished.
By the Thearch’s decree,
their capture shall not cease.
Heavenly light shakes in terror,
the host of demons takes flight to the east.
Ghosts and demons are annihilated,
and I attain long life.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Thearch’s decree and ordinance command.

According to the *Heavenly Pass Three Charts, Highest Clarity Scripture*: Mount Fengdu lies in the north, in the *gui* region, thus the northeast is the Ghost Gate, the root of dead *qi*. The mountain rises two thousand six hundred *li* high, with a circumference of thirty thousand *li*. Its cavern-palaces lie beneath the mountain, with a circumference of fifteen thousand *li*. Above and below, there are ghostly and divine halls. Atop the mountain are twelve palaces governing ghosts, and below are twelve palaces ruling spirits. Each palace spans a thousand *li* in circumference. Above, six palaces lie to the left and six to the right; below, six lie to the left and six to the right—thus twenty-four palaces in all.

The names of the upper six palaces are:
1. The Palace of Zhou’s Absolute Yin
2. The Palace of Tai’s Punitive Judgment
3. The Palace of Bright Dawn’s Enduring Offense
4. The Palace of Serene Illumination’s Sinful *Qi*
5. The Palace of Ancestral Numinosity’s Seven Transgressions
6. The Palace of Daring Governance’s Boundless Connections

The names of the lower six palaces are:
1. The Palace of Restful Clarity’s General Numinosity
2. The Palace of Mysterious Governance’s Weighty Rectitude
3. The Palace of Uniting Immortals’ Ascendant Subtlety
4. The Palace of Upright Perfection’s Lingering Governance
5. The Palace of Cloudy Storehouses’ Jade Records
6. The Palace of Lofty Emptiness’ Crimson Radiance

Reciting this incantation once shall first strike terror into heaven and earth, binding the myriad demons. Reciting it twice shall annihilate ghosts and demons, severing the dead names of the Six Heavens. Those who study the Dao yet do not know the names of the Fengdu palaces—the domains of gods and ghosts—shall be unable to cut off the root of death, rendering all later learners incapable of success.

The Northern Thearch said: Those born in the Lower Yuan, whether man or woman, when traveling at night or lying down to sleep, who recite the names of the Six Heavenly Palaces shall cause all ghostly demons to hear and dissolve into bloody pulp. They must not recite loudly, for this harms ghosts all the more. If one recites the incantation without affliction, one must first make a vow: "I recite the names of the Six Heavenly Gates to pacify the hun and settle the po, without harming the netherworld." This incantation reads:

Zhou’s Absolute marks the Thearch’s dawn,
Judgment’s weight constructs the second.
Flaming as clouds in the sky,
bursting like radiant splendor.
A divine peak at Martial City,
Serene Illumination swallows the Azure River.
The Gate of Heaven looms over the Cinnabar Well,
Cloud Gate rises in towering majesty.
Seven Transgressions link the wondrous canopy,
Boundless Connections spread their demonic sway.
The Six Heavens cross the northern path—
this is the home of gods and ghosts.

Expel the Poisonous Tiger King,
the Six Heavenly Ghost Kings,
the Thunderclap and Gathered Bells,
the Northern Thearch’s Demon Kings,
the Four Heavenly Luminaries,
the Fengdu Ghost Ministers,
Ba Yuan’s Ugly Earl,
the Nine Heavens’ Registers—
all great demons under my command,
dare you not obey?

The Northern Thearch said: This incantation I have spoken is called the Northern Thearch’s Divine Incantation, for it crushes and devours the ghostly gods of the Six Heavens. Those born in the Lower Yuan—whether old or young, man or woman, poor or humble—who recite this divine incantation while walking, sitting, or resting shall find all their desires fulfilled. All demonic ghosts shall retreat and disperse, and one’s spirit and *qi* shall flourish. With single-minded resolve and steadfastness, all obstacles shall be removed, and all one seeks shall align with the Dao.
chunks.overlap_context:
Heavens, the Great General Tianpeng, the Envoys of the Northern Dipper, and the Great Generals of the Three Primordials shall secretly protect them, preventing injury and ensuring safety, forever averting the misfortune of violent death.

The Northern Thearch said: Should those born in the Lower Yuan face harm from evil persons, they must visualize the malefactor beneath their left foot and recite this incantation one hundred thirty times. The evil person shall then turn misfortune into fortune.

chunks.original_text: 北方黑帝五灵玄老大神咒，但每持念之时，先存天蓬神将，四面六手，各执戈剑、弓箭、金矛音牟、戟等六物，身长五十丈，披金矛铠音凯。 甲，光赫万里，叱音尺。 咤音叱。 震怒，领神兵三十万人，黑衣玄冠来下，禁灭邪妖。 叩左齿三十六通，次叩右齿三十六通，次呜天鼓二十四通，然后转身北面，次坐建王方向破地，乃微音咒曰： 天蓬天蓬，此是四面天兵，各领四万人，布声如虎音。 九玄杀童。 此是上清禹余天大赤天上法中上清三洞法三天兵符，管天煞大神百亿万人世。 五丁都司，此是六丁神女在三天门下声诵，三十六司中各有六万人到者煞急，北帝三煞神兵一十一万人也。 高刁北功。 此是北帝一洞天中北帝三煞神一十一万人也。 七政八灵，此是北帝七星真人七千四百人，常居师之左右，以听善恶也。 太上浩凶。 此是太上三将军，有三千万众，待立师长前，祛散邪魅也长颅巨兽，此是四海龙王四千四百人，收摄山精野鬼诛斩之。 手把帝锺。 此是五岳四渍河海大神，各有五万人，在此禁坛修斋用。 素枭三神，严驾夔龙。 并是三天魔王，有三千兵马，常在人间，虚空听人善恶。 在斋堂或有疑惑者，当存此神，以镇其所也。 威剑神王，斩邪灭踪。 并是风神主海神，各八千人，请雨时存之。 紫气乘天，并是兵魔都统王，管此世间人名煞恶，存以下声也。 丹霞赫冲。 并是女青诏书玄都大神，百亿万人，灵官章醮存，常在左右。 吞魔食鬼，横身饮风。 此是二十四天鬼神，常收伪得便斩者，勑召存此。 治救疾病瘟疫官私口舌并存之。 此六万人。 苍舌绿齿，四目老翁。 并是日月星辰之王，各有八千人，移山塞海存此神。 天丁力士，威南御凶。 天驺激戾，威北衔。 此是上清法中将，各有一千二百人常随，师诵经时存之。 三十万兵，卫我九重。 辟尸千里，祛却不祥。 并是六丁八史大神，各有八万五千人，诵经时及传符箓存之。 敢有小鬼，欲来见状。 镬天大斧，斩鬼五形。 此是五帝兵马三洞天官，有三千万众，常随师之左右。 修真之时存之。 炎帝裂血，北帝燃骨。 四明破骸，天猷灭类。 此是四明功曹使者，三千六百人，随师左右，以听善恶。 常须存好事，不得起心形恶念之。 神刀一下，万鬼自溃。 此是北帝黑煞大神王，煞鬼存之。 虚空中并闻。 鬼叫之声也。 急急如太上老君律令。 右三十六句，四言一叩齿。 北帝曰：诵吾神咒，行吾此道，守护科禁。 吾当与北方三十洞天君，天蓬大将军，十极八景大神飞天，猛兽隐蔽，不离生人，围绕侍卫，令一切爱念无所滞碍。 诵此咒或七遍，或至四十九遍，一百二十遍讫。 即啄齿，呜天鼓，击天磬，各三十六通。 又更诵此后咒三遍或七遍，即行寝外无妨，名净天地咒。 所居秽恶，常念解秽辟尸咒：按经云所叩齿，使内外虚彻，才似耳闻也。 洞中玄虚，晃朗太元。 八方威神，使我自然。
chunks.translated_text:
The Northern Black Thearch’s Five Numinous Mysterious Elder Divine Incantation—whenever one holds and recites it, first visualize the Heavenly Peng Divine General: four-faced, six-armed, each hand wielding a halberd, sword, bow and arrow, golden spear, *yinmou*, and halberd, his body fifty *zhang* in height, clad in golden spear armor, radiant for ten thousand *li*, his roar shaking the earth. Leading a divine host of three hundred thousand, clad in black robes and dark crowns, they descend to suppress and extinguish evil spirits. Strike the left teeth thirty-six times, then the right teeth thirty-six times, then sound the Heavenly Drum twenty-four times. Then turn to face north, sit facing the *Wang* direction to break the earth, and softly intone the incantation:

Heavenly Peng, Heavenly Peng,
these are the four-faced heavenly soldiers,
each leading forty thousand men,
their voices like the roar of tigers.
Nine Mysteries Slaying Youth—
this is the Shangqing Yu Yu Heaven Great Crimson Heaven’s method,
the Shangqing Three Caverns method’s Three Heavenly Soldiers talisman,
commanding the Heaven-Slaying Great Gods of a hundred million myriad worlds.
Five Ding Commanders—
these are the Six Ding divine maidens at the Three Heavenly Gates,
reciting aloud, with thirty-six bureaus each dispatching sixty thousand to slay swiftly.
Northern Thearch’s Three Slaying Divine Soldiers, one hundred ten thousand strong.
High Di, Northern Gong—
these are the Northern Thearch’s Three Slaying Divine Soldiers in the Northern Thearch’s One Cavern Heaven, one hundred ten thousand strong.
Seven Governances, Eight Numinous Ones—
these are the Northern Thearch’s Seven Stars Perfected, seven thousand four hundred,
ever at the master’s left and right, listening to good and evil.
Supreme Lord Vast Ferocity—
these are the Three Generals of the Supreme Lord, thirty million strong,
standing before the master’s presence to dispel and scatter evil spirits.
Long-Skulled Mighty Beasts—
these are the Four Seas Dragon Kings, four thousand four hundred,
seizing and capturing mountain spirits and wild ghosts to execute them.
Hand Grasping the Thearch’s Bell—
these are the Five Marchmounts, Four Streams, rivers, and seas’ great gods,
each with fifty thousand, employed in altar rites and purification fasts.
Three Pale Owl Gods, Sternly Mounting Kui Dragons—
these are the Three Heavenly Demon Kings, with three thousand troops,
ever in the human realm, listening in the void to human good and evil.
When in the purification hall doubts arise, visualize these gods to stabilize the place.
Mighty Sword Divine King, Slaying Evil and Erasing Traces—
these are the Wind Gods and Sea Lords, each with eight thousand,
to be visualized when praying for rain.
Purple Qi Riding the Heavens—
these are the Marshal Kings of the Hosts of Demons,
commanding the slaying of evil in this world’s people; recite in a low voice.
Cinnabar Clouds Blazing Surge—
these are the Dark Capital’s Great Gods of the Jade Purity Edict,
a hundred million myriad strong, visualized in spirit-official petitions, ever at one’s side.
Devouring Demons and Feeding on Ghosts, Body Bared to Drink the Wind—
these are the twenty-four heavenly ghost gods,
ever seizing the false to execute them; visualize when summoning.
To cure illnesses, epidemics, public and private disputes, visualize these—sixty thousand strong.
Green-Tongued, Green-Teethed, Four-Eyed Elder—
these are the Kings of the Sun, Moon, and Stars, each with eight thousand,
to be visualized when moving mountains and damming seas.
Heavenly Ding Warriors, Ferocious Southward Guardians—
Heavenly Couriers, Fierce Northward Chargers—
these are the generals of the Shangqing method, each with one thousand two hundred,
ever following when the master recites scriptures; visualize them.
Three hundred thousand soldiers, guarding my ninefold layers,
warding off corpses for a thousand *li*, dispelling misfortune.
These are the Six Ding and Eight Scribes Great Gods, each with eighty-five thousand,
visualized when reciting scriptures and transmitting talismans.
Dare any petty ghost approach to witness this?
Cauldron of Heaven’s Great Axe, slaying the five forms of ghosts—
these are the Three Caverns Heavenly Officials of the Five Thearchs’ troops, thirty million strong,
ever at the master’s left and right; visualize when cultivating the Real.
Blazing Thearch Splitting Blood, Northern Thearch Burning Bones—
Four Luminaries Shattering Skeletons, Heavenly Plan Annihilating Species—
these are the Four Luminaries’ Merit Officers, three thousand six hundred,
ever at the master’s side, listening to good and evil.
One must always visualize good deeds, never harbor evil thoughts.
With one stroke of the divine blade, ten thousand ghosts scatter—
this is the Northern Thearch’s Black Slaying Great Divine King; visualize to slay ghosts.
In the void, all hear the cries of ghosts.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Supreme Venerable Lord’s ordinance commands.

These thirty-six lines, four characters each, are recited with one strike of the teeth.

The Northern Thearch said: Recite my divine incantation, practice my Way, and uphold my precepts and prohibitions. I shall command the Thirty Cavern Lords of the North, the Heavenly Peng Great General, the Ten Poles and Eight Sceneries’ Great Flying Divine Beasts, and hidden ferocious beasts, never leaving the living, encircling and guarding them, so that all attachments and desires encounter no obstacles. Recite this incantation either seven times, or up to forty-nine times, or one hundred twenty times, then strike the teeth, sound the Heavenly Drum, and strike the Heavenly Chime, each thirty-six times. Then recite this subsequent incantation three or seven times before retiring; there is no harm in doing so outside. This is called the Heaven and Earth Purification Incantation. For any defilement in one’s dwelling, constantly recite the Defilement-Dispelling, Corpse-Averting Incantation:

As the scripture states, strike the teeth so that inner and outer are emptied and resonant, as if heard by the ear.
Within the Cavern’s Mysterious Void, radiant and vast is the Great Primordial.
The mighty gods of the eight directions make me natural.

chunks.original_text: 灵宝符命，普告九天。 乾罗怛那，洞罡太玄。 斩妖缚邪，杀鬼万千。 中山神咒，元始玉文。 我诵一遍，却鬼延年。 按行五岳，八海知闻。 魔王束手，侍卫我轩。 凶秽消散，道气长存。 急急如律令。 道言：此咒北帝神秘之法，若世人得此，常能行之，可以制御诸恶，添福益算，延年度厄，禳灾却祸，救护生人，无有枉横，男女长幼，总可奉行。 陶真人曰：吾昔於天台学道未成就，常为山鬼所扰，见形露体，互来惊怖。 吾常闻此道，未尝行之。 依法戒行七日讫，因经行所居之处，去室百步外，见血流遍地，尸臭音臭。 盈谷。 闻有人哭声，词理哀切。

The Numinous Treasure Talisman’s Decree universally proclaims to the Nine Heavens:
*Qianluo Danna*, penetrating the Firmament’s Great Mystery.
Severing demons, binding evil, slaying ten thousand ghosts.
The Central Mountain’s divine incantation, the Primordial Jade Scripture’s text.
I recite it once, and demons retreat while years extend.
Traversing the Five Peaks, the Eight Seas take heed.

Both men and women, young and old, may all uphold it.

Master Tao of the Pottery said: Long ago, when I studied the Dao at Tiantai but had not yet attained accomplishment, I was constantly harassed by mountain ghosts—appearing in bodily form, unclothed, startling and terrifying me. Though I had often heard of this Dao, I had never practiced it. After observing the precepts and practicing for seven days, I walked through my dwelling’s surroundings, and a hundred paces beyond the chamber, I saw blood flowing across the ground, the stench of corpses and foul odors filling the valley. I heard the sound of weeping, its words piteous and sorrowful.

chunks.original_text: 云：陶弘景，陶弘景，夺我居止，伤我性命。 自后，更不复高声。 持诵之久，如与百神同游，长生可取。 王真人曰：吾先师张天师奉太上命，战夺蜀郡二十四治鬼营，救护生人。 一战二十四治大鬼帅，一时降伏，诸徒吏悉禁闭在治下，今为山二十四狱鬼，竟不能出。 皆得太上降此北帝神咒，吾师临鬼一咒，天兵及三五大将天蓬部落一时降下，往无不伏者，是天蓬第九星辰也。 郑思远曰：五闻太上北华仙人，教始学道士，受以此道，诵之万遍。 先灭妖魅不祥，立见真道。 吾思之，不可得闻。 后东华山遇左仙翁，谓吾曰：子欲拜受北酆都山大帝图箓神咒，章醮驱邪除鬼，得修真之道，当以信帛香油质命，方与子受此，是太素元君玄母之道，不可妄传於迷乱之夫、行尸走骨之辈。 若不敬之，殃逮祖考。 吾受之，克见真道。
chunks.translated_text:
They cried out: "Tao Hongjing, Tao Hongjing, you have seized our dwelling and harmed our lives!" Thereafter, they never again raised their voices in such clamor. With prolonged recitation, one may wander in the company of the hundred spirits, and long life may be attained.

Master Wang the Perfected said: My former teacher, Celestial Master Zhang, by the command of the Most High, battled to seize the twenty-four demonic encampments of Shu Prefecture, rescuing and protecting the living. In a single battle against the great demonic chieftains of the twenty-four encampments, he subdued them all at once, confining their underlings and officers beneath the encampments. Now they have become the twenty-four mountain prisons for demons, utterly unable to escape. All this was achieved by the Most High’s transmission of this Divine Incantation of the Northern Emperor. When my teacher confronted the demons with a single recitation, the celestial soldiers and the three to five great generals of the Tianpeng host descended at once. None failed to submit—this is the ninth stellar spirit of Tianpeng.

Zheng Siyuan said: I once heard that the Northern Flower Immortal of the Most High taught this Dao to novice Daoists, instructing them to recite it ten thousand times. First, it extinguishes inauspicious specters and malevolent spirits, and the true Dao is immediately revealed. I longed for this but could not obtain it. Later, on Eastern Flower Mountain, I encountered the Left Immortal Elder, who said to me: "If you wish to receive the talismanic charts and divine incantations of the Great Emperor of Mount Fengdu in the Northern Feng, to perform rituals, dispel evil, and expel demons, thereby attaining the Dao of cultivating truth, you must offer silk, incense, and oil as a pledge of sincerity. Only then will I transmit this to you—this is the Dao of the Primordial Lady of the Great Simplicity, the Mysterious Mother. It must not be recklessly passed to deluded and disordered men, or to those who are but walking corpses and wandering bones. If one fails to revere it, calamity will extend to one’s ancestors." I received it and thereby beheld the true Dao.

chunks.original_text: 元始天尊，尔时游历诸天，成就国界，济度人民，广宣妙法。 见下元生人，有诸灾妖鬼气流行，九丑之精枉害良善。 因作是想，三界转轮，冤对弥多，国土不安，兵戈乱起，作何救助？ 以保兆民。 於是召命北帝真君，演其济度之法。 北帝曰：臣酆都之旨，伏鬼消魔七元之坛，保家安国，大圣所使，即降真灵。 尔时，天尊闻北帝应声秘要，愿而奉行。 北帝曰：其咒甚妙，宜长斋念诵，身得长生，飞腾虚空。 北帝分身咒曰： 谨勑臣身中五体真官，魂为天父，魄为地母，头为雷公，发为黑云，顶为明星，脑为朱雀，眉为麒麟，眼为日月，鼻为虎贲，上唇为风伯，下唇为雨师，舌为九州都督，喉为璇玑，左臂为玉衡却敌，右臂为玉衡破敌，掌为火车，指为甲卒，两乳为仙童，脑骨为横山，脊骨为蓬山，胁骨为名山，腹为金城，肝为青帝，肾为黑帝，脾为黄帝，心为赤帝，肺为白帝，胆为太乙，肠为龙虎，腋为禁狱，脐为江湖，石子为织女，膀胱为河伯，血为河水，脉为螣蛇，胃为勾陈，皮为天罗，肉为地网，臀音屯。 为玄武，阴为八蛮，腿为双童，膍音昆。 为力士，膝为刚风，胫为师子，足为白马，手为三将军，各领七千万众。 兵士抽刀拔剑，乘驾火车，从臣身中出。 急急如律令。 此咒伏一切鬼神。 如癫邪，即念三徧。 如小可，切不得念，损子魂魄。 慎之。 入房退病天蓬敕水咒： 咄，吾是天帝太上之子，为老君所使。 头戴日月，身佩北斗。

chunks.original_text: 或寒或热，举体不宁。 九丑之鬼，知汝姓名。 北帝神咒，摄录汝精。 四明破骸，北斗然明。 神刀一下，万鬼自刑。 伤寒头痛，不得妄生。 东方木气，灭汝身形。 伏在脾中，不得动倾。 急急如律令。 斩温之法成功后，先念天蓬上咒。 日用功满，甲子日佩大箓，及作法建立七元坛者，先念吾敕五岳水咒曰： 吾是太上之臣，名书玉清，上统六天。 北帝鬼宫，悉是我之所营。 我之所部，何鬼敢生。 左佩豁落，右带火铃。 掷火万里，威制千灵。 有犯者戮，有干者刑。 帝君有命，收捕不停。 天光骇音蟹。 动，群邪束形。 鬼妖灭类，我得长生。 急急如律令。 帝君曰：念咒毕，即念吾召十天魔王、八景大神、三十六洞天大威力、天丁力士、三五禁气大将军、卫灵大神、飞雷电骑神咒，曰： 罗天毒兽，备卫四门。 神兵万众，九丑万群。 张喉镢天，猛马高奔。 毒龙奋瓜，金头横吞。 威兵巨万，受符校仙。 六天不拘，合凶成群。 妖魔蛊魅，秽气纷纷。 谣歌空洞，乱香阵云。 小鬼假形，当人生门。 神王所告，无有不闻。 上摄六气，下检河源。 五岳四渎，善恶速分。 千千万万，来对我前。 五帝校录，有功者原。 凶魔千神，束形乱鞭。 敢不从命，所诛无捐。 屠肝杵胆，斩首灭形。 北镢清汤，南陵火焚。 金真戮气，流铃捕魂。 妖爽无遗，荡尽邪源。 身佩天书，道行正文。 涤荡九气，清明三元。 玄灵举真，上合自然。 莫有干试，斩后闻天。 急急如律令。 北帝曰：但念南方卫灵咒讫，即禁坛咒曰： 朱雀陵光，神威内张。 山源四镇，鬼井逃亡。 神池吐气，邪精内藏。 魂台四明，琼户玲琅。 玉真巍峨，坐镇明堂。 手挥紫霞，头建神光。 执咏洞经，三十九章。 中有辟邪，龙虎斩罡。 猛兽奔牛，衔刀吞镶。 揭山镬天，神雀毒龙。 六颔吐火，啖鬼之王。 电猪雷父，掣星流横。 枭磕驳灼，逆风横行。 天禽罗阵，皆在我傍。 吐火万丈，以除不祥。 群精启道，封落山乡。 千神万灵，并手叩颡。 泽尉捧炉，为我烧香。 所在所经，万神奉迎。 天兽来卫，千精振伏，莫干我气。 急急如律令。 出房复立。 国中却蝗虫灾符 北帝曰：若国土州县，遭蝗虫降下，万民惶惶。 不安业者，但於州北门前建七元坛，行道将吾灵符二道。 一道生铁书，掷於州河之中，当变为黑气冲天，甘露降下。 又一道以梓木，用雌黄书之，埋於土地庙中，入地一尺二寸，其蝗虫当时消死矣。 右符，用生铁一方，朱书，掷於国大河中。 北帝曰：禁坛讫，行道求心中耳。 用梓木板长一尺二寸书之，埋安土地庙中，其虫消死矣。 北酆杀鬼印 北帝曰：下元生人，若男若女，被山魑古魅、神坛里社、妖精野怪，使其病人。 狂言乱语，入水不惧生死，将吾北酆印，印病人心，其病立差。 以枣木心刻之，一年三度醮祭，然后行用矣。 北帝曰：吾於上经卷中，宣题下元生人有诸苦难等。 官符口舌，疾病灾怪，或入军阵之中临当被敌，一切癫痫。 但带吾此符，应日立愈。 入军阵者，头上带之，一当百人，永离刀伤之厄，神兵相佑矣。 北帝曰：下元生人有心中不快，频遭死殃。 或女人身孕不成，男女死损。 及被恶人谋枉，咒诅相刑。 但吾火铃帝箓厌之，大吉。 右符出衡山录。 北帝曰：若封山岳，敕古庙，召五岳神，来闻未来之事，及移山覆海，驱遣妖精。

Chills and fever wrack the body, leaving no peace. The Nine Ugly Ghosts know your name. The Northern Thearch’s divine incantation captures and records your essence. The Four Luminaries shatter your bones, the Northern Dipper blazes bright. With a single stroke of the divine blade, the ten thousand ghosts punish themselves. Chills and headaches, feverish pains—you shall not recklessly arise. The wood *qi* of the East extinguishes your form. Subdued within the spleen, you shall not stir or topple. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

Once the Rite of Slaying Pestilence is complete, first recite the Heavenly Peng’s upper incantation. When daily practice is fulfilled on the *jiazi* day, wear the Great Register and establish the Seven Primes Altar. First recite my command to the Five Marchmounts’ Water Incantation:

I am a minister of the Most High, my name inscribed in Jade Clarity, supreme over the Six Heavens. The Northern Thearch’s Ghostly Palace is entirely my domain. All under my command—what ghost dares arise? On my left hangs the *huoluo* blade, on my right the Fire Bell. Casting fire ten thousand leagues, my might subdues a thousand spirits. Those who offend are slain, those who resist are punished. The Imperial Lord commands: seize and capture without cease. Heavenly light and thunderous roars—move, and the myriad evils bind themselves. Ghosts and demons perish utterly; I attain long life. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

The Imperial Lord says: Upon finishing the incantation, immediately recite my summons to the Ten Heavenly Demon Kings, the Eight Radiant Great Spirits, the Thirty-Six Grotto-Heavens’ Mighty Powers, the Heavenly *Ding* Warriors, the Generals of the Three-Five Forbidden *Qi*, the Guardians of the Numinous, and the Flying Thunderbolt Cavalry Incantation:

Beasts of the Poisonous Heavens, guard the four gates. Divine soldiers by the myriad, the Nine Ugly by the ten thousand. Throats gape to split the sky, fierce steeds gallop high. Poisonous dragons brandish claws, golden heads devour sideways. Mighty warriors by the countless thousands receive the talisman and examine the immortals. The Six Heavens unrestrained, banding malevolence into hordes. Demons, goblins, and specters—foul *qi* swirls in chaos. Hollow songs echo, incense clouds scatter in disarray. Lesser ghosts assume false forms, blocking the Gate of Human Life. What the Divine Kings proclaim, none fail to hear. Above, they seize the Six *Qi*; below, they inspect the river sources. The Five Marchmounts and Four Waterways swiftly distinguish good from evil. By the thousands, by the ten thousands, come before me. The Five Thearchs record merits—those with merit are pardoned. Malevolent demons and spirits are bound and lashed. Dare disobey, and none escape execution. Livers are hacked, gall crushed, heads severed, forms annihilated. Northward, the *jue* cleaves the clear broth; southward, fire burns at Nanshan. The Golden Perfected slays *qi*, the Flowing Bell captures souls. No demonic essence remains; all evil sources are swept away. Bearing the Heavenly Script, the Dao’s true writ is followed. The Nine *Qi* are cleansed, the Three Primes made clear. The Mysterious Numinous ascends in truth, uniting with the natural. None dare test me—after the slaying, report to Heaven. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

The Northern Thearch says: After reciting the Southern Guardian Incantation, then recite the Altar-Binding Incantation:

The Vermilion Bird’s radiance presses inward, divine might expands within. The four mountain sources are guarded; ghostly wells flee in terror. The spirit pool exhales *qi*, evil essences hide within. The Soul Terrace’s Four Luminaries, the jade doors gleam. The Jade Perfected stands majestic, seated to guard the Hall of Light. Hands wield the purple aurora, head crowned with divine radiance. Reciting the Grotto Scriptures, thirty-nine chapters. Within lies the demon-expelling, dragon-tiger slaying *gang*. Fierce beasts and charging oxen, blades in jaws, swallowing metal. Uplifting mountains, cauldrons overturning the sky, divine birds and poisonous dragons. Six jaws spew fire, devouring the King of Ghosts. Lightning boars and thunder fathers, dragging stars in streaks. Owls and blazing hybrids, moving crosswind. Heavenly birds arrayed in formation, all beside me. Spewing fire ten thousand fathoms to dispel misfortune. Spirits open the Dao, sealing and casting into mountain villages. A thousand spirits, ten thousand numina, all bow with clasped hands. Marsh wardens hold censers, burning incense for me. Wherever I go, the myriad spirits welcome. Heavenly beasts come to guard, a thousand essences tremble and submit—none dare disturb my *qi*. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!

Exit the chamber and stand again.

**Talisman for Eradicating Locust Plagues in the Realm**
The Northern Thearch says: If a state, prefecture, or county suffers a locust plague, causing the people distress and preventing them from their livelihood, simply establish a Seven Primes Altar before the northern gate of the prefecture. Perform the Dao and cast my two spirit talismans. One talisman, inscribed on raw iron, is thrown into the prefecture’s river, where it transforms into black *qi* piercing the sky, and sweet dew descends. Another talisman, inscribed on catalpa wood with realgar, is buried in the Earth God’s temple, one foot two inches deep—then the locusts will instantly perish.

The right talisman: Use a square of raw iron, inscribe in cinnabar, and cast into the state’s great river.

The Northern Thearch says: After binding the altar, perform the Dao to seek the heart’s desire. Use a catalpa wood board, one foot two inches long, inscribe it, and bury it in the Earth God’s temple—the locusts will perish.

**Northern Feng Seal for Slaying Ghosts**
The Northern Thearch says: For those born in the Lower Prime, whether man or woman, afflicted by mountain *chi* and ancient specters, spirit altars and village shrines, or demonic spirits and wild anomalies causing illness—raving speech, madness, entering water without fear of death—use my Northern Feng Seal to stamp the afflicted’s heart, and the illness will immediately cease. Carve it from jujube wood’s core, perform three annual offerings, then it may be used.

The Northern Thearch says: In the upper scroll of this scripture, I proclaimed the myriad sufferings of those born in the Lower Prime—official talismans and slander, illnesses and calamities, or entering battle and facing enemies, all manner of epilepsy. Simply carry this talisman, and recovery follows the appointed day. Those entering battle wear it on their heads, where one man equals a hundred, forever avoiding the misfortune of blade wounds, as divine soldiers protect them.

The Northern Thearch says: For those born in the Lower Prime with troubled hearts, repeatedly suffering deadly misfortunes, or women whose pregnancies fail, or men and women dying prematurely, or those wronged by evil people’s schemes, cursed and punished—simply suppress it with my Fire Bell Imperial Register for great fortune.

The right talisman is from the *Hengshan Record*.

The Northern Thearch says: To seal mountains and peaks, command ancient temples, summon the Five Marchmounts’ spirits to reveal past and future events, or to move mountains and overturn seas, and to expel demonic spirits.

chunks.original_text: 将吾此符以镜上，用朱砂书，悬七元坛上，去坛二百尺，坛上念天蓬咒，其鬼神亲见，须臾立对未来之事。 北帝曰：凡欲与天下人作法之时，用甲子庚申之日。 若传不得其人，令人癫狂病死，慎之敬行。 若持咒吃五辛口不净者，天蓬大将怒目一嗔，令人神魂堕落，因而癫邪，甚难救治。 凡人祭七灵毕，即取座上酒七杯饮之，后七日神通自然，心生智慧，光显尊妙，秘之神验。 临坛行持掌图 北帝曰：吾所说妙经，能上消天灾，下镇帝王帝印使诀，以除不祥，告诸众善念之。 国有此文，普天获福。 世间有此文，龙神扶卫。 山居有此文，百邪振伏。 神通之力动，皆有三十万兵随逐。 此文非常之词，勇猛之旨，不得传授轻泄背慢，不遵真典之者。 尔时，四众及诸真人上白北帝曰：此经当何名为？ 北帝曰：号《神咒妙诀印七元伏魔上经》，流传神秘，万劫奉行。 太上北帝素灵斩邪灭魔杀鬼玉符，若人能佩之，保命延年。 及贴房门之中，去诸邪精鬼魔，符中使者，斩邪灭鬼，大吉。 太玄北帝第一神符，下元修行弟子，若能佩带，长生久视，辟尸斩邪灭魔。 贴房堂之中，去诸邪精鬼魅，符中使者，斩邪灭鬼矣。 北帝第二符，酆都上清神符，辟尸大箓。 太上三五丹呈阴阳，驱伏邪精。 翻天倒地，斩诸邪魔。 各各降伏，所使护身，长命灭鬼等用。 北帝第三符，治一切疾病。 佩带护人身命，禁断诸鬼，斩邪缚神，去灾灭祸，却邪成正，保守人身，长生久视。 元始天尊第四符，说北帝真书玉文辟尸神箓，救治人民疾病灾难，降此玉字神符，诛斩邪魅。 令人佩带头上，辟尸千里。 若有邪精鬼魅，贴符堂房之中，悉斩消灭矣。 北帝第五符，斩飞尸鬼魅邪精，应破丧死之家。 为害者佩之，护身命，大吉利。 北帝第六符，治水火灾难。 佩带身上，及贴门中镇宅，大吉。 北帝第七符，治人身染殟疫瘴毒、妖魔行疠气。 苦恼者佩带此符，永得安平，恶鬼消灭矣。 北帝第八符，解秽辟恶，驱邪遣魅，不敢害人。 保命护身，延年大吉。 右前八符，五灵玄老帝君，能救一切众生灾难殟疫等疾。 佩我之金书玉符，普皆安乐。 其神验极大，殊非小功耳。 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第二竟 #1责：疑作『青』。 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第三 酆都戮鬼品

Place this talisman upon a mirror, inscribe it with cinnabar, and suspend it above the Seven Primes Altar. Two hundred feet from the altar, recite the Heavenly Peng Mantra upon the altar, and the ghosts and spirits will appear before you, promptly answering questions of future events.

The Northern Thearch says: Whenever performing rituals for all under Heaven, choose the days of *jiazi* or *gengshen*. If transmitted to the unworthy, it will cause madness, illness, and death—proceed with reverence and caution. Should one holding the mantra consume the Five Pungents with an impure mouth, the Heavenly Peng General will glare in wrath, causing the person’s spirit and soul to fall, leading to madness and possession, which is most difficult to cure.

After completing the rites to the Seven Spirits, take the seven cups of wine from the altar and drink them. After seven days, divine powers will arise naturally, wisdom will flourish in the heart, and one’s dignity and wonder will radiate—guard this secret, for its efficacy is profound.

**Altar Ritual and Palm Chart**
The Northern Thearch says: The wondrous scripture I expound can dispel celestial disasters above and stabilize the imperial seal below, eliminating inauspicious omens. Proclaim it to all good practitioners. Should a nation possess this text, all under Heaven will receive blessings. Should the world hold this text, dragons and spirits will guard and protect. Should one dwell in the mountains with this text, all evil will tremble and submit. When the power of divine transformation stirs, thirty thousand soldiers will follow in its wake.

This text is no ordinary discourse—its intent is fierce and mighty. It must not be transmitted carelessly, leaked, or treated with disrespect, nor may those who defy the true canon receive it.

At that time, the Four Assemblies and all perfected ones addressed the Northern Thearch, saying: By what name should this scripture be called?

The Northern Thearch replied: It is titled *The Divine Mantra Wondrous Canon: The Seven Primes Subduing Demons Sutra*. Let it be transmitted in secrecy and upheld for ten thousand kalpas.

**The Supreme Northern Thearch’s Plain Spirit Talisman for Beheading Evil and Destroying Demons and Ghosts**—should one wear it, it preserves life and extends years. If affixed within a chamber door, it dispels all demonic spirits and ghosts, as the talisman’s envoys behead evil and destroy ghosts, bringing great fortune.

**The Supreme Mystery Northern Thearch’s First Divine Talisman**—for disciples of the Lower Prime who cultivate the Dao: if worn, it grants long life and eternal vision, repelling corpses and beheading evil to destroy demons. Affixed within a hall or chamber, it dispels all demonic spirits and specters, as the talisman’s envoys behead evil and destroy ghosts.

**The Northern Thearch’s Second Talisman: The Fengdu Upper Clarity Divine Talisman, the Great Register for Repelling Corpses**—the Supreme Three-Five Elixir manifests yin and yang, driving away and subduing demonic spirits. It overturns heaven and earth, beheading all evil demons. Each is subdued and made to protect the body, granting long life and destroying ghosts.

**The Northern Thearch’s Third Talisman**—cures all illnesses. Worn to protect the body and life, it restrains all ghosts, beheads evil, binds spirits, dispels disasters, eliminates misfortune, repels evil to restore rectitude, safeguards the person, and grants long life and eternal vision.

**The Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning’s Fourth Talisman**—expounds the Northern Thearch’s true scripture, the jade text register for repelling corpses, saving and healing the people’s illnesses and calamities. This jade-character divine talisman is bestowed to execute and behead demonic specters. Should one wear it upon the head, it repels corpses for a thousand *li*. If demonic spirits or specters afflict a household, affix the talisman within the hall or chamber, and all will be beheaded and annihilated.

**The Northern Thearch’s Fifth Talisman**—beheads flying corpses, demonic specters, and evil spirits, and breaks the misfortune of households plagued by death. Those harmed should wear it to protect their lives, bringing great fortune.

**The Northern Thearch’s Sixth Talisman**—averts disasters of water and fire. Worn upon the body or affixed within a door to pacify a dwelling, it brings great fortune.

**The Northern Thearch’s Seventh Talisman**—cures those afflicted by pestilential epidemics, miasmic poisons, and demonic plagues. Those suffering should wear this talisman to attain eternal peace, as evil ghosts are destroyed.

**The Northern Thearch’s Eighth Talisman**—purifies defilement, repels evil, drives away demons, and dispatches specters, preventing harm to people. It preserves life, protects the body, and extends years, bringing great fortune.

The preceding eight talismans, bestowed by the Five Spirits Mysterious Elder Thearch, can save all sentient beings from disasters, epidemics, and illnesses. Those who wear my golden script and jade talismans will universally attain peace and happiness. Their divine efficacy is immense, far from a minor merit.

Here ends the second scroll of *The Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning’s Divine Mantra Wondrous Canon of the Northern Thearch Subduing Demons*.

**The Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning’s Divine Mantra Wondrous Canon of the Northern Thearch Subduing Demons, Scroll Three: The Fengdu Chapter on Slaying Ghosts**

chunks.original_text: 道言：北方五灵帝君，时在神丹之极云景殿上五明宫内玄台宝座之中，垂十绝灵旛，披离罗之帔，戴宝曜花冠，飞凤羽裙，瑶华蕊珠文履，执碧瑶之笏，七宝之函，云锦凤纹之案，琉璃华佩，琼凤香炉，交龙神虎之剑，飞云凤气明光玉几，班麟翠拂，左右侍真，列班其次，瞻视尊颜。 北帝诀。 大指恰子，四指压大指，二三五指皆直。 是时，北方五灵帝君，忽然微笑，鼓动法音，神光赫奕，遍照十方无极世界。 于时，东方九气天君，侍真骑吏九千亿众，来入于座。 南方三气天君，侍真骑吏三千亿 众，来入于座。 西方七气天君，侍真骑吏七千亿众； 来入于座。 北方五灵帝君，是时命诏北玄真人，侍真玉童，令侍其座。 须臾万变，宫阙殿堂台榭，皆是水晶、琉璃、珊瑚、琥珀、雕装严饰，金麟狮子，遍在其座。 北方五灵帝君先谒东方九气天君，次谒南方三气天君，次谒西方七气天君，各就其座，讲酆都下元男女生死之录。 忽闻鬼狱冤魂受对，痛声号绝。 又见死魂无托冥暗之中，鬼官不录。 是时，于座西方七气天君问曰：此辈罪人，是何业报？ 死魂受栲，痛切难任。 北方五灵帝君答曰：下元生人，死魂受栲。 为其前生不孝不忠，君臣不义，父子不慈，不敬三光，不信冥理，欺师谤道，反逆宗亲，广杀物命，恣纵贪淫。 酆都夺算，寿促中年。 死魂报对，劫尽无解。 七气天君又曰：死魂无托，鬼官不录，是何缘对？ 北帝曰：此人为其前身，耽酒味肉，杀戮无度，不造善功，专行无道。 年算未尽，六天洞宫魔鬼，乘人罪衅，放其毒疫，夭折人算。 水火盗贼，疫疠刀兵，危难人命。 官私口舌，枷锁迍塞，令人所为不遂。 年年岁岁，有遭不少。 吾有《酆都三备神咒经》，北帝之法。 若人能净心，专行吾道，依经受持，作七元坛，香灯供养，昼夜无倦。 诵吾神咒，存真思神，无挠外事。 吾遣天蓬神兵部落，洞渊赤杀吏兵，卫灵神将，豁落七元兵士，侍卫尔身。 令万病消散，所治者愈。 令居贫得富，居危得安，居卑得尊，求者得遂。 下元生人男女，颠狂鬼魅，异常之怪。 但依吾科禁，将吾神咒步罡，七星临斗，专行印诀。 神兵立降，防护尔身。 北帝曰：若后学道士，功业未成，须依吾酆都摄录鬼神大印。 可以赤枣木，长五寸，阔四寸。 以壬辰日，於正北郊外，人犬不知处雕成。 以酒七脯七分祭毕，可埋癸地。 咒曰： 北帝神印，佩带灵真，三师下降，依吾指陈，饮吾醮祭，福寿来臻。 急急如大帝口敕律令。 北帝曰：若救治万病，存其神。 先鸣天鼓三通，次鸣天钟三通，次存度师在左右。 又鸣天鼓九通，闭目在空悬之中，北极灵君戴大玄冠，羽服焕然，降坛之所。 次存星辰七人，形如小儿，朱衣赤帻，降临坛所。 次存左上仙蔽身大将军，二指上。 姓唐名宏，字文明，家在会稽，身长八十丈，天冠赤帻，绛章单衣，羽服赫然，手持宝剑，兵士三十万人，从左肾中出，降侍前后。 次存右上灵景大将军，中指上。 姓葛名雍，字文度，家在豫章，身长七十二丈，天冠赤帻，绛章单衣，羽服赫然，手持玉戟，兵士三十万人，从右肾中出，降侍前后。 次存中上神藏形已身大将军，四指上。 姓周名武，字文刚，家在吴郡，身长九十六丈，天冠赤帻，绛章单衣，羽服赫然，手持玉杨枝，兵士三十万人，从心中出，降侍前后。

The Dao speaks: The Five Spirits Thearch of the Northern Direction, at that time, was within the Cloud Radiance Palace atop the Ultimate Divine Elixir, seated upon the Mystic Terrace’s treasure throne in the Fivefold Luminance Palace. Ten wondrous spirit banners hung down; he wore a mantle of parted net, a flowered crown of precious radiance, a flying phoenix feathered skirt, and cloud-brocade shoes adorned with jade blossoms and seed-pearl patterns. In his hands he held a scepter of green jade, a case of seven treasures, and a cloud-brocade phoenix-patterned desk. His ornaments were of fluorite and blossoming jade; a fragrant censer of jade phoenix stood before him, along with a divine tiger-and-dragon sword. A luminous jade table of flying clouds and phoenix qi stood beside him, with a kingly lynx-feather whisk. Realized beings stood in attendance to his left and right, arrayed in ranks, gazing upon his august countenance.

The Mudra of the Northern Thearch: the thumb clasps the little finger, the four fingers press upon the thumb, while the second, third, and fifth fingers remain straight.

At that time, the Five Spirits Thearch of the Northern Direction suddenly smiled faintly, stirring his dharma-sound. Divine radiance blazed forth, suffusing the ten directions and the boundless worlds.

Then, the Nine Qi Heavenly Lord of the Eastern Direction, with his retinue of nine thousand billion realized beings and mounted officers, came and entered his seat. The Three Qi Heavenly Lord of the Southern Direction, with his retinue of three thousand billion realized beings and mounted officers, came and entered his seat. The Seven Qi Heavenly Lord of the Western Direction, with his retinue of seven thousand billion realized beings and mounted officers, came and entered his seat.

At that time, the Five Spirits Thearch of the Northern Direction summoned the Northern Mystic Perfected and the jade lads attendant upon the realized, commanding them to attend his seat. In an instant, myriad transformations occurred: the palaces, halls, towers, and pavilions were all adorned with crystal, fluorite, coral, amber, and intricate carvings. Golden qilin and lions were arrayed throughout the seats.

The Five Spirits Thearch of the Northern Direction first paid homage to the Nine Qi Heavenly Lord of the Eastern Direction, then to the Three Qi Heavenly Lord of the Southern Direction, and next to the Seven Qi Heavenly Lord of the Western Direction. Each took their seats and discoursed upon the records of the living and dead, male and female, of the Lower Realm of Fengdu.

Suddenly, the cries of aggrieved souls in the ghostly prisons were heard, their wails of pain ceasing only in death. Then were seen the dead souls, untethered in the dark of the netherworld, unregistered by the ghostly officials.

At that time, the Seven Qi Heavenly Lord of the Western Direction, seated to the west, inquired: “What karmic retribution befalls these sinful beings? The dead souls endure torment unbearable.”

The Five Spirits Thearch of the Northern Direction replied: “The dead souls of the Lower Realm endure torment. For in their former lives, they were unfilial and disloyal, lacking righteousness between ruler and minister, lacking kindness between father and child. They disrespected the Three Luminaries, disbelieved in the principles of the unseen, deceived their teachers, slandered the Dao, rebelled against their kin, wantonly took lives, and indulged in greed and lust. Fengdu strips them of their allotted years, cutting short their lives in middle age. Their dead souls face retribution; their kalpas are exhausted, and there is no deliverance.”

The Seven Qi Heavenly Lord further asked: “Why are these dead souls untethered, unregistered by the ghostly officials?”

The Northern Thearch replied: “These beings, in their former lives, indulged in wine and meat, slaughtered without restraint, performed no virtuous deeds, and acted contrary to the Dao. Though their allotted years were not yet spent, the demonic ghosts of the Six Heavens’ Cavernous Palaces seized upon their transgressions, unleashing plagues and poisons, cutting short their years. They perish by water, fire, bandits, epidemics, blades, and warfare—perils to life. They suffer from official and private disputes, shackles, and obstacles, their endeavors thwarted. Year after year, countless meet such fates.

I possess *The Threefold Wondrous Mantra Canon of Fengdu* and the methods of the Northern Thearch. If one can purify the heart, single-mindedly practice my Dao, uphold the canon, and establish a Sevenfold Primordial Altar with incense and lamps, offering devotion day and night without weariness; if one recites my divine mantras, visualizes the true and contemplates the spirits without distraction—then I shall dispatch the Heavenly Peng divine soldiers, the Red Slayers of the Abyssal Cavern, the guardian spirit-generals, and the Sevenfold Primordial warriors of the Vast Expanse to protect your body. Thus, all illnesses shall disperse, and those you treat shall recover. The impoverished shall gain wealth, the imperiled shall find safety, the lowly shall rise in station, and all seekers shall attain their desires.

For the living men and women of the Lower Realm afflicted by madness, ghostly possession, or extraordinary anomalies—simply follow my precepts and rituals, wield my divine mantras, pace the celestial stems, and align with the Seven Stars and the Dipper. Employ the mudras with single-minded focus, and the divine soldiers shall descend at once to guard your body.”

The Northern Thearch said: “If later students of the Dao have not yet perfected their merit, they must rely upon my great seal of Fengdu for subduing and recording ghosts and spirits. Carve it from red jujube wood, five inches long and four inches wide. On a *renchen* day, engrave it in a secluded place in the northern outskirts, unknown to men or dogs. After offering seven cups of wine and seven portions of dried meat as sacrifice, bury it in a *gui* earth. Recite the incantation:

‘The Northern Thearch’s divine seal,
Worn by the realized spirits,
The Three Masters descend,
Following my command.
Partake of my offerings,
And blessings and longevity shall arrive.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Great Thearch’s oral decree and ordinance.’”

The Northern Thearch said: “To heal all illnesses, visualize the spirits. First sound the celestial drum three times, then the celestial bell three times. Next, visualize your master of transmission standing to your left and right. Sound the celestial drum nine times, then close your eyes and envision the Northern Ultimate Spirit Lord in the empty void above, wearing a great dark crown and radiant feathered robes, descending to the altar.

Next, visualize the seven stellar spirits, childlike in form, clad in vermilion robes and red headbands, descending to the altar. Then visualize the Great General of the Left, Concealer of the Body, above the second finger. His surname is Tang, given name Hong, style Wenming. His home is in Kuaiji. His body is eighty *zhang* tall, crowned with a celestial cap and red headband, clad in a crimson unlined robe and resplendent feathered garments. He wields a precious sword, leading three hundred thousand soldiers, emerging from your left kidney to stand in attendance before and behind you.

Next, visualize the Great General of the Right, Spirit Radiance, above the middle finger. His surname is Ge, given name Yong, style Wendu. His home is in Yuzhang. His body is seventy-two *zhang* tall, crowned with a celestial cap and red headband, clad in a crimson unlined robe and resplendent feathered garments. He wields a jade halberd, leading three hundred thousand soldiers, emerging from your right kidney to stand in attendance before and behind you.

Next, visualize the Great General of the Center, Concealer of the True Form, above the fourth finger. His surname is Zhou, given name Wu, style Wengang. His home is in Wu Commandery. His body is ninety-six *zhang* tall, crowned with a celestial cap and red headband, clad in a crimson unlined robe and resplendent feathered garments. He wields a jade willow branch, leading three hundred thousand soldiers, emerging from your heart to stand in attendance before and behind you.”

chunks.original_text: 次存青龙将军，卯文。 天冠黑帻，着青衣，身长八十二丈，手持弓箭，兵士四十万人，悉青衣，羽服赫然，从肝中出，降侍左右。 次存白虎将军，酉文。 天冠黑帻，着白衣，身长三十六丈，手持弓弩，兵士四十万人，悉白衣，羽服赫然，从肺中出，降侍左右。 次存朱雀将军，午文。 天冠黑帻，绛章单衣，身长六十丈，手持长鼓吹角，兵士四十万人，悉朱衣，羽服赫然，从心中出，降侍前后。 次存玄武将军，子文。 天冠黑帻，着皂衣，身长二十五丈，手持钟鼓，兵士四十万人，羽服赫然，从肾中出，降侍前后。 次存麒麟将军，中指根。 身长七十二丈，天冠黑帻，绛章单衣，手持魁罡，兵士四十万人，悉黄衣，羽服赫然，从脾中出，降侍前后。 次存八神八煞大将军，搜山八将诀，四指中文起。 天丁力士捕鬼使者，天冠赤帻，悉赤衣，羽服赫然，从遍身毛孔中出，降侍前后。 先结双雷诀，擎起雷公在左右，次两手天蓬印，擎起四面八臂。 次存天蓬大将军，身长万五十丈，两手斗诀。 着龙鳞之甲，佩七星之剑，统兵百千万骑，平身端坐，存腰胯拳膊，为一座斗。 豁落七元大将军，洞渊神将，雷师电师，两手雷诀，塞耳取雷声。 又用两手雷诀，闭目取电光。 羽服赫然，各持金剑，并从面中出，降侍前后。 次存郁仪将军，左眼，吁气一口，名彭执。 结璘将军，右眼，呬气一口，名彭叫。 羽服赫然，照曜内外，各领兵士一十二万人，并从两眼中出，降侍前后。 次存役使吏兵，仰头咒曰：呵气一口，存见元始天尊在目前。 向兆吐气一口，中有一真人，即己身，是名天帝之子。 叱咄，吾是天帝之子，老君所使，头戴日月，两眼出。 身佩北斗，有乾灵之兵百千万 众，毛孔是。 在吾左右。 前有万石镬汤，雨手弹午后有黄金钺斧。 朝发北斗泰山之道，路逢东王公教我杀鬼之法，授我役神之方。 上告北帝，召役吏兵。 头戴华盖，山字印。 足蹑魁罡。 左扶六甲，右使六丁。 何神不伏，何鬼敢当。 急急如律令。 北帝曰：下元生人，有知七星名字者，一切灾病，呼之即百邪退散，万愿从心。 咒曰： 子，贪狼之星，讳阳明，尊神亿万众，来扶我身。 丑亥，巨门之星，讳阴精，尊神亿万众，来扶我身。 寅戌，禄存之星，讳真人，尊神亿万众，来扶我身。 卯酉，文曲之星，讳玄冥，尊神亿万 众，来扶我身。 辰申，廉贞之星，讳丹元，尊神亿万众，来扶我身。 巳未，武曲之星，讳北极，尊神亿万众，来扶我身。 午，破军之星，讳天关，尊神亿万众，来扶我身。 叱咄，七星尊神，千千万万亿兵士，在吾左右。 左青龙，名孟章。 卯文。 右白虎，名监兵。 酉文。 前朱雀，名陵光。 午文。 后玄武，名执明。 子文。 脾为贵子，入中宫。 中。 孟章监兵前行，陵光执明在后。

Ahead, the Vermilion Bird, named Ling Guang, marked by the *wu* trigram. Behind, the Dark Warrior, named Zhi Ming, marked by the *zi* trigram. The Spleen, the Noble Child, enters the Central Palace. Center. Meng Zhang and the Guardian of Soldiers advance ahead; Ling Guang and Zhi Ming follow behind.”

chunks.original_text: 长生符 已上长生神符四道，以四时八节晦朔吞之，延年益寿。 北帝曰：吾真符六十六道，悉是北宫杀鬼治病灵篆。 但精诚，以法信五彩命纹，志心诣师受佩。 上答国恩，下保万民。 龙神护卫，冤对成亲。 神仙治化，鬼不侵人。 敕符咒曰：子文。 北方黑帝，万圣之尊。 太微六甲，五气灵君。 光华日月，威备乾坤。 飞符摄戮，断绝鬼门。 行神布炁，辟除五殟。 左右吏兵，三五将军。 雷公霹雳，电绕风奔。 刀剑如雨，队仗如云。 手把帝钟，头戴昆仑。 行绕天下，收捉鬼神。 九州社令，血食之宾。 不许拒逆，敢有张鳞。 镇星缚手，北帝收魂。 三台七星，持剑斩身。 罪不轻拷，殃及子孙。 邪精魍魉，耳不得闻。 闻吾者死，逆吾灭根。 头破脑裂，碎如微尘。 急急如太上真符律令。 北帝曰：下元生人，是男是女，受持吾秘法，及医治万民，皆须清净，沐浴身心。 依科行法，醮祭七元，坛位皆须严洁，酒脯五果香灯。 佩吾神符，诵吾神咒，专心不二。 即七真下降，神将潜扶，所愿从心，无不称遂。 若人受持此法，心为不洁，志不谒诚，徒费金玉，终无神验。 北帝曰：吾使六丁将吏，摄戮鬼神，驱斥魔鬼。 下元生人，求学未能。 契吾至道，先须符印，降伏外魔，摄治万病。 召酆都鬼录之官，进品仙阶，名书碧简。 慎勿妄传非人，七祖酆都摄拷魂神，生人夺算。 尔时，四方帝君闻北帝说伏魔神咒符印神秘之法。 赞叹五灵帝君，神力微妙，不可思议。 大 众恭敬，六天振动，付诸真子授教。 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第三竟 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第四 捍厄品 尔时，元始天尊在於香林园中，为诸天童子说法演戒毕，太上道君前进作礼，上白天尊：今日侍座，得闻明真科律二十四条，善恶因绿受报之日，心欢意释，无余滞碍。 又蒙开示罪福缘对拔度斋法，救济幽魂长夜之苦，上升福堂，衣食自然。 其法弘普，死者咸赖。 然今世及来生男女，未见经戒，气力薄弱，不堪受持，无以捍厄。 多为世间众邪恶鬼横作侵害，夭折寿命，不终天年。 天尊既开大慈之化，使生死俱济，存亡荷恩。 惟愿哀怜，更垂开示来生男女防身护命之法，得免厄难。 见世三灾九横、五瘟七疰、疾病疫毒之气，众邪魍魉诸灾之难。 全其性命，无有中伤。 如蒙哀愍，仰受圣恩。
chunks.translated_text:
**Talisman of Longevity**
The four talismans of longevity above—swallow them on the four seasons, eight solar terms, dark and new moons to extend years and increase lifespan.

The **Northern Emperor** declares:
My sixty-six true talismans are all divine scripts of the Northern Palace, slaying demons and curing illnesses. Only with utmost sincerity, inscribe them in five colors with destined patterns, and receive them from a master with a devoted heart. Above, they repay the nation’s grace; below, they protect the myriad people. Dragon spirits guard and defend, turning foes into kin. Divine immortals govern transformations, and ghosts dare not encroach upon mortals.

The **Talisman Incantation** states:
*Zi Wen.*
Northern Black Emperor, revered among the ten thousand sages.
Grand Tenuity’s Six Jia, the Five Qi Spirit Lords.
Radiant as sun and moon, majestic as heaven and earth.
Flying talismans seize and execute, sealing the gates of ghosts.
Marching spirits deploy *qi*, dispelling the Five Afflictions.
Left and right officers and soldiers, the Three and Five Generals.
Thunder Lords and lightning bolts, winds whirling in haste.
Blades fall like rain, ranks arrayed like clouds.
Hands grasp the Emperor’s bell, heads crowned with Kunlun.
Traversing the world, they capture and subdue ghosts and spirits.
The Nine Provinces’ earth gods, blood-offering guests—
none may resist. Should any dare to spread their scales,
the Star of Pacification binds their hands, the Northern Emperor seizes their souls.
The Three Terraces and Seven Stars wield swords to sever their bodies.
Crimes shall not be lightly punished; calamity extends to descendants.
Evil spirits and *wangliang*—let their ears not hear.
Those who hear me die; those who oppose me are eradicated to the root.
Heads shatter, brains split, crushed to fine dust.
*Hasten! As the True Talisman of the Most High commands!*

The **Northern Emperor** declares:
For those born in the Lower Yuan—be they man or woman—who receive and uphold my secret method and heal the myriad people, all must purify body and mind, bathe, and fast. Follow the rites to perform the ritual, offering libations to the Seven Primes. Altar stations must be solemn and pristine, with wine, dried meats, five fruits, incense, and lamps. Wear my divine talisman, recite my divine incantation, and focus the mind unwaveringly. Then the Seven Perfected shall descend, spirit generals shall secretly assist, and every wish shall be fulfilled without fail.

If one receives and upholds this method with an impure heart or insincere devotion, they waste gold and jade in vain, and no divine efficacy shall manifest.

The **Northern Emperor** declares:
I dispatch the Six Ding officers and generals to seize and execute ghosts and spirits, driving away demonic fiends. Those born in the Lower Yuan who seek to learn but have not yet attained my supreme Dao must first employ talismans and seals to subdue external demons and cure all illnesses. Summon the officials of the Fengdu Ghost Register to advance their immortal ranks, their names inscribed on jade slips. Beware of recklessly transmitting this to the unworthy, lest the seven generations of ancestors in Fengdu be seized and tormented, and the living have their lifespan stolen.

At that time, the Four Directional Emperor Lords, hearing the Northern Emperor expound the divine incantations, talismans, seals, and secret methods for subduing demons, praised the Five Numinous Emperor Lords—whose divine power is subtle and wondrous, beyond comprehension. The great assembly paid reverence, the Six Heavens trembled, and the teachings were entrusted to true disciples.

**The Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s Scripture on the Northern Emperor’s Subduing Demons Divine Incantation, Wondrous Scroll Three, concludes.**

**The Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s Scripture on the Northern Emperor’s Subduing Demons Divine Incantation, Wondrous Scroll Four: The Chapter on Warding Off Calamities**

At that time, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy was in the Fragrant Grove Garden, expounding the Dharma and reciting the precepts to the assembly of heavenly youths. When the discourse concluded, the Most High Dao Lord approached, bowed, and addressed the Heavenly Worthy:
Today, seated in attendance, I have heard the twenty-four articles of the luminous true precepts, the karmic retribution of good and evil, and my heart rejoices, my mind is liberated, with no lingering obstructions. Moreover, I have been graciously instructed on the karmic connections of sin and fortune, the Dharma of deliverance through purification rites, and the salvation of suffering souls in the long night, ascending to the Hall of Blessings where clothing and sustenance arise naturally. This Dharma is vast and universal; the deceased all rely upon it.

Yet, the men and women of this world and the next, who have not encountered the scriptures and precepts, are weak in *qi* and strength, unable to uphold them, and thus lack means to ward off calamities. Many are harmed by worldly malevolent ghosts and demons, their lives cut short, failing to complete their natural lifespan. Since the Heavenly Worthy has opened the transformation of great compassion, benefiting both the living and the dead, the living and the deceased alike bear this grace. I humbly beseech your mercy to further reveal the methods for men and women of future generations to protect their bodies and preserve their lives, that they may escape calamities. In this world, they face the Three Disasters and Nine Adversities, the Five Pestilences and Seven Afflictions, the *qi* of illnesses and epidemics, and the perils of myriad demons and specters. May their lives be preserved, free from harm. If your compassion is moved, I shall reverently receive this sacred grace.

chunks.original_text: 於是，天尊欢喜，答曰：善哉善哉，子今所请，亦为至要。 吾今愍一切，如父母念子。 今为汝说，汝可谛听，坚持在心，勿忘吾言。 尔时，众圣欣庆，一心皈命。 天尊告曰：往昔过去，人民淳朴。 无有中伤，任命长短。 终其天年无有夭枉，鬼不横伤。 但今末世浅薄，人心破坏。 五情杂乱，更生疑惑。 所为不实，唯用邪行。 背真从伪，不义不仁。 违天逆地，攻根伐株。 不忠不孝，无爱无慈。 欺罔万民，酷虐百姓。 杀戮众生，残害物命。 结诸罪衅，欣，去声。 冤对无边。 致使今生，动见厄难。 或为劫贼之所伤命。 或为恶鬼之所灭身。 或被蚖蛇虎狼百毒虫螫音适。 之所加害。 官私口舌，无故横生，闭系牢狱，鞭杖徒刑。 或复家遭瘟疫，身染毒气，大小疾病，人口死亡，六亲断绝。 诸如等苦，并是六天故气。 北酆帝王八部鬼师，人间死将，五兵之神，通行天下，乘其罪衅，放其毒气，以杀恶人。 年年月月，有遭不少，更相牵连，以致死亡。 所存人民，无能免得如斯等，苦甚可痛。
chunks.translated_text:
Then, the Heavenly Worthy rejoiced and replied: "Excellent, excellent! What you have requested is indeed of utmost importance. I now take pity on all beings as parents cherish their children. I shall now speak for you—listen carefully, hold fast to these words in your heart, and never forget my teaching."

At that moment, the assembly of sages rejoiced and, with single-minded devotion, prostrated in reverence.

The Heavenly Worthy declared: "In the distant past, the people were simple and honest. They suffered no harm, their lifespans unfolding as destined. They fulfilled their natural years without premature death, and no ghosts inflicted wanton injury. But now, in this degenerate age of shallowness, the human heart is corrupted. The five emotions are in turmoil, giving rise to doubt and confusion. Deeds lack sincerity, and only perverse conduct is pursued. They turn from truth to embrace falsehood, forsaking righteousness and benevolence. They defy Heaven and rebel against Earth, severing roots and felling trunks. They are neither loyal nor filial, devoid of love and compassion. They deceive the multitudes and tyrannize the common folk. They slaughter living beings and destroy the lives of creatures, accumulating boundless transgressions and karmic enmity.

Thus, in this present life, calamities arise at every turn. Some are slain by bandits, others destroyed by malevolent ghosts. Some are harmed by venomous snakes, tigers, wolves, or the stings of poisonous insects. Official and private disputes arise without cause, leading to imprisonment, flogging, or exile. Families may be struck by pestilence, bodies afflicted by toxic *qi*, great and small illnesses, or the death of kin, severing the six relations.

All such sufferings arise from the *qi* of the Six Heavens. The King of the Northern Feng, the Eight Divisions of Ghostly Masters, the Generals of the Dead in the human realm, and the Spirits of the Five Weapons roam the world, seizing upon transgressions to unleash their toxic *qi* and slay the wicked. Year after year, month after month, countless suffer these fates, entangled in one another’s doom, leading to death. The surviving people cannot escape such agonies—how grievous and pitiable!"
chunks.overlap_context: ace. I humbly beseech your mercy to further reveal the methods for men and women of future generations to protect their bodies and preserve their lives, that they may escape calamities. In this world, they face the Three Disasters and Nine Adversities, the Five Pestilences and Seven Afflictions, the *qi* of illnesses and epidemics, and the perils of myriad demons and specters. May their lives be preserved, free from harm. If your compassion is moved, I shall reverently receive this sacred grace.

chunks.original_text: 今为汝说北帝无畏神咒，并六宫之名。 若能信向，一心持诵，必免诸难，终身无患，获如是福。 其咒曰： 吾是太上弟子，下统六天。 六天之宫，是吾所部。 不但所部，乃太上之所主。 吾知六天宫名，故得长生。 敢有犯者，太上斩之。 急急如律令。 第一，纣绝阴天宫。 第二，泰杀谅事宗天宫。 第三，明晨耐犯武城天宫。 第四，恬照罪气天宫。 第五，宗灵七非天宫。 第六，敢司连宛屡天宫。 北帝曰：有知酆都鬼王及六宫名者，百鬼摄伏。 当临外之时，志诚点念。 魔鬼闻之，悉化为血。 可先面向北，微其音，不得高声，咒曰： 咄，吾头戴朱雀，足履玄武，左扶青龙，右踞白虎。 前有万石镬汤，后有黄金钺斧。 天驺甲卒在吾前后，瘟邪百鬼去我万里。 急急如律令。 又咒曰： 洞中玄虚，晃朗太元。 八方威神，使我自然。 灵宝符命，普告九天。 乾罗怛那，洞罡太玄。 斩妖缚邪，杀鬼万千。 中山神咒，元始玉文。 我诵一遍，却鬼延年。 按行五岳，八海知闻。 魔王束手，侍卫我轩。 凶秽消散，道气长存。 急急如律令。 又咒曰：
chunks.translated_text:
Here now is the Northern Emperor’s Fearless Divine Incantation, together with the names of the Six Palaces. Should you place faith in it and recite it with single-minded devotion, you shall surely escape all calamities, remain free of affliction throughout your life, and obtain blessings such as these.

The incantation reads:
I am a disciple of the Most High, ruling below over the Six Heavens.
The Six Heavenly Palaces are my domain—
not only my domain, but the charge of the Most High.
I know the names of the Six Heavenly Palaces, and thus I attain long life.
Should any dare transgress, the Most High shall strike them down.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

First: the Palace of Zhòu-Jué-Yīn.
Second: the Palace of Tài-Shā-Liàng-Shì-Zōng.
Third: the Palace of Míng-Chén-Nài-Fàn-Wǔ-Chéng.
Fourth: the Palace of Tián-Zhào-Zuì-Qì.
Fifth: the Palace of Zōng-Líng-Qī-Fēi.
Sixth: the Palace of Gǎn-Sī-Lián-Wǎn-Lǚ.

The Northern Emperor declares: He who knows the names of the Fengdu Ghost-Kings and the Six Palaces shall command the submission of all hundred ghosts.
When facing outward, focus your mind and silently invoke them.
Upon hearing this, demonic spirits shall all dissolve into blood.

First face north, lower your voice—do not speak loudly—and recite:
Hū! My head bears the Vermilion Bird, my feet tread the Dark Warrior.
To my left, the Azure Dragon lends support; to my right, the White Tiger crouches.
Before me boil cauldrons of ten thousand *shí*; behind me gleam axes of yellow gold.
Heavenly couriers and armored soldiers stand before and behind me.
Pestilential evil and the hundred ghosts flee ten thousand *lǐ* from me.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

Another incantation reads:
Within the cavern, profound and void; radiant and bright, the Great Origin.
The mighty spirits of the eight directions empower me by nature.
The talismanic writ of the Numinous Treasure proclaims to the Nine Heavens.
Qián-Luó-Dá-Nà, the penetrating power of the Great Mysterious.
Slay demons, bind evil, annihilate ten thousand ghosts.
The divine incantation of Zhongshan, the Jade Scripture of the Primordial Beginning.
Reciting it once repels ghosts and extends years.
Treading the Five Marchmounts, the Eight Seas take heed.
The Demon-Kings submit, guarding my chariot.
Malevolence and filth disperse; the *qi* of the Dao abides forever.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

chunks.original_text: 吾是帝君，名书玉清。 下统六天，北帝鬼宫。 悉是我营，悉是我部何鬼敢生。 左佩豁落，右带火铃。 掷火万里，威制千灵。 有犯者戮，有干者刑。 帝君有命，收捕不停。 天光骇动，草魔束形。 鬼妖灭种，我得长生。 急急如律令。 又咒曰： 太上老君，教我杀鬼，语我神方。 上呼玉女，收捕不祥。 登山左契，佩带印章。 头戴华盖，足履魁罡。 左扶六甲，右踞六丁。 前有黄神，后有越章。 神师诛伐，不避毫狂。 先杀小鬼，次杀夜光。 何神不伏，何鬼敢当。 急急如律令。 北方黑帝五灵玄老大神咒杀鬼之法 先叩齿三十六通，次念救护神咒： 天蓬天蓬，九玄杀童。 五丁都司，高刁北功。 七政八灵，太上皓凶。 长颅巨兽，手执帝钟。 素枭三神，严驾夔龙。 威剑神王，斩邪灭踪。 紫气乘天，丹霞赫冲。 吞魔食鬼，横身饮风。 苍舌绿齿，四目老翁。 天丁力士，威南御凶。 天驺激戾，威北衔。 三十万兵，卫我九重。 辟尸千里，祛却不祥。 敢有小鬼，欲来见状。 镢天大斧，斩鬼五形。 炎帝裂血，北帝然骨。 四明破骸，天猷灭类。 神刀一下，万鬼自溃。 急急如律令。 天尊重告太上老君曰：若遇瘟疫之年，鬼兵流行。 所在国土州县乡坊，疫疠竞起，无处隐藏。 若欲求免者，宜志心日诵三遍，可与病人同床同食。 无所畏惧，一切疾病邪魔终不能害。 至竟平安，三灾九厄自然得度。 若复有人常常读诵，令人见世居危得安，居疾得康，居贫得富，万灾不干，所求如意，所愿从心。 尔时，太上告诸真，子欲修此道长生不死之法。 先存其神，养其根，行其气，呼其名。 先存五兽防身，次鸣天鼓，次存天地日月，与我长生。 然后存其神，头发神七人，字寻长。 顶上神三人，字东王父。 脑户神七人，字元光。 眉间神，字天君。 两耳神四人，字娇女。 两目神六人，字英明。 鼻神，字通灵。 口神，字丹朱。 舌神，字黄人。 齿神三十六人，字卫士。 喉神，字虎贲。 两肩神，字一爵。 两手神，字魄阴。 肺神，字鸿鸿。 心神字，虚虚。 肝神，字临临。 胆神，字镬镬。 胃神，字怛怛。 脾神，字裨裨。 肾神，字漂漂。 脐神，字玉灵。 丹田神，字丹精。 两□神，字阴阴。 两膝神，字膒音区。 公。 颈音景。 神，字随朵。 两足神，字柱天力士。 子欲卧，从上三呼之，竟乃止。 若体中有病，皆随疾处，呼其名字，对神治之。 正卧暝目，存其神，所疾立愈。 日用朔望八节之日，悉皆存其神，自然尸解三尸。 一以志心，存四神向王，呼吸咽液，津气轮转，乃得长生。 过此不得杂想，挠乱心神，众恶备履，乃自致损折矣。 北帝曰：修身求法，正伏凶魔。 先须精心，存神念道。 昼则焚香，夜乃然灯。 不想外事，志心奉行，无有懈怠。 转经念咒，去离三业。 净想身心，功成克遂。 上界鉴知，当令万福归身，善芽增长。 乃有仙童玉女，常在左右。 咒中大威力神王，观其素志，密卫其身，所求皆果。 北帝杀鬼咒，先叩齿三十六通，咒曰： 二象回倾，玄一之精。 七灵护命，上诣三清，三皇驱除。 赫奕罗兵，三十万人，侍卫神营。 巨兽百丈，吐威摄精。 挥剑逐邪，馘落魔灵。 神伯所咒，千妖灭形。 急急如律令。 玉帝长生咒曰： 九天有命，上告玉清。 促召千真，俱会帝庭。
chunks.translated_text:
I am the Lord Emperor, my name inscribed in the Jade Clarity.
Below, I govern the Six Heavens, the Northern Emperor’s Ghostly Palace.
All is my encampment, all is my domain—what ghost dares arise?
At my left hangs the *Huoluo* blade, at my right the Fire Bell.
Hurl fire a thousand miles, awe commanding a myriad spirits.
Those who offend are slain, those who trespass are punished.
The Lord Emperor commands: seize and capture without cease.
Heaven’s light trembles, grass-demons bind their forms.
Ghosts and fiends are extirpated—thus I attain long life.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

Another incantation reads:
The Most High Lord Lao teaches me to slay ghosts, instructs me in divine methods.
Above, I summon the Jade Maidens to seize and capture misfortune.
Ascending mountains, I bear the left tally; at my waist, the seal of command.
My head wears the floral canopy, my feet tread the *Kuigang*.
To my left, the Six *Jia* spirits lend support; to my right, the Six *Ding* spirits crouch in wait.
Before me stands the Yellow Spirit; behind, the *Yuezhang*.
The divine masters execute judgment, sparing not even the mad.
First slay the lesser ghosts, then the night-shining ones.
What spirit does not submit? What ghost dares stand against me?
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

The Black Emperor of the North’s Five Numinous Elders’ Divine Incantation for Slaying Ghosts:
First, knock the teeth thirty-six times, then recite the Incantation of Salvation and Protection:
Heavenly *Peng*, Heavenly *Peng*, Nine Mysteries’ Slayer of Youth.
Five *Ding* Commanders, *Gaodiao* of the Northern Merit.
Seven Governances, Eight Numinous Ones, the Most High’s Radiant Might.
Long-skulled giant beasts wield the Emperor’s Bell.
Three White Owls, Three Spirits, sternly ride the *Kui* dragons.
The Divine King of the Mighty Sword slays evil and eradicates traces.
Purple *qi* ascends the heavens, cinnabar clouds surge forth.
Devouring demons, consuming ghosts, the body traverses the winds.
Green-tongued, green-toothed, four-eyed Old Man.
Heavenly *Ding* warriors, mighty in the South, repel misfortune.
Heavenly *Zou* rages fiercely, mighty in the North, biting down.
Three hundred thousand soldiers encircle and guard my ninefold layers.
Expelling corpses a thousand miles, dispelling all ill fortune.
Should any lesser ghost dare approach to behold my form,
The Heaven-Splitting Great Axe hews its fivefold shape.
The Flame Emperor severs its blood, the Northern Emperor burns its bones.
The Four Luminaries shatter its remains, the Heavenly Plan annihilates its kind.
One stroke of the divine blade—ten thousand ghosts scatter.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

The Heavenly Worthy solemnly addresses the Most High Lord Lao:
Should a year of pestilence arise, when ghostly soldiers roam unchecked,
In every land, province, county, village, and ward, plague and pestilence surge forth, nowhere to hide.
Those who seek deliverance should, with sincere heart, recite this thrice daily, sharing bed and board with the afflicted.
Fear nothing—all diseases and demonic harms shall be powerless to harm.
Ultimately, peace shall prevail; the Three Calamities and Nine Perils shall naturally be transcended.
Should one persist in recitation, in this life, peril shall turn to safety, sickness to health, poverty to wealth.
No disaster shall touch them; all desires shall be fulfilled, all wishes granted.

At that time, the Most High addressed the various perfected ones:
You who wish to cultivate this Dao of long life and deathlessness,
First visualize the spirits, nurture their roots, circulate their *qi*, invoke their names.
First visualize the Five Beasts to guard the body, then sound the Heavenly Drum.
Next, visualize Heaven and Earth, Sun and Moon, to attain long life with me.
Then visualize the spirits:
The seven spirits of the hair, named *Xunchang*.
The three spirits atop the head, named *Dongwangfu*.
The seven spirits of the brain’s gate, named *Yuanguang*.
The spirit between the brows, named *Heavenly Lord*.
The four spirits of the ears, named *Jiaonü*.
The six spirits of the eyes, named *Yingming*.
The spirit of the nose, named *Tongling*.
The spirit of the mouth, named *Danzhu*.
The spirit of the tongue, named *Yellow Man*.
The thirty-six spirits of the teeth, named *Guardians*.
The spirit of the throat, named *Tiger’s Might*.
The spirits of the shoulders, named *One Goblet*.
The spirits of the hands, named *Po Yin*.
The spirit of the lungs, named *Honghong*.
The spirit of the heart, named *Xuxu*.
The spirit of the liver, named *Linlin*.
The spirit of the gallbladder, named *Huohuo*.
The spirit of the stomach, named *Dada*.
The spirit of the spleen, named *Pipi*.
The spirit of the kidneys, named *Piaopiao*.
The spirit of the navel, named *Jade Numinous*.
The spirit of the Cinnabar Field, named *Cinnabar Essence*.
The spirits of the two [omitted character]s, named *Yinyin*.
The spirits of the knees, named *Ouyin Qu Gong Jing*.
The spirit of the neck, named *Suiduo*.
The spirits of the feet, named *Pillar of Heaven’s Warriors*.

When you lie down, call upon them thrice from top to bottom, then cease.
Should illness afflict the body, invoke the name of the spirit corresponding to the afflicted area to heal it.
Lie straight, close your eyes, visualize the spirits—your ailment shall instantly be cured.
On the first day of the month, the fifteenth, and the eight solar terms, visualize all these spirits to naturally shed the Three Corpses.
With sincere heart, visualize the Four Spirits facing the King, inhale and swallow saliva, revolve the *qi* of the essences—thus shall you attain long life.
Beyond this, do not entertain stray thoughts to disturb the heart and spirit.
Should you tread the path of myriad evils, you shall only bring harm upon yourself.

The Northern Emperor states:
To cultivate the body and seek the Dao, first subdue malevolent demons.
Begin with a pure heart, visualize the spirits, and contemplate the Dao.
By day, burn incense; by night, light lamps.
Banish external concerns, practice with sincere devotion, never slackening.
Recite scriptures, chant incantations, abandon the Three Karmas.
Purify body and mind—thus shall merit be accomplished and success achieved.
The Upper Realms shall take note, bestowing myriad blessings upon you, nurturing the sprouts of goodness.
Then shall jade maidens and immortal youths ever attend at your side.
The mighty spirit-kings within the incantations, observing your pure resolve, shall secretly guard your body—all your prayers shall be fulfilled.

The Northern Emperor’s Ghost-Slaying Incantation:
First, knock the teeth thirty-six times, then recite:
The Twin Symbols revolve, the essence of the Mysterious One.
Seven Numinous Ones guard life, ascending to the Three Clarities, the Three Sovereigns drive them out.
Resplendent, the *Luobing* soldiers—three hundred thousand—stand guard in the divine encampment.
A hundred-zhang beast spews might to seize essences.
Brandishing swords to expel evil, beheading demonic spirits.
What the Divine Earl has cursed, a thousand fiends shall perish.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

The Jade Emperor’s Longevity Incantation reads:
The Nine Heavens issue their decree, proclaiming to the Jade Clarity.
Hasten to summon a thousand perfected ones to assemble in the Emperor’s court.

chunks.original_text: 太乙下观，双皇易形。 鉴察万邪，理气摄生。 若有不祥，干试神明。 青帝之道，勅整神兵。 七神秉钺，天降右征。 挥剑前驱，豁落火铃。 告命甲驺，武卒天丁。 上威六天，下摄广灵。 既摄百邪，斩鬼灭形。 神戈电扫，奸妖无生。 仙皇秉节，有命敢停。 拒节违令，一一诛刑。 各敬各慎，保兹皇宁。 九天告命，万神敬听。 急急如律令。 是时，太上道君及诸天无量圣众，闻说北帝真言捍厄之法，不胜欣悦。 成起作礼，赞叹五灵妙术功德，威摄之力。 我等今者获大法门，谨於来世救获众生。 男女勤修不退，各各受持，欢喜奉行。 太上元始天专说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第四竟 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第五 神印品 北帝曰：《酆都秘密神咒妙经》，皆斩鬼之文，役使万神之旨。 教告诸来世真子，得吾此法，常能行之，为不死之道。 若顿修学之法，在於危险之路。 鬼庙之间，有诸疑难之处，当先反舌向其所，唾之三过，以左手捻鼻孔下中鬲内际三十六过，按之勿举指。 计数足，叩齿七通，进手掩鼻，临目微咒曰：火铃印向午弹。 朱鸟陵光，神威内张。 山源四镇，鬼兵逃亡。 神池吐气，邪根伏藏。 魂台四明，琼户玲琅。 玉真巍峨，坐镇明堂。 手挥紫霞，头建神光。 执咏洞经，三十九章。 中有辟邪，龙虎斩罡。 猛兽奔牛，衔刀吞镶。 揭山镢天，神雀毒龙。 六颔吐火，啖鬼之王。 电猪雷父，掣星流横。 枭音骁。 磕驳音剥。 灼，逆风横行。 天擒罗阵，皆在我傍。 吐火万丈，以除不祥。 群精启道，封落山乡。 千神万灵，并手叩颡。 泽尉捧炉，为我烧香。 所在所经，万神奉迎。 天兽来卫，千精振伏，莫干我气。 急急如律令。 北帝曰：此咒名为南方火铃大神咒，若有一切灾病恐怖之处。 但存吾形及天蓬大将，专志专心，念此神咒一遍。 自然魂魄归身，万邪摄伏，众恶消亡。 若诸国土，兵革四兴，侵害万姓，欲求免脱。 但立七元坛於国北门，依时行道，然灯烧香，念此神咒。 天蓬将降，逆风横行。 南方火池吐气万丈，以除不祥。 兵戈正息，贼害消宁。 返凶为吉，背义不生。 三十万兵，威加火铃。 北帝曰：吾酆都神印，一十二图，灵验神化，变动无方。 能伏使万神，驱邪遣魅，收鬼治病，安国宁家。 依法修行，无灾不灭。 功成道备，身生水火。 逍遥自在，长生可取。 并以赤枣木心为之，刻字依科，铺陈醮祭不阙。 有灾之日，一心行之。 上消天灾，下散地祸。 救病疗疾，皆获神验。 北帝第一煞鬼神印 用雷霹木刻之，长三寸，阔二寸一分，治一切瘟疫。 但枣栢木亦可。 北帝酆都召鬼神印 用赤枣木心刻之，治一切瘟病。 及印病者，必平安。 天帝神咒 收邪伏魔，令人吉亨。 天丁治病疾神印 带之大吉利。 印随身逐带之 延年益寿，安宅利人口，吉。 天蓬印 治一切为狗鬼，令病人自说，功成道合，乘印升天。 长三寸，阔三寸一分。 合君印

The Great One descends to observe, the Twin Sovereigns transform their forms.
Scrutinizing the myriad evils, regulating qi to nurture life.
Should any inauspiciousness test the divine luminaries,
The Way of the Azure Emperor commands the divine soldiers to assemble.
Seven spirits wield axes, heaven sends forth the rightful expedition.
Brandishing swords to lead the vanguard, wielding the *huoluo* fire bells.
Proclaiming orders to the armored couriers, martial warriors and celestial soldiers.
Above, they overawe the Six Heavens; below, they subdue the vast spirits.
Having subdued the hundred evils, they behead ghosts and annihilate forms.
Divine halberds sweep like lightning, leaving no trace of wicked demons.
The Immortal Sovereign holds the tally—who dares delay the command?
Those who resist or violate the decree shall be executed one by one.
Let each be reverent, each be cautious, to preserve this imperial tranquility.
The Nine Heavens proclaim their decree—let the myriad spirits heed with respect.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees.

At that moment, the Most High Dao Lord and the immeasurable host of sagely beings in the heavens, upon hearing the Northern Emperor’s true incantation for warding off calamity, were filled with boundless joy. They rose to bow in reverence, praising the wondrous efficacy and virtuous power of the Five Numinous arts, their awe-inspiring might of subjugation. "We have now attained this great Dharma gate," they declared. "We shall diligently apply it in future ages to deliver and protect all beings. Let men and women practice with unwavering devotion, each upholding and reciting it with joyful observance."
