The Fifth Scroll of *The Wondrous Scripture of the Northern Emperor’s Demon-Subduing Incantations*, Spoken by the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy
**Chapter on Divine Seals**

The Northern Emperor said: "*The Secret Scripture of Fengdu’s Wondrous Incantations* contains the texts for beheading ghosts and the principles for dispatching the myriad spirits. I now teach these to the true disciples of future ages. Those who obtain this method and practice it constantly shall attain the Way of deathlessness. For those who seek to master it swiftly, the method lies in perilous paths, amidst ghostly shrines, or in places of doubt and difficulty. First, press the tongue against the palate, spit three times toward the source, and with the left hand pinch the area beneath the nostrils—thirty-six times at the inner boundary of the diaphragm—pressing firmly without lifting the fingers. Once the count is complete, knock the teeth seven times, advance the hands to cover the nose, and with eyes slightly closed, softly recite the incantation:

*Fire Bell Seal, flick toward noon.*
The Vermilion Bird’s radiance, divine might surges within.
The Four Mountain Sources stand guard—ghostly soldiers flee in terror.
The divine pool exhales qi, evil roots hide in submission.
The Four Luminaries of the Soul Terrace, jade doors chime like jasper.
The Jade Perfected stands majestic, enthroned in the Hall of Light.
Hands wielding purple auroras, head crowned with divine radiance.
Reciting the *Cavern Scripture*’s thirty-nine chapters,
Within them, demon-expelling rites—Dragon and Tiger slaying *gang*.
Fierce beasts and charging oxen, bearing blades and swallowing metal.
Uprooting mountains, cleaving the heavens, poisonous dragons and divine raptors.
Six jaws spewing fire, devouring the King of Ghosts.
The Lightning Boar, the Thunder Father, seizing stars in their flight.
The screech of the *xiao* bird, the clamor of the *kebo*.
Scorching, they advance against the wind.
The Heavenly Net Formation, all arrayed at my side.
Spouting fire a thousand *zhang* to dispel inauspiciousness.
The host of spirits open the path, sealing off mountain villages.
A thousand spirits, ten thousand numina, all bow with hands clasped to their foreheads.
The Marsh Constable bears the censer, burning incense for me.
Wherever I go, the myriad spirits welcome me.
Heavenly beasts come to guard, a thousand spirits tremble in submission—
Do not disturb my qi!
Swiftly, swiftly, as in statutes and decrees."

The Northern Emperor said: "This incantation is called the *Great Fire Bell Incantation of the Southern Direction*. In places of disaster, illness, or terror, simply visualize my form and that of the Heavenly Vanguard Marshal. Focus your mind single-pointedly and recite this divine incantation once. Naturally, your hun and po will return to the body, the myriad evils will be subdued, and all malevolence will vanish. Should any land be plagued by the rise of warfare on all four fronts, harming the myriad people, and you seek deliverance, simply establish a Seven Primes Altar at the northern gate of the country. Follow the proper times to perform the Dao, light lamps, burn incense, and recite this incantation. The Heavenly Vanguard Marshal will descend, advancing against the wind. The Southern Fire Pool will exhale qi a thousand *zhang* to dispel inauspiciousness. Warfare will cease, banditry will vanish, misfortune will turn to fortune, and treachery will not arise. Three hundred thousand soldiers, their might augmented by fire bells."

The Northern Emperor said: "My Fengdu Divine Seals—twelve in all—possess numinous efficacy and wondrous transformations, their powers boundless. They can subdue and command the myriad spirits, expel evil and banish demons, capture ghosts and cure illnesses, pacify nations and secure households. Practice in accordance with the method, and no disaster will remain. When merit is complete and the Dao perfected, the body will traverse water and fire. Roaming freely, attaining longevity is within reach. Carve them from the heartwood of red jujube, inscribe the characters according to the ritual codes, and arrange them for offerings without fail. On days of calamity, practice with single-minded devotion. Above, they dissolve heavenly disasters; below, they disperse earthly misfortunes. Healing illnesses and curing diseases, all shall attain divine efficacy."

**The Northern Emperor’s First Ghost-Slaying Seal**
Carved from thunderbolt wood, three *cun* long and two *cun* and one *fen* wide. It cures all epidemics. Jujube or cypress wood may also be used.

**The Northern Emperor’s Fengdu Ghost-Summoning Seal**
Carved from the heartwood of red jujube. It cures all epidemic diseases. When stamped upon the afflicted, they shall surely recover.

**The Heavenly Emperor’s Divine Incantation**
Subdues evil and subdues demons, bringing good fortune and prosperity.

**The Heavenly Soldier’s Illness-Curing Seal**
Carrying it brings great auspiciousness.

**Seal to Be Carried on the Person**
Prolongs life, benefits the household, and brings good fortune to the family.

**The Heavenly Vanguard Seal**
Cures all ailments caused by dog ghosts, compelling the afflicted to confess. When merit is complete and the Dao attained, one ascends to heaven bearing the seal. Three *cun* long and three *cun* and one *fen* wide.

**The Sovereign’s Seal**

chunks.original_text: 带之，令贵人朝集入宅，大吉昌。 太微帝君印 带之，令人畏惧。 摄召灵神，无不振伏。 已上印择日刻之。 北狱使者印 带及吞之，去诸痫疾百病。 带右肘上，吉利。 大将军印 带之，伏强兵战斗，用之百胜。 并带右膊上。 力士神玉印 杂用随意，先书词，却印其上带之吉利。 太微帝君印 带之，令受敬，贵人相合。 长一寸二分，用六合日刻之。 北帝曰：已前神印，却灭三灾，安保三光，利宜万姓，去祸除殃，讨逐不祥。 若能志心，立见真道。 善哉善哉。 北帝曰：吾玄都大神印，分布六合，救灾解厄，治病消魔。 愿诸真子，勿示非人。 救印咒曰：午文。 太上神灵，炎帝之精。 霞光掣电，流曜三清。 流火万里，鬼无逃形。 神印一着，灰灭邪精。 三五将军，豁落吏兵。 平天戛地，诛鬼不停。 飞符走印，头戴五星。 掷火前杀，万鬼千精。 六天鬼贼，付与神丁。 五灵真老，是吾天师。 无碍神通，万灵同归。 恶鬼绝灭，不祥者追。 中黄九道，威布四围。 伏匿故气，不遣纤遗。 五瘟七疰，吾能杀之。 何神敢拒，何神敢窥。 酆都戮形，北斗斩尸。 神刀一下，万鬼消麋。 急急如太上五灵五气北方黑帝灵君律令敕。 又咒曰： 大道有神，名曰天丁。 奉承九天，受事三清。 下游世界，捕逐妖精。 神王一怒，五岳摧倾。 征东群魔，豁落鬼兵。 千千截首，万万剪形。 罗酆敢试，北都共营。 凶凶者戮，善善者宁。 六天沉魂，一一录名。 违道者死，顺道者生。 飞游灾煞，敢变幽冥。 鬼妖荡尽，人道安宁。 急急如北帝灵君敕印斩鬼律令敕煞摄。 北帝曰：此神咒神印，北玄所秘，上圣所宗。 告诸将来真子，精心受持。 立我形像，供养礼拜，精勤不替。

Carrying it commands awe and reverence. It summons and subdues all spirit deities without fail.

All the above seals should be carved on an auspicious day.

**The Northern Prison Envoy’s Seal**
Carried or swallowed, it dispels all epilepsy, convulsions, and the hundred diseases. Worn on the right elbow, it brings good fortune.

**The Great General’s Seal**
Carried, it subdues mighty armies and ensures victory in every battle. It should be worn on the right upper arm.

**The Valiant Warrior’s Divine Jade Seal**
Versatile in use; first inscribe the invocation, then stamp it, and carry it for good fortune.

**The Supreme Tenuity Sovereign’s Seal**
Carried, it ensures respect and harmony with noble persons. One *cun* and two *fen* in length, to be carved on a day of hexagram *Liù Hé*.

The Northern Emperor says: The preceding divine seals dispel the Three Calamities, secure the Three Luminaries, benefit the myriad families, remove misfortune and disaster, and expel all inauspiciousness. If one cultivates with sincere devotion, the true Dao shall manifest at once. Excellent, excellent!

The Northern Emperor says: My Mysterious Capital’s Great Divine Seal is distributed throughout the Six Directions, rescuing from disaster, resolving adversity, curing illness, and dispelling demons. May all true disciples guard it well and not show it to the unworthy.

**Incantation for Activating the Seal:**
*Wǔ wén.*
Supreme divine numen, essence of the Flame Emperor.
Rosy light flashes like lightning, streaming radiance through the Three Clarities.
Fire flows for ten thousand *li*, no ghost escapes its form.
With one impression of the divine seal, evil spirits are reduced to ashes.
The Generals of Three and Five, the *Huōluò* officers and soldiers,
Level heaven and strike earth, ceaselessly slaying ghosts.
Flying talismans and swift seals, bearing the Five Stars upon their heads,
Hurl fire to slay in advance, vanquishing ten thousand ghosts and a thousand spirits.
The demonic thieves of the Six Heavens are delivered to the Divine Soldiers.
The Five Numinous True Elders are my Celestial Masters.
Unobstructed divine power, all spirits return in unity.
Evil ghosts utterly destroyed, inauspicious ones pursued.
The Nine Paths of the Central Yellow spread might in all directions,
Subduing and concealing old *qi*, leaving not the slightest trace.
The Five Pestilences and Seven Afflictions—I can slay them all.
What spirit dares resist? What spirit dares spy?
Their forms are executed in Fengdu, their corpses severed by the Northern Dipper.
With one stroke of the divine blade, ten thousand ghosts dissolve into mist.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Supreme Five Numinous Five *Qi* Northern Dark Emperor’s Numinous Lord.

**Another Incantation:**
The Great Dao has a spirit, named the Heavenly Soldier.
Serving the Nine Heavens, attending the Three Clarities,
It roams the world below, capturing and pursuing demonic spirits.
When the Divine King is enraged, the Five Peaks crumble.
The eastern hordes of demons, the *Huōluò* ghostly soldiers,
Thousands upon thousands beheaded, ten thousand upon ten thousand their forms destroyed.
Dare they test the nether courts of Fengdu? The northern capital’s defenses stand firm.
The fiercest are executed, the virtuous find peace.
The sunken souls of the Six Heavens, each is recorded by name.
Those who defy the Dao die; those who follow it live.
Flying and roaming calamities, dare they alter the hidden and obscure?
Ghosts and demons are swept away, the human realm finds tranquility.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Northern Emperor’s Numinous Lord, commanding the seal to slay ghosts, as per the statutes and ordinances.

The Northern Emperor says: These divine incantations and seals are the secrets of the Northern Mystery, revered by the highest sages. I instruct all future true disciples to receive and uphold them with utmost sincerity. Establish my image, make offerings, and pay homage with unwavering diligence.

chunks.original_text: 每年龙行三日，马住五日，雉飞七日，戌建九日，甲子庚申之日，醮祭虔仰，专想不二。 每旦斋心，持念神咒满万遍。 当可功成，所施即应。 告诸来世真子，若居世俗，焚修香火，即微声持念，勿令高词，恐惊神祇，忌生死秽气。 凡持经，即须解禁。 此酆都神印，乃长生不死之道。 故置之於下元生界一十二图，以镇十二年月日灾气，伏灭十二时之难。 有修之於国，天下和平，诸方宾伏，蛮夷胡越，八表归仁。 若国土有灾，杀戮不息，君臣忧苦，皆须建七元之坛，急造印，挂於国维十二辰位，分野之中，晨夕焚香供养。 北真将降，神印灵仙，化为大神。 或作猛将，扶助国家，当为消灭三灾刑戮之难，戈甲不行，国土安康，君臣共泰，万民清吉，神印之力。 北帝曰：若下元生人，修吾此道。 未见科法，不睹经文。 符印不备，捻诀无方。 念诵无功，只言无效。 不知神仙妙道，事在精修。 日进其功，神灵习记。 宿愆既荡、罪业蒙原。 三障渐消，六根无碍。 上通灵智，下统人伦。 立召立来，神兵侍卫。 醮祭不辍，上圣日知。 治病消魔，应心随意。 功成道果，证入无为。 尔时，北帝所说神咒神印，付诸大力神王三十万人及诸妙行真人。 凡大地鬼神闻之，普皆摄伏，滞疾蒙苏，冤魂解脱。 此经又何名之？ 北帝曰：名为《酆都神印大帝妙经》，和天安地，度阳九之难，延命扶危。 人各受持，告诸真子精而行之。 太上元始天专说北帝伏麾神咒妙经卷第五竟 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第六 一名太上九真妙戒金箓度命九幽拔罪经 尔时，元始天尊在九清妙境三元宫中，御三炁之华，宝云玉座骞林之下，与诸大圣太上道君，太上老君，九皇上真，飞天大圣，妙行真人，四司五帝，天龙人鬼，无鞅数众，一时同会劫仞宝台。 十方来众，皆驾五色琼轮，八景琅舆，玄灵翠节，飞云素盖，麟驾羽轩，龙旗凤葆，狮子白鹤，啸歌邕邕，烧香散花，游空飞步，咏诵洞章，朝赞天尊，总校图箓，拔度诸苦。 时三元上宫，光明照耀。 洞朗太空，灵都紫微，辉映十方。 下及无极境界，长夜九幽地狱之中。 善恶命根，光中焕然。 一切玄司，无不照耀。 一一天宫，皆见元始天尊与诸大众，敷弘妙道，开化人天，标讫善功，注名黄箓，金格玉简，陈列三清。 一一地狱之中，皆见十方救苦天尊，入於九幽，拔度诸苦，勅命北帝，三官九府，百二十曹，五帝考官，察命童子，司命司录，司功司杀，土皇九垒，及四明公宾友僚属，五岳掾吏，执罚神兵，巨天力士，天驺甲卒，牛头狱卒，威剑神王，三界大魔，九亿鬼王，皆集九幽地狱之中，同禀教戒。 尔时，酆都北帝及诸鬼官，咸皆震悚，各作是念：我等积罪，身为鬼官，统御冥司，常居黑暗，动经亿劫，不见光明。 今日何缘？ 忽感上圣，威光朗耀，普照重昏，欲有启问，怀疑未敢。 尔时，普掠狱中，有诸罪人，名入黑簿。 牛头狱卒，驱上刀山，皆悉身首坏烂，五体零落。 其中独有一人，循山上下，逐树高低，履锋践刃，无一伤损，所有刀戟，变成莲花。 尔时，北帝心大惊怖，稽首礼谢，上白天尊：弟子先缘不幸，身任冥司，自处酆都，已经亿载。 屡见罪人，受诸苦恼。 亦见东方风雷之狱，常有黑风震雷霹雳，飞戈飘戟，冲突罪人，分散肢体，穿穴五藏，万劫受苦，不舍昼夜。
chunks.translated_text:
Each year, on the three days when the Dragon moves, the five days when the Horse halts, the seven days when the Pheasant flies, the nine days when the Dog establishes, and on the days of Jiazi and Gengshen, perform the jiao rites with reverence, focusing the mind without distraction. Each morning, purify the heart and recite the divine incantations ten thousand times. Thus may merit be accomplished and responses manifest without delay.

Instruct all future true disciples: if dwelling in the secular world, conduct the incense offerings and devotions in a subdued voice, avoiding loud recitation lest the gods and spirits be startled. Shun the polluting qi of birth and death. Whenever handling the scripture, first lift the prohibitions.

This Fengdu Divine Seal is the Dao of longevity and deathlessness. Thus it is placed within the Twelve Diagrams of the Lower Primordial’s Realm of Life, to suppress the baleful qi of the twelve years, months, and days, and to subdue the calamities of the twelve hours. If a nation practices this, the realm will know peace, all directions will submit, and the barbarians of the eight wilds will return to virtue. Should a land suffer disasters, incessant slaughter, or the sorrows of ruler and ministers, establish the Altar of the Seven Primordials, swiftly forge the seal, and hang it at the twelve earthly branches of the nation’s borders, within its astrological divisions. Morning and evening, burn incense and make offerings. The Perfected of the North will descend, and the divine seal’s transcendent immortals will transform into mighty deities—or fierce generals—to aid the state, dispelling the three disasters, averting punishments, halting warfare, and securing the land’s tranquility. Ruler and ministers will share prosperity, the myriad people will enjoy purity and fortune—all through the power of the divine seal.

The Northern Emperor says: If those born in the Lower Primordial cultivate this Dao of mine yet fail to witness its statutes, behold its scriptures, or prepare its talismans and seals, their hand gestures lack method, their recitations bear no merit, and they claim it yields no effect. They know not the wondrous Dao of immortals, for the matter lies in diligent cultivation. Daily progress in practice allows the gods and spirits to become familiar and mindful. Past transgressions are swept away, karmic offenses pardoned. The three obstacles gradually dissolve, the six senses become unobstructed. Above, one communes with numinous wisdom; below, one governs human relations. Summon, and they come at once—divine soldiers stand guard. Unceasing jiao rites ensure the Highest Sages take daily notice. Heal illnesses, dispel demons, and responses will follow the heart’s intent. Merit accomplished, the fruit of the Dao attained, one enters the realm of non-action.

At that time, the Northern Emperor bestowed the divine incantations and seals upon the thirty myriad Mighty Divine Kings and the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct. All the ghosts and spirits of the great earth, upon hearing this, universally submit. Those afflicted by stagnation and illness find relief; wronged souls achieve liberation.

What is this scripture called? The Northern Emperor says: It is named *The Wondrous Scripture of the Fengdu Divine Seal of the Great Emperor*, harmonizing Heaven and pacifying Earth, delivering from the calamities of the Nine Yangs, prolonging life and aiding the imperiled. Let each receive and uphold it, and all true disciples practice it with devotion.

Thus concludes *The Fifth Scroll of the Wondrous Scripture of the Northern Emperor’s Demon-Subduing Incantations*, spoken by the Most High Primordial Heavenly Venerable.

---

*The Sixth Scroll of the Wondrous Scripture of the Northern Emperor’s Demon-Subduing Incantations Spoken by the Most High Primordial Heavenly Venerable*
Also named: *The Most High Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts and Golden Register for Delivering Lives and Rescuing from the Nine Hells*

At that time, the Primordial Heavenly Venerable was in the Wondrous Realm of the Nine Purities, within the Three Primordials Palace, seated upon a jeweled cloud and jade throne beneath the canopy of the Qianlin trees. Together with the Great Sages—the Most High Dao Lords, the Most High Lord Lao, the Nine August Perfected, the Flying Heavenly Great Sages, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors, the hosts of heavenly dragons, humans, and ghosts, an innumerable assembly—all gathered at once upon the jeweled terrace of kalpas. The multitudes from the ten directions arrived, riding five-colored jade wheels, eight-scene jasper chariots, dark numinous jade staves, flying cloud white canopies, unicorn-drawn feathered carriages, dragon banners and phoenix plumes, lions and white cranes. Their roars and songs resounded harmoniously as they burned incense, scattered flowers, soared through the void, and chanted the cavernous hymns, praising the Heavenly Venerable and collectively reviewing the registers to deliver all from suffering.

Then, the Upper Palace of the Three Primordials radiated luminous brilliance, illuminating the vast emptiness. The Numinous Capital of the Purple Tenuity shone, casting its glow across the ten directions. Below, even the boundless realms and the eternal night of the Nine Hells of the netherworld were revealed. The roots of good and evil destinies gleamed within the light, and every mysterious office was illuminated. In every heavenly palace, the Primordial Heavenly Venerable and the great assembly were seen expounding the wondrous Dao, transforming humans and gods, marking meritorious deeds, and inscribing names in the Yellow Registers, golden tablets, and jade slips, arrayed before the Three Clarities.

Within each hell, the Ten Directions’ Savior Heavenly Venerables were seen entering the Nine Hells to deliver all from suffering. They commanded the Northern Emperor, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, the hundred-twenty departments, the Five Emperor Examiners, the Life-Inspecting Lads, the Recorders of Life and Deeds, the Controllers of Merit and Execution, the Nine Mounds of the Earth Sovereign, the Four Luminous Lords and their retinues, the officials of the Five Peaks, the divine soldiers enforcing punishments, the mighty heavenly warriors, the heavenly couriers and armored troops, the Ox-Head jailers, the Mighty Sword Divine Kings, the great demons of the Three Realms, and the nine hundred million ghost kings—all gathered in the Nine Hells of the netherworld to receive the teachings and precepts.

At that time, the Northern Emperor of Fengdu and all the ghost officials trembled in awe, each thinking: "We have accumulated sins and become ghost officials, governing the netherworld, dwelling in darkness for kalpas without end, never beholding light. What karmic cause brings us today to suddenly witness the august radiance of the Highest Sages illuminating the profound gloom? We wish to inquire but hesitate in doubt."

At that time, within the prisons of universal torment, all the sinners whose names were inscribed in the Black Registers were driven by the Ox-Head jailers onto the Mountain of Knives. Their heads and bodies were shattered, their limbs scattered. Yet among them, one man alone ascended and descended the mountain, following the trees’ heights, treading upon blades and edges without a single wound. All the swords and halberds transformed into lotus flowers.

Then, the Northern Emperor was greatly alarmed. He bowed his head in reverence and addressed the Heavenly Venerable: "Your disciple, by past karma, was unfortunate to assume office in the netherworld, dwelling in Fengdu for kalpas uncounted. I have repeatedly witnessed sinners enduring myriad torments. I have also seen the Eastern Prison of Wind and Thunder, where black winds, crashing thunder, and lightning bolts hurl flying spears and drifting halberds, piercing sinners’ bodies, scattering their limbs, and rending their viscera. For ten thousand kalpas, they suffer without respite, day or night."

chunks.original_text: 又见南方火翳之狱，有诸罪人，吞火食炭，为火所烧，头面焦燎，头戴火山，皮肤骨肉，节节生火，万劫受苦，不舍昼夜。 又见西方金刚之狱，有诸罪人，金槌铁杖，乱拷无数，肢体坏烂，筋骨零落，铁叉穿腹，金槌塞心，万劫受苦，不拾昼夜。 又见北方凕泠之狱，有诸罪人，沉没丘寒之池，冰戟霜刃，冲断筋骨，百毒之汁，以灌其上，五体零落，心腹破坏，万劫受苦，不舍昼夜。 又见中央普掠之狱，有诸罪人，身被拷掠，痛毒难忍，断筋流血，闷绝掷地，於是狱卒，方以铁叉叉刺，令诸罪人，各各循上刀山剑树，八达黑风，吹树低昂，足落刀山，身挂剑锷，万劫受苦，不舍昼夜。 又见东南方铜柱之狱，有诸罪人，手抱足登，表裹焦烂，筋骨零落，腹背脓溃，万劫受苦，不舍昼夜。 又见西南方屠割之狱，有诸罪人，身被倒悬，刀剑割体，四肢筋脉，皮肤五藏，皆有刀刃割切其中，血流满地，非可堪忍，万劫受苦，不舍昼夜。 又见西北方火车之狱，有诸罪人，五车裂体，四肢分散，或身处火车东西，一一车轮皆有刀刃，随轮运转，割切肢体，加诸猛火，烧炙焦烂，万劫受苦，不舍昼夜。 又见东北方镬汤之狱，有诸罪人，身被铁叉，叉入镬汤，五体煮渍，四肢溃烂，脓血臭秽，不可堪忍，万劫受苦，不舍昼夜。 未审今此罪人，以何因缘，巡上刀山剑树，了无伤损，刀戟锋刃，变成莲花，相好端严，独步无畏，众苦所加，莫能害者。 忽感上圣回驾，天真降集，一切震惧，莫知所以。 惟愿天尊大慈大悲，溥济溥度，令诸九幽受苦众生，拔除众罪，自识宿命，舍恶从善，得出九幽，身处光明，轮转福报，长得解脱，永离三涂。 尔时，九幽地狱众生，闻是北帝广为启请，心生悔过，愿求拔罪，举声悲叫，响震梵天。 尔时，十方救苦天尊，大悲观心，普及一切，度身威光，假六通惠，令诸罪人，闭眼静思。 俄顷之间，自识宿命，各各明了。 生存之日，或造诸恶业。 或手弒君父，不孝二亲。 或诽谤大道，背真就伪。 或伤残兄弟，谋及师尊。 或六亲通同，淫犯骨肉。 或为劫贼，杀害人命。 或屠割众生，自饶一身。 或以强凌弱，以贵虐贱。 或浮好三宝，执心不专。 或轻慢法师，秽贱灵文。 或心怀阴贼，安忍嫉妬。 或恶口两舌，斗乱善人。 或杀生淫祀，裸露三光。 或心生，或口语，或自作，或教他。 积劫以来，所有诸罪，一时顿悟，各各明了。 倍增悲恼，愿求解脱。 天尊普告四众曰：汝等谛听，此诸罪人，亿劫已来，不信经教，唯罪是修，恶恶相牵，赃满罪定，遂使名书黑簿，身没九幽，沉沦三涂，未应解脱。 赖於其中，有此一人，生存之日，曾建九幽大斋，受持金箓白简、九真妙戒，标名金格，列字玉清，德重功高，名通上界。 我以神力，随念救护。 今当普宣禁戒，绝诸恶根，咸使汝等一时解脱。
chunks.translated_text:
Moreover, he beheld the Southern Prison of Blazing Obscurity, where multitudes of sinners swallowed fire and devoured coals, scorched by flames. Their faces and heads were charred, fire-mountains crowned their skulls, and from their skin, bones, and flesh, flames erupted joint by joint. For ten thousand kalpas, they suffered without respite, day or night.

He further witnessed the Western Prison of Diamond, where sinners endured countless beatings with iron hammers and metal rods. Their limbs rotted and disintegrated, their sinews and bones scattered. Iron forks pierced their bellies, and golden hammers lodged in their hearts. For ten thousand kalpas, they suffered without pause, day or night.

He also saw the Northern Prison of Freezing Cold, where sinners sank into pools of frigid mire. Ice-spears and frost-blades severed their sinews and bones, while vats of venomous brew were poured upon them. Their bodies fell apart, their hearts and viscera ruptured. For ten thousand kalpas, they suffered without respite, day or night.

Then he observed the Central Prison of Universal Torment, where sinners endured unbearable agony under relentless torture. Their sinews snapped, blood flowed, and they collapsed in swoons. Thereupon, the wardens impaled them with iron forks, compelling them to ascend the mountains of blades and forests of swords. Black winds from all directions swayed the trees, causing their feet to slip onto the knife-mountains and their bodies to hang upon the sword-edges. For ten thousand kalpas, they suffered without cease, day or night.

He further beheld the Southeastern Prison of Bronze Pillars, where sinners embraced and climbed the pillars, their outer and inner flesh scorched and rotted. Their sinews and bones fell apart, their backs and bellies festered with pus. For ten thousand kalpas, they suffered without respite, day or night.

He also saw the Southwestern Prison of Butchery, where sinners were suspended upside down while blades carved their bodies. Their limbs, sinews, skin, and viscera were all sliced by knives, blood pooling upon the ground in unbearable torment. For ten thousand kalpas, they suffered without pause, day or night.

Moreover, he witnessed the Northwestern Prison of Fire Chariots, where sinners were torn asunder by five chariots, their limbs scattered. Some were cast amid the fire chariots, each wheel lined with blades that, as they turned, sliced their bodies. Fierce flames roasted them to charred ruin. For ten thousand kalpas, they suffered without respite, day or night.

He further beheld the Northeastern Prison of Boiling Cauldrons, where sinners were impaled by iron forks and plunged into cauldrons of boiling liquid. Their bodies were steeped and cooked, their limbs dissolved into pus and blood, the stench unbearable. For ten thousand kalpas, they suffered without cease, day or night.

The Northern Emperor then inquired: "By what karmic cause does this one sinner alone ascend and descend the mountains of blades and forests of swords unscathed, the spears and halberds transforming into lotus flowers? His countenance is majestic, his steps fearless, and though myriad torments assail him, none can harm him."

Suddenly, the Heavenly Venerable turned his chariot, and the Perfected Ones descended in assembly. All trembled in awe, uncertain of what was to come.

The Northern Emperor entreated: "May the Heavenly Venerable, in his great compassion and mercy, universally save and deliver all beings suffering in the Nine Dark Realms. May their sins be eradicated, their past lives recalled, and may they forsake evil to embrace goodness. May they escape the Nine Dark Realms, dwell in radiance, and through the wheel of blessed retribution, attain lasting liberation, forever departing the Three Wretched Paths."

At that moment, the multitudes of the Nine Dark Hells, hearing the Northern Emperor’s earnest plea, awakened to remorse and yearned for absolution. Their cries of sorrow resounded, shaking the Brahma-heavens.

Then, the Heavenly Venerables of the Ten Directions, moved by boundless compassion, surveyed all with their salvific light. Through the power of the Six Penetrations, they bade the sinners close their eyes and meditate in stillness. In an instant, each recalled their past lives and understood their deeds.

In their former existences, they had committed myriad evils:
Some had murdered their lords or fathers, or been unfilial to their parents.
Some had slandered the Great Dao, turning from truth to falsehood.
Some had harmed their brothers or plotted against their masters.
Some, with their kin, had committed incest.
Some had been bandits, taking lives.
Some had slaughtered beings to indulge their own flesh.
Some had oppressed the weak with strength or abused the lowly with power.
Some had feigned devotion to the Three Treasures while their hearts wavered.
Some had disdained Dharma-teachers or defiled sacred scriptures.
Some had harbored malice, cruelty, or jealousy.
Some had wielded vicious tongues, sowing discord among the virtuous.
Some had killed living beings in licentious rites or exposed the Three Luminaries to shame.
Whether by thought, word, or deed—whether self-committed or taught to others—
all sins accumulated over kalpas were suddenly realized, each clearly understood.

Their sorrow redoubled, and they yearned for liberation.

The Heavenly Venerable addressed the four assemblies: "Listen well. These sinners, for countless kalpas, have disbelieved the scriptures and teachings, persisting only in evil. Sin upon sin has bound them, their transgressions complete and their fates sealed. Thus, their names were inscribed in the Black Register, their bodies cast into the Nine Dark Realms, sunk in the Three Wretched Paths, with no hope of deliverance.

Yet among them was this one who, in life, had established the Great Fast of the Nine Dark Realms, upheld the Golden Register and White Petitions, and observed the Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts. His name was inscribed in the Golden Ledger and recorded in the Jade Clarity. His virtue was profound, his merit lofty, and his name known in the Upper Realms. By my divine power, I have responded to his prayers and protected him.

Now, I shall proclaim the prohibitions and sever all roots of evil, that all of you may be liberated at once."

chunks.original_text: 尔时，北帝闻是说，己心大欢，喜不胜，踊跃瞻仰尊颜，而作颂曰： 善哉元始尊，众生慈父母。 倾光紫微宫，曲映九幽户。 峨峨丘寒庭，回照廓冰浦。 炎炎烈火狱，霈然洒法雨。 圆通大哀智，常善济众苦。 拔度长夜魂，今得稽首礼。 尔时，北帝说是颂已，是诸大众同声称善。 钧天伎乐，万种互作。 幢盖香花，荫洒一切。 於是元始天尊复告四众曰：汝等谛听，静念在心。 吾当为汝显说九真妙戒、金箓白简受持功德，拔难济苦，神力难思。 众灵稽首，伏受教命。 天尊告曰：

At that moment, the Northern Emperor, having heard these words, was overjoyed in his heart, his delight beyond measure. Leaping with reverence, he gazed upon the Venerable One’s countenance and offered this hymn of praise:

*"Excellent indeed, Most High Lord of the Primordial Beginning,
Compassionate Father and Mother of all beings.
From the Purple Tenuity Palace, Your radiance pours forth,
Bending to illumine the gates of the Nine Dark Realms.
Majestic and towering, the Frigid Courts of the Netherworld,
Your reflected light expands across the frozen shores.
In the raging flames of the infernal pits,
A torrential Dharma-rain descends in abundance.
Boundless is Your great wisdom of universal compassion,
Ever skillful in delivering beings from suffering.

I shall now reveal to you the Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts, the merit of upholding the Golden Register and White Petitions, the deliverance from calamity and salvation from suffering—divine powers beyond comprehension."*

The assembled spirits bowed their heads in reverence, prostrating themselves to receive the sacred command. The Heavenly Venerable One declared:

chunks.original_text: 年  月  日  时斋坛告下。 太极真人曰：修上真大洞道及三真之要，而不知酆都山真形者，七祖不得荡灭於胞门也。 又名六天策文，丹黑书写殁者姓名於其侧，烈火炀之，则此都解其缚，三官赦愆，上升福堂矣。 石刻立台墓宫，苦魂受度，简记朱陵。 学者佩身及置堂房上，万鬼灭爽，幽源开泰。 此文书上清北元之阙，以正六剑之分，出《元始六天制魔经》 赞曰： 酆都真形，文隶上清。 学修仙士，佩制魔精。 三官赐福，七祖受生。 削除黑簿，炼度朱陵。 威神默护，致道契成。 六天策文，镇宅利亨。 开业道甘露通真咒曰： 功德金色光，微微开幽关。 华池流真香，莲盖随云浮。 千灵重元和，常居十二楼。 急宣灵宝旨，自在天堂游。 此名破地狱通真神咒，及太上金口所宣秘咒妙言。 若人持诵，能令地狱门开，关锁自落。 九幽罢对，六道停轮。 苦魂受生，先灵超度。 浄酆都地狱升天咒曰： 茫茫酆都中，重重金刚山。 灵宝无量光，洞照炎池烦。 七祖诸幽魂，身随香云旛。 定慧青莲花，上生神永安。 天尊言：此神咒，若地狱幽魂，一闻咒名，自然快乐，得生天路。 此二神咒，出《甘露神咒地狱升天经》。 酆都山真形 汝等若能受持金箓白简九真妙戒、长生灵符、救苦真符，当消九幽大罪，标名九宫。 察命童子护戒，威神五帝直符，六宫掾吏自当随逐简文，覆护受戒弟子。 天尊又曰：若有国土，兵灾不息，疫毒流行，是其国主后妃太子王公及诸庶人，亦当修建九幽大斋，各各受持九真妙戒、金箓宝符。 兵灾静息，妖恶自屏，天人称庆，欣国太平。 若在山林旷野，为虎狼猛兽之所奔突。 便当宁心，存思金简灵符，察命童子、受戒法师、护法神王。 猛兽自退，终不害己。 若入大海，遭遇恶风，亦当存念风波静息，得达於岸。 若入军阵白刃之中，亦当存念兵杖伏匿，不有损伤。 若在牢狱枷锁之中，亦当存念冤枉自伸，必得解脱。 若为邪精众苦所缠，亦当存念鬼魅消灭，自然差愈。 若人命过，应入九幽，名书黑簿。 夫妻男女门人同学，当为亡人立九幽大斋，名书白简，为受九真妙戒，烧除黑簿。 彼诸罪人，应时解脱，升入天门，因缘轮转，得为九宫真人。 天尊又曰：金箓妙戒、长生灵符，威禁至重。 若能如法修行，其福无量。 若复有人起心诽谤，生轻慢想。 当知此人积恶万劫，罪障深重，名书黑簿，身没鬼官。 命过之后，必当沦陷九幽地狱，备受诸苦，绵绵长夜，不可解脱。 设复有人，初虽信受，后起悔心。 察命童子奏上三官，削除金简，注名死录。 或在见世身受恶病，虫癫痈疽，人所弃掷，求生不得，求死不得，忧恼自煎，无由解脱。 或复长被横恶所加。 或犯王法。 或犯刀兵。 或犯虎狼。 或犯水火。 或犯恶人，口舌咒诅，室家不和，门庭起诤，冤家牵引。 一失真道，常沦恶趣。 是故汝等，依科遵奉，勿生异念。 宣告男女，咸使闻知。 是时，北帝及诸四众、九幽罪人，闻是说，已神开意悟，各发善念。 众苦消释，身心泰然，背#1发道意，永不轮转。 是时九幽黑簿，一时焚烬。 火山息焰，水池静波。 吞火食炭，化为甘露。 金槌铁杖，变成莲花。 飞空步虚，而作颂曰： 稽首无上道，归心元始尊。

On the [Year] [Month] [Day] at the [Hour], the altar of the fast proclaims:

The Perfected of the Great Ultimate declares: Those who cultivate the Great Cavern Dao of the Supreme Perfected and the essentials of the Three Perfected, yet do not know the True Form of Mount Fengdu, shall not have their seven ancestors purged from the Womb Gate. This is also called the *Six Heavens’ Strategic Text*. Inscribe the deceased’s name in cinnabar and black ink beside it, then refine it in searing flames—thus shall this realm loose its bonds, the Three Offices pardon transgressions, and the soul ascend to the Hall of Blessings. Carve it in stone and erect it at the tomb palace, and suffering souls shall receive deliverance, their names recorded in the Vermilion Numinous Court. Let scholars wear it upon their person or place it above the hall’s chambers, and ten thousand ghosts shall vanish without trace, while the hidden springs of darkness open to prosperity.

This text is inscribed at the Northern Gate of Supreme Clarity, governing the division of the Six Swords, as recorded in the *Scripture of the Primordial Six Heavens’ Subjugation of Demons*.

Its eulogy says:
The True Form of Fengdu,
Text of Supreme Clarity.
Cultivating immortals,
Wear it to subdue demonic essence.
The Three Offices bestow blessings,
Seven ancestors receive rebirth.
Black ledgers erased,
Refined and delivered to the Vermilion Numinous Court.
Might and spirit silently guard,
Attaining the Dao’s fulfillment.
The *Six Heavens’ Strategic Text*,
Secures the home and brings prosperity.

The *Sweet Dew Communion with Perfection Incantation* says:
Virtue’s golden radiance,
Gently opens the gates of darkness.
The Flower Pool flows with true fragrance,
Lotus canopies drift upon the clouds.
A thousand spirits harmonize primordial unity,
Ever dwelling in the Twelve Towers.
Hasten to proclaim the Lingbao decree,
And wander freely in the celestial halls.

This is called the *Divine Incantation Breaking Hell’s Bonds and Communing with Perfection*, a secret and wondrous utterance proclaimed by the Golden Mouth of the Most High. If one recites it, the gates of hell shall open, locks shall fall away of themselves, the Nine Dark Realms shall cease their trials, and the Six Paths shall halt their turning. Suffering souls shall receive rebirth, and forebears shall ascend in deliverance.

The *Incantation Purifying Fengdu’s Hell and Ascending to Heaven* says:
Vast and boundless, within Fengdu,
Layer upon layer, the Vajra Mountains stand.
The boundless radiance of Lingbao,
Illumines the scorching pools of affliction.
The seven ancestors and all hidden souls,
Their forms follow the fragrant cloud-banners.
With the blue lotus of concentration and wisdom,
They ascend to the divine, forever at peace.

The Heavenly Worthy declares: If the imprisoned souls of hell hear even the name of this divine incantation, they shall naturally rejoice and attain the path to heaven. These two divine incantations are from the *Sweet Dew Divine Incantations Scripture of Ascending from Hell to Heaven*.

**The True Form of Mount Fengdu**
If you receive and uphold the Golden Register, the White Petition, the Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts, the Talisman of Longevity for the Spirit, and the True Talisman of Salvation from Suffering, you shall dissolve the great sins of the Nine Dark Realms and inscribe your name in the Nine Palaces. The Youth Who Surveys Destiny shall guard the precepts, the Mighty Spirits and the Direct Talismans of the Five Emperors, and the clerks of the Six Palaces shall follow the petition’s text, sheltering and protecting the disciples who receive the precepts.

The Heavenly Worthy further declares: If in any land war ceases not and pestilence spreads, let its ruler, queen, crown prince, nobles, and all common people establish the Great Fast of the Nine Dark Realms, each receiving the Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts and the Golden Register’s sacred talismans. War shall quiet, malevolent forces shall withdraw, heaven and humanity shall rejoice, and the land shall know great peace.

If in mountains or wilds you are beset by tigers, wolves, or fierce beasts, calm your heart and visualize the Golden Petition’s talisman, the Youth Who Surveys Destiny, the Precept Master, and the Dharma-Protecting Divine Kings. The beasts shall retreat of themselves and never harm you.

If upon the great sea you encounter fierce winds, visualize the stilling of waves and storms, and you shall reach the shore.

If amid the blades of battle you stand, visualize weapons vanishing, and you shall suffer no harm.

If imprisoned in shackles and bonds, visualize your grievances redressed, and you shall surely be freed.

If afflicted by demonic spirits or manifold sufferings, visualize malevolent ghosts vanishing, and you shall naturally recover.

If one has passed away and is bound for the Nine Dark Realms, their name inscribed in the Black Ledger, let their spouse, children, disciples, and fellow students establish the Great Fast of the Nine Dark Realms, inscribe their name on a White Petition, receive the Nine Perfected Wondrous Precepts, and burn away the Black Ledger. Those sinful souls shall be instantly released, ascend through the Celestial Gate, and through the turning of karmic conditions, become Perfected of the Nine Palaces.

The Heavenly Worthy further declares: The wondrous precepts of the Golden Register and the Talisman of Longevity for the Spirit bear the weightiest of prohibitions. If cultivated in accordance with the method, their blessings shall be boundless. Yet if one harbors doubt and slander, fostering thoughts of contempt, know that such a person accumulates evil across ten thousand kalpas, their sins profound and heavy, their name inscribed in the Black Ledger, their body consigned to the demonic officials. After death, they shall inevitably sink into the Nine Dark Hells of Fengdu, enduring every torment through endless nights, never to be freed.

Should one initially believe and receive, only to later regret, the Youth Who Surveys Destiny shall report to the Three Offices, erase their name from the Golden Petition, and inscribe it in the Ledger of Death. In this life, they may suffer malignant diseases—worms, leprosy, ulcers, and abscesses—abandoned by all, unable to live yet unable to die, tormented by their own anguish, with no escape. Or they may long endure misfortune: falling victim to violence, violating the king’s law, perishing by blade or beast, drowning in water or burning in fire, cursed by evil tongues, discord in the household, strife at the gate, or entanglement with enemies. Once having lost the true Dao, they shall forever sink into evil destinies.

Therefore, follow the regulations and uphold them without deviant thoughts. Proclaim this to all men and women, that all may hear and know.

At that time, the Northern Emperor and all the four assemblies, along with the sinful souls of the Nine Dark Realms, hearing these words, their spirits awakened and minds enlightened, each aroused good intentions. Their manifold sufferings dissolved, their bodies and minds at peace, they turned their backs on the cycles of rebirth and forever embraced the Dao.

At that moment, the Black Ledgers of the Nine Dark Realms were all consumed in flames. The flames of Fire Mountain subsided, the waves of the Water Prison stilled. Those who swallowed fire and ate coals were transformed into sweet dew. Golden hammers and iron staves became lotus blossoms. Walking upon the void, they chanted in praise:

We bow our heads to the Supreme Dao,
Our hearts return to the Primordial Worthy.

chunks.original_text: 至真妙应主，开化飞玄门。 妙戒悟五灵，金书警万神。 察命录籍，灵符度苦魂。 乘云朝玉帝，齐契玄中人。 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第六竟 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第七 九龙品 尔时，天尊在紫微宫中九龙座上，青春长斋之月十五日，明星皎洁之时，与诸天帝，八威神王，地下众灵，仙男仙女，神男神女，九宫仙人，飞仙部众，悉在道前稽首，长跪瞻视圣颜。 天尊默然，一无所说，闭目静思，普念十方无量众生，处在愚冥，不闻真正，造诸恶业，没生死河，输回五道。 穷苦所逼，谁能悟理，独吾知耳。 心念是已，便复叩齿。 不觉北帝乘道威力，知有所念，从北方玄丘绝顶之上，与诸真骑浮空而来，直诣道前，虔心作礼，上白天尊言：上圣慈化，悯念天人，备受灾厄，广为救拔。 诸天欢乐，瑞云映生。 地狱无冤对之愆，天堂荷更生之庆。 邪妖屏绝，六洞不开。 人天赤子，普获深恩。 又念穷苦所逼，饥寒忧悲。 不审上圣，将何救度？ 如蒙拯济，诸天荷恩。 天尊告曰：子今所请，欲令人天，贫富一均，无有差别，当为汝说。 成天立地，起自无为。 结气凝空，是因吾教。 宿命修短，得道因缘。 注上生籍者，诣南昌之宫。 去灾荣禄者，求於北斗。 执簿追呼者，属於三官之司。 利禄获珍者，即须五龙九圣。 吾今演说，各愿受持。 天尊告曰：四天之中，有九龙微妙名字，善利官禄，令土地丰熟，灾害不生，有求称遂，离诸虚耗，日得富昌。 天尊告曰：龙化无迹，因道而生。 为天帝之威灵，卫世人之俸禄，其由信也。 告诸大众，若国土灾厄，五谷不丰，贫穷困苦，衣食不充。 及诸国人民，官禄不迁，忧惶相继，诸不称意，名宦不昌。 欲求利益者，当先立吾形像，置三官之位，建九龙之坛。 晨夕三时，焚香行道。 礼念九龙名字，召五方龙王。 精思北极，天符将降，龙王即临。 受其信心，为勅五土之神，广作利益，运五方珍宝，来降境中，国土丰饶，无不遂意。 精诚之者，立应其福。 道言：青龙者，是东方七宿角亢之精，下降人间，护持国土。 青华宫内，化生修吉龙王、深林龙王，掌领青色之宝、地下杂珍，卫护人世青色之衣官禄。 有人居世，愿不副心，贫穷逃难，宜立坛焚香，画形礼拜，念诵三日三夜，或七日七夜。 清斋启请，能招东方无极世界青色之宝及青色之衣官禄，入人身中，消除东方格木之灾、凶横之厄，岁星真官即为注籍，令人富贵。 赤龙者，是南方七宿井鬼之精，下降人间，护持国土。 长生宫内，化生多善龙王、花留龙王，掌领赤色之宝、地下杂珍，卫护人世赤色之衣官禄。 有人居世，值诸迍厄，官禄不迁，七珍不集者，宜立坛焚香供养，礼拜求愿。 能招南方无极世界赤色珍宝及赤色之衣官禄，入人身中，消除火灾，口舌之忧，见世安乐，令人福兴。 白龙者，是西方七宿奎娄之精，下降人间，护持国土。 素云宫内，化生甘恩龙王、善然龙王，掌领白色之宝，注人世白色之衣官禄，管地下七珍。 有人居世，志愿不从，名宦不达，公私赛迫。 宜立坛焚香，献水礼拜，供养启请。 能招西方无极世界白色之宝及白色之衣官禄，降入人身，消除虚耗咒诅之厄，广利土地，令五谷丰登，心神安泰，公私俱利，福禄齐新。

The Most Perfect and Wondrous Lord,
Opens the Flying Mystery Gate.
With subtle precepts, awakens the Five Spirits;

The Seventh Scroll of *The Supreme Venerable Sovereign’s Wondrous Scripture of the Northern Emperor’s Divine Incantations for Subduing Demons*
**The Chapter of the Nine Dragons**

At that time, the Heavenly Worthy was seated upon the Nine Dragons Throne within the Purple Tenuity Palace. It was the fifteenth day of the month of Everlasting Spring, when the bright star shone resplendent. Before him, the various Heavenly Emperors, the Eight Mighty Spirit Kings, the multitudes of earthly spirits, immortal men and women, divine men and women, the immortals of the Nine Palaces, and the hosts of flying immortals all prostrated themselves, kneeling in reverence to gaze upon his sacred countenance.

The Heavenly Worthy remained silent, uttering not a word. Closing his eyes in tranquil contemplation, he reflected upon the boundless beings of the ten directions, mired in ignorance and darkness, unaware of the true and correct Dao. They commit manifold evil deeds, drowning in the river of birth and death, drifting through the Five Paths. Oppressed by extreme suffering, who among them can awaken to the truth? Only I know.

Having thus pondered, he once more clicked his teeth. Unbeknownst to him, the Northern Emperor, sensing the power of the Dao, perceived his thoughts. From the summit of the Dark Mound in the north, he arrived with his divine retinue, riding the void, and approached the Heavenly Worthy. With utmost reverence, he bowed and addressed him, saying: "Most Sagely One, your compassionate transformation pities the suffering of heaven and humanity, enduring calamities and hardships. You broadly extend salvation. The heavens rejoice, auspicious clouds arise. The hells are freed from grievances, and the heavens bear the joy of renewed life. Demons and malevolent spirits are banished, the Six Caves sealed. The children of heaven and earth universally receive profound grace. Yet you also reflect upon those oppressed by poverty and hardship, afflicted by hunger, cold, sorrow, and grief. We do not know, Most Sagely One, by what means you will save and deliver them. If you deign to grant succor, the heavens will be ever grateful."

The Heavenly Worthy replied: "What you now request is that in heaven and earth, the poor and rich may be made equal, without distinction. I shall now expound this for you. The establishment of heaven and earth arises from non-action. The coalescence of qi and the condensation of the void are the result of my teachings. The length of one’s predestined life and the causes of attaining the Dao—those whose names are inscribed in the Registers of the Upper Birth proceed to the Palace of Southern Prosperity. Those who seek to avert disasters and attain honor and emolument turn to the Northern Dipper. Those pursued by the ledgers belong to the offices of the Three Officials. Those who obtain wealth and treasures must seek the Nine Saints and Five Dragons. I shall now expound this; may each of you receive and uphold it."

The Heavenly Worthy declared: "Within the Four Heavens, there are the wondrous names of the Nine Dragons. They bestow blessings upon official emoluments, ensure the fertility of the land, prevent disasters, grant the fulfillment of prayers, and ward off all depletion, bringing daily prosperity and abundance."

The Heavenly Worthy declared: "Dragons leave no trace, for they arise through the Dao. As the majestic spirits of the Heavenly Emperor, they guard the stipends of the world’s people—this is their trust. I now proclaim to the great assembly: If a land suffers calamities, its five grains do not flourish, and its people endure poverty, hardship, and insufficient clothing and food; if its officials stagnate in rank, their worries unending, and all their desires unfulfilled, their reputations and careers unprosperous—those who seek benefit should first establish my image, set up the altars of the Three Officials, and construct the platform of the Nine Dragons. At dawn, noon, and dusk, they should burn incense and perform the Daoist rites. By reverently reciting the names of the Nine Dragons and summoning the Dragon Kings of the Five Directions, concentrating their thoughts upon the Northern Culmen, the celestial talismans will descend, and the Dragon Kings will arrive. Receiving their sincere devotion, the Dragon Kings will command the spirits of the Five Lands to widely bestow benefits, dispatching the treasures of the Five Directions to descend upon the realm. The land will flourish abundantly, and all wishes will be fulfilled. Those of utmost sincerity will immediately receive their blessings."

The Dao declares: The Azure Dragon is the essence of the Seven Mansions of the East—Horn and Neck—descending to the human realm to protect the land. Within the Azure Flower Palace, it transforms into the Auspicious Cultivation Dragon King and the Deep Forest Dragon King, presiding over the azure treasures and the various subterranean riches, guarding the azure robes and official emoluments of the world. If one in the world finds their aspirations unfulfilled, suffering poverty and fleeing calamity, they should establish an altar, burn incense, depict the dragon’s form, and prostrate in worship. Reciting the scripture for three days and nights, or seven days and nights, maintaining purity and invoking the dragon, they can summon the azure treasures of the Infinite World of the East and the azure robes and official emoluments into their body. This will dispel the calamities of the Eastern Wood Star, the misfortunes of violent disasters, and the True Official of the Year Star will inscribe their name in the registers, bringing wealth and nobility.

The Vermilion Dragon is the essence of the Seven Mansions of the South—Well and Ghost—descending to the human realm to protect the land. Within the Palace of Longevity, it transforms into the Many Virtues Dragon King and the Flower Remaining Dragon King, presiding over the vermilion treasures and the various subterranean riches, guarding the vermilion robes and official emoluments of the world. If one in the world encounters misfortunes, their official rank stagnant and the seven treasures ungathered, they should establish an altar, burn incense, make offerings, and prostrate in worship to seek their wishes. This will summon the vermilion treasures of the Infinite World of the South and the vermilion robes and official emoluments into their body, dispelling fire disasters and the sorrows of slander. They will enjoy peace in this life and their blessings will flourish.

The White Dragon is the essence of the Seven Mansions of the West—Straddler and Stomach—descending to the human realm to protect the land. Within the White Cloud Palace, it transforms into the Sweet Grace Dragon King and the Virtuous Serenity Dragon King, presiding over the white treasures and bestowing the white robes and official emoluments of the world, governing the seven subterranean treasures. If one in the world finds their aspirations unfulfilled, their reputation and career unrealized, and both public and private affairs obstructed, they should establish an altar, burn incense, offer water, prostrate in worship, and make invocations. This will summon the white treasures of the Infinite World of the West and the white robes and official emoluments to descend into their body, dispelling the misfortunes of depletion and curses, widely benefiting the land, ensuring abundant harvests of the five grains, and bringing peace to the mind and spirit. Both public and private affairs will prosper, and blessings and emoluments will be renewed.

, they turned their backs on the cycles of rebirth and forever embraced the Dao.

At that moment, the Black Ledgers of the Nine Dark Realms were all consumed in flames. The flames of Fire Mountain subsided, the waves of the Water Prison stilled. Those who swallowed fire and ate coals were transformed into sweet dew. Golden hammers and iron staves became lotus blossoms. Walking upon the void, they chanted in praise:

We bow our heads to the Supreme Dao,
Our hearts return to the Primordial Worthy.

chunks.original_text: 黑龙者，是北方七宿斗牛之精，下降人间，护持国土。 太阴宫内，化生波流龙王、思度龙王，掌领黑色之宝及黑色之衣宫禄，注舟船之道。 有人居世，所愿乖违，未偿素志者，宜立坛礼拜。 能致北方无极世界黑色之宝及黑色之衣官禄，入人身中，能消水灾船车之厄，欲令土地丰稔。 礼此龙神黄龙者，是中央七宿□□之精，下降人间，护持国土。 高皇天内，化生离宫龙王，掌领黄色之宝及五方库藏之珍，供给万姓衣食俸禄。 随人居处房室之中，及名山珍宝窟穴之中。 及人居世，欲求福禄称意，宜立坛礼念。 能招中央土帝之宫地下黄色珍宝官禄，入人身中，生业日盛，贵极王祚，万愿从心，消除五脏百病之厄、及五星临命之灾，镇星注籍，令人福生。 道言：此五方龙王，善镇国土。 又其九龙，善护珍宝，化生五方。 若国土五谷不丰，人多饥馑，王赋不充，逃亡山谷，怨声盈路。 心欲求安，当须置立九龙道场，转经行道，天降甘露，饥者自饱，五谷早熟，花果有味，救此饥荒，免致命殂，龙王之力。 道言：若诸国土分野，灾祥四兴，五谷断种，人民饥荒。 可以碧玉、黄金、象牙为简，以三元之日，书九龙名字，据分野五方，钉入地一尺二寸。 安镇神龙，仍以香花逐位供养。 七日之后，骊宫龙王与北帝大将，诣朱明宫开宝藏，运七真之具，及诣羊山左谷中取五谷，来赴此国救济，天人即得丰稔，免诸忧悲。 道言：若国土男女，生遇丑星恶宿之年，五墓四绝之下，运命不昌，生逢虚耗，衣食不充，忧惶旦夕，百不称意。 其欲求福，当立坛礼念九龙真形，及每月二十六日，焚香献水，佩带九龙真符，及五龙大箓。 精诚专志，龙降天威，入人宅舍，令所求如意，立得利宜。 道言：若诸国人民方伯，二千石下至令长，欲得官禄高迁，身无灾难，禁断有方，无诸诤讼。 可以象牙，於福生之日东立，书此九龙名字，以五色袋盛之，精诚奉信。 於所卧之室，每至月辰之日，以名花异果献之，及净水供养。 龙王下降，神力护人，扶助王化，迁官宜禄。 道言：五虚之鬼，姓狼，字僧文。 六耗之鬼，姓黄，字元盖。 每年作人虚耗，令人贫困，所向不通，钱财耗散。 但念九龙妙典，供养礼拜，传授真符。 即不能侵扰，虚耗之鬼助人作福。 道言：吾所说五龙九圣，安镇五方九宫分野。 所以者何？ 龙王上统九天，下安九地等仙官之灵威。 升天入地，传言负彩。 出幽入微，年寿万岁，精通至道。 若世间有通灵彻圣之者，修真悟道之人，及国王大臣，及行军战阵，悉用神龙扶助，而得胜也。 体生於无，皆禀灵也。 天地万物，皆因道法，起教证焉。 道君告北帝曰：有形之圣，莫过於龙。 复能降雨兴云，感动天地。 善护珍宝，吐琅玕宝珠。 致物与人，守连环宝珠。 江湖洞穴，垒明月宝珠。 龙宫内殿，无价莹珠。 奇不可说，是以保家安国。 若有人持念此北帝九龙妙典，设法行道。 国中人民有疾苦者，悉得安愈。 金银涌出，八苦消停，众善和合。 法音流布，无不获福，分野欢乐，悉证无为。 尔於未闻，要在宣传。 道言：若下元生人，住宅凶耗，居处不安，频有灾疾。 可建立五龙道场，日夕三时，转经行道。 当降仙官及勅八卦大神，月德六合及五龙王。
chunks.translated_text:
The Black Dragon is the essence of the northern seven lodges, Dipper and Ox, descending to the human realm to protect and sustain the land. Within the Palace of Great Yin, it transforms into the Dragon Kings Poliu and Sidu, presiding over the black treasures and bestowing the black robes and official emoluments of the world, governing the ways of ships and vessels. If one in the world finds their aspirations thwarted and their long-held wishes unfulfilled, they should establish an altar and prostrate in worship. This will summon the black treasures of the Infinite World of the North and the black robes and official emoluments to descend into their body, dispelling the misfortunes of water disasters, shipwrecks, and carriage accidents, and ensuring the land’s abundant harvest.

The Yellow Dragon is the essence of the central seven lodges, descending to the human realm to protect and sustain the land. Within the Palace of High August Heaven, it transforms into the Dragon King of the Detached Palace, presiding over the yellow treasures and the five directional treasuries’ riches, providing the myriad people with clothing, food, and official emoluments. It dwells within the chambers of human residences and the treasure caves of famous mountains. If one in the world seeks to attain blessings and emoluments as they desire, they should establish an altar and offer devout prayers. This will summon the yellow treasures and official emoluments from the subterranean palace of the Central Earth Emperor to enter their body, causing their livelihood to flourish daily, their nobility to reach the royal throne, and all their wishes to be fulfilled. It will dispel the misfortunes of the five viscera’s hundred ailments and the calamities of the five stars’ influence upon fate. When the Star of Stability inscribes their name in the register, blessings will arise within them.

The Dao states: These Five Directional Dragon Kings excellently stabilize the land. Moreover, the Nine Dragons excellently guard the treasures, transforming and manifesting across the five directions. If a land’s five grains do not flourish, its people suffer famine, its royal taxes remain unmet, and its people flee to the mountains and valleys, filling the roads with cries of resentment, those who seek peace should establish a Nine Dragons ritual arena, recite scriptures, and perform the Daoist circumambulation. Heaven will send sweet dew, the hungry will be sated, the five grains will ripen early, flowers and fruits will bear flavor, and famine will be averted, sparing lives from untimely death—all through the power of the Dragon Kings.

The Dao states: If the lands under the jurisdiction of various states experience omens both auspicious and inauspicious, the five grains fail to propagate, and the people suffer famine, one may inscribe the names of the Nine Dragons on tablets of jasper, gold, and ivory. On the days of the Three Origins, these tablets should be driven into the earth to a depth of one foot and two inches, aligned with the five directions of the respective lands. Thus, the divine dragons will be pacified and anchored. Offerings of incense and flowers should be made at each position. After seven days, the Dragon King of the Black Palace, along with the Great Generals of the Northern Emperor, will journey to the Vermilion Brightness Palace to open the treasure vaults, transport the implements of the Seven Perfected, and proceed to the left valley of Goat Mountain to retrieve the five grains. Bringing these to the afflicted land, they will provide relief, allowing both heaven and humanity to enjoy abundance and dispelling all sorrows.

The Dao states: If the men and women of a land are born in years governed by the Ominous Star or ill-omened lodges, under the Five Graves or Four Cuts, their fate will not prosper, and they will encounter depletion and loss, lacking sufficient clothing and food. Anxious day and night, nothing will go as they wish. Those who seek blessings should establish an altar and devoutly recite the true forms of the Nine Dragons. On the twenty-sixth day of each month, they should burn incense, offer water, wear the true talismans of the Nine Dragons, and carry the Great Register of the Five Dragons. With sincere devotion and focused intent, the dragons will descend with heavenly might into their homes, granting their desires and bringing immediate benefit.

The Dao states: If the regional lords, governors, and magistrates of a land—from the two-thousand-bushel officials down to the district chiefs—wish to attain high official rank, remain free from disasters, enforce prohibitions effectively, and avoid disputes and litigation, they may inscribe the names of the Nine Dragons on ivory. On the day of Blessing’s Birth, they should stand it in the east, place it in a five-colored bag, and hold it with utmost sincerity. In their sleeping chambers, on the days of the lunar phases each month, they should offer rare flowers, exotic fruits, and pure water. The Dragon Kings will descend, their divine power protecting the people, aiding the royal transformation, and ensuring promotions and emoluments.

The Dao states: The ghosts of the Five Depletions are surnamed Lang and named Sengwen. The ghosts of the Six Losses are surnamed Huang and named Yuangai. Each year, they cause people’s depletion and loss, impoverishing them, obstructing their paths, and dissipating their wealth. However, by reciting the wondrous scripture of the Nine Dragons, making offerings, and prostrating in worship, and by transmitting the true talismans, these ghosts will be unable to harass them, and the ghosts of depletion and loss will instead assist in bringing blessings.

The Dao states: The Five Dragons and Nine Sages I have spoken of pacify and anchor the five directions and the nine palaces’ respective lands. Why is this so? The Dragon Kings govern the nine heavens above and stabilize the nine earths below, wielding the numinous power of the immortals’ officials. Ascending to heaven and entering the earth, they convey messages and bear radiant hues. Emerging from obscurity and penetrating the subtle, they live for ten thousand years, their essence attuned to the supreme Dao. If there are those in the world who possess divine insight and sagely wisdom, who cultivate truth and awaken to the Dao, as well as kings, great ministers, and those engaged in military campaigns, all may invoke the divine dragons for assistance and achieve victory.

Their forms arise from the formless, all endowed with numinosity. The myriad things of heaven and earth all arise through the Dao’s methods, establishing teachings and verifying them. The Dao Lord addressed the Northern Emperor, saying: Among the sagely beings of form, none surpass the dragon. It can summon rain and raise clouds, moving heaven and earth. It excellently guards treasures, spitting forth precious pearls of langgan. It bestows things upon humanity and safeguards the linked-ring treasure pearls. In the rivers, lakes, and grottoes, it amasses luminous moon pearls. Within the dragon palaces’ inner halls lie priceless lustrous pearls—marvels beyond description. Thus, it protects households and stabilizes nations. If one recites and upholds this wondrous scripture of the Northern Emperor’s Nine Dragons, establishing rituals and practicing the Dao, all within the land who suffer illness will be healed. Gold and silver will well forth, the eight sufferings will cease, all virtues will harmonize, and the Dharma’s sound will spread far. None will fail to obtain blessings; the lands will rejoice, and all will realize the formless.

You have not yet heard this; it is essential to propagate it.

The Dao states: If those born in the Lower Origin dwell in homes plagued by depletion and misfortune, their residences unsettled and disasters and illnesses frequent, they may establish a Five Dragons ritual arena. Morning and evening, at the three periods of the day, they should recite scriptures and perform the Daoist circumambulation. Then, immortal officials will descend, and the Eight Trigrams’ great spirits, the Virtue of the Moon, the Six Harmonies, and the Five Dragon Kings will be commanded.

chunks.original_text: 入其宅舍，为消虚耗，逐去邪精。 安贴宫室，镇守宅宇，保子宜孙。 广招官禄，致五色珍宝，入於家庭。 永代安和，富贵无极。 道言：九龙真符，宜官利禄，能令人富贵，万愿从心。 有佩此文，诸灾不染，官私敬爱。 此符有龙神从官九人，玉女十二人，六甲将军八万人，童子六人，及北帝大将军，常来卫护。 上消天灾，下散地祸，无愿不从。 自非虔仰，不敢妄传。 於是仙众而作颂曰： 龙化本无踪，有迹生道宗。 遨游九天际，息驾六领宫。 提携高上宾，及我素灵同。 道场虚寂内，灵歌发太空。 形感至寂庭，思咏微通。 龙吟统官府，凤啸太霄馆。 灵唱无留味，众音承风散。 谁能救此章，精诵素灵赞。 以解三涂过，拔出九玄难。 虔诚礼太虚，福庆凌霄汉。 九龙映明珠，二景对真光。 云飞启翔会，玄象及扶桑。 冥庆自相扶，阴阳朗八荒。 五星光辉耀，神龙演纪纲。 若能修至道，消遥入紫乡。 道君告北帝曰：此九龙妙典，非人不传。 若家有此经，能招珍宝、无价明珠。 告诸真子，善思念之。 广修至道，接引迷途。 功成德遂，升入无形。 精德加重，生南上宫，离诸邪境。 耳闻妙音，足乘五云。 口餐甘露，变化无穷。 尔时，座中大众闻说九龙妙典及五方龙王本源，各生欢雅。 诸方世界，七宝涌出，免诸饥乏。 六合清平，天无妖秽，五谷丰登。 众真作礼，传化奉行。 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第七竟 辟尸箓品 北帝曰：下元生人，宿缘修浅，居世多迍。 当今阳九运周，百六数讫。 鬼精乱行，侵扰大地，善恶莫分。 太上慈仁，出洞渊秘箓神化神咒，以除不祥。 犹有未尽根由，敢附竹木水石之中，尤害万姓。 或魍魉所侵，邪神通体。 或五殟百毒，侵害人间。 或入军阵交锋，枉损性命。 故出明教，妙篆真图，告诸将来真子。 有灾之日，精心传授，以保万民。 白素为之，佩带供养，百邪自退，军阵得胜，家宅清宁，辟尸千里，冤家止讼，善愿从心。 北帝曰：受者词云：某国小兆，某官臣某，谨赍法信，诣天师门下，请受北帝神咒，飞行妙篆。 所属北斗某星君，北斗大神随小兆臣某。 伏鬼消魔，居世安乐，家国休静，大帝扶持。 急急如律令。 北帝曰：此篆灵图，常有一十六部北帝大吏，神咒将军各一百二十人，常覆护受佩之人。 令百邪溃伏，延年益算，永保元吉。 若入军阵之中，受佩此文，兵革退散，免血光之厄、八难之灾。 北帝曰：下元生人，若有滞疾不瘥，魂魄不安，被百魅所侵，连年累月者，即须叩头，奉受太微帝君明镜大箓。 佩之身上，鬼精退散，百病自消，延年保命，神秘神诀。 灵篆图像 明镜玉女一人，保命玉女一人，司命玉女一人，黄素玉女一人，青腰玉女一人。 北帝曰：夫人五人，为勾销死簿。 东斗主算君，为延寿益年。 南斗真人君，为注上长生玉历。 西斗记名君，为注上福禄。 北斗星皇君，为落除死名。 中斗太微君，为禳却灾祸，消诸不祥，所居安乐，鬼气消亡。 若有强□违道之者，并请收付魁罡之下，入地万丈。 急急如律令。 北帝曰：吾出此道、救世安人。 既天下清宁，则功成道合。 尔时，天尊在不可思议城中，遥观北帝，大布符图，救护大地。 仍放光明，普照诸天，乃至下方无极世界。
chunks.translated_text:
Entering their dwellings, it dispels depletion and misfortune, driving away malevolent spirits. It stabilizes palaces and chambers, safeguarding the household and ensuring descendants thrive. It broadly attracts official emoluments, drawing five-colored treasures into the home. For generations, there shall be peace and harmony, boundless wealth and nobility.

The Dao states: The Nine Dragons True Talisman brings official rank and emoluments, enabling one to attain wealth and nobility, with all wishes fulfilled. Those who carry this text shall remain untouched by disasters, respected by both officials and commoners. This talisman is accompanied by nine dragon spirits as officials, twelve jade maidens, eighty thousand generals of the Six Jia, six divine youths, and the Great General of the Northern Emperor, who constantly come to guard and protect. Above, it dispels celestial calamities; below, it scatters terrestrial misfortunes—no wish shall go unfulfilled. Without sincere reverence, it must not be recklessly transmitted.

Thereupon, the assembly of immortals offered this hymn:

Dragons transform without trace,
Yet their marks give rise to the Dao’s lineage.
Roaming the nine heavens’ bounds,
They rest their chariots in the six peaks’ halls.
They uplift the loftiest guests,
And join with our pure spirits in harmony.
Within the empty stillness of the ritual arena,
Divine songs resound through the vast sky.
Forms perceive the tranquil court,
Thoughts chant, subtly connecting.
Dragon chants govern the offices,
Phoenix cries echo in the celestial halls.
Spiritual hymns leave no lingering taste,
All sounds disperse upon the wind.
Who can rescue this chapter?
Through earnest recitation, praise the pure spirits’ ode,
To absolve the three paths’ transgressions,
And extricate from the nine mysteries’ trials.
With reverence, pay homage to the Great Void,
Where blessings ascend beyond the heavens.
Nine dragons reflect the luminous pearl,
Two radiant essences face the true light.
Clouds soar in soaring assemblies,
Celestial signs and the Fusang tree appear.
Hidden blessings mutually sustain,
Yin and yang illuminate the eight wilds.
The five stars shine brilliantly,
Divine dragons unfold the cosmic order.
If one cultivates the utmost Dao,
Freely they enter the Purple Realm.

The Dao Lord addressed the Northern Emperor, saying: This Nine Dragons Wondrous Canon is not to be transmitted to the unworthy. If a household possesses this scripture, it will attract treasures and priceless luminous pearls. I exhort all true disciples to reflect upon it earnestly. Broadly cultivate the utmost Dao, guiding those lost on the path. When merit is accomplished and virtue perfected, ascend into the formless. With profound virtue deepened, be born in the Southern Supreme Palace, free from all perverse realms. Your ears shall hear wondrous sounds, your feet shall ride the five-colored clouds. Your mouth shall feast on sweet dew, and your transformations shall be boundless.

At that time, the great assembly, having heard the Nine Dragons Wondrous Canon and the origins of the Five Directions’ Dragon Kings, each rejoiced with refined delight. Throughout all worlds, the seven treasures welled forth, sparing all from hunger and want. The six directions were purified, the heavens free from defilement, and the five grains abundant. The assembly of perfected beings bowed in reverence and transmitted the teachings for practice.

Thus concludes the seventh scroll of *The Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s Scripture of the Northern Emperor’s Divine Incantations for Subduing Demons*.

---

**Section on the Register for Expelling Corpses**

The Northern Emperor said: Those born in the Lower Origin, with shallow karmic cultivation in past lives, endure many hardships in this world. Now, as the Yang Nine cycle turns and the Hundred Six count concludes, ghostly spirits roam chaotically, invading and disturbing the earth, where good and evil are indistinguishable. The Most High, in his compassion, revealed the *Secret Register of the Abyssal Cavern* and divine incantations to eliminate misfortune. Yet some root causes remain unexhausted, daring to lurk within bamboo, wood, water, and stone, harming the myriad people. Whether afflicted by *wangliang* spirits, perverse gods, the Five Maladies, or a hundred poisons, or whether entering battle and wrongfully losing their lives, I now issue this luminous teaching, wondrous talismans, and true diagrams to instruct all future true disciples. On days of calamity, transmit these with utmost sincerity to protect the people. Inscribe them on white silk, wear and venerate them—all perverse forces shall retreat, battles shall be won, households shall be tranquil, corpses shall be repelled for a thousand *li*, grievances shall cease, and good wishes shall be fulfilled as the heart desires.

The Northern Emperor said: The recipient shall recite these words: "I, a humble subject of [such-and-such] kingdom, [such-and-such] official [so-and-so], respectfully present ritual offerings to the gate of the Heavenly Master, requesting to receive the Northern Emperor’s divine incantations and flying talismans. Under the governance of the Northern Dipper’s [such-and-such] Star Lord, may the Northern Dipper’s great spirits follow this humble subject [so-and-so]. Subdue ghosts, dispel demons, and grant peace in this life, tranquility for household and kingdom, with the Great Emperor’s protection. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law!"

The Northern Emperor said: This talismanic diagram is constantly attended by sixteen divisions of the Northern Emperor’s great officers, one hundred twenty divine incantation generals, who ever shield those who wear it. They cause all perverse forces to scatter and submit, prolonging years and increasing destiny, eternally preserving primordial auspiciousness. If one enters battle wearing this text, weapons shall retreat, sparing them from the calamity of bloodshed and the eight difficulties.

The Northern Emperor said: For those born in the Lower Origin afflicted with lingering illness, whose souls are unsettled, beset by a hundred specters over years and months, they must kowtow and receive the *Luminous Register of the Supreme Tenuity Emperor Lord*. Wear it upon the body—ghostly spirits shall retreat, all illnesses shall vanish, years shall be prolonged, and life preserved. These are the secret divine methods.

**Talismanic Diagram and Imagery**
One Jade Maiden of the Luminous Mirror, one Jade Maiden of Life Preservation, one Jade Maiden of Life Administration, one Jade Maiden of Yellow Silk, one Jade Maiden of the Azure Waist.

The Northern Emperor said: These five women shall strike names from the ledger of death. The Lord of the Eastern Dipper governs destiny, prolonging life and increasing years. The True Person Lord of the Southern Dipper inscribes eternal life in the Jade Calendar. The Lord of the Western Dipper records names, inscribing blessings and emoluments. The Star Sovereign of the Northern Dipper erases names from death’s roster. The Supreme Tenuity Lord of the Central Dipper averts calamities, dispelling all misfortunes, ensuring peace in one’s dwelling and the vanishing of ghostly *qi*. Should any defiantly oppose this Dao, they shall be seized and consigned beneath the *Kuigang*, plunged ten thousand *zhang* into the earth. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law!

The Northern Emperor said: I issue this Dao to save the world and pacify its people. When the world is purified and at peace, merit shall be accomplished and the Dao fulfilled. At that time, the Heavenly Worthy, within the Inconceivable City, gazed afar upon the Northern Emperor, broadly disseminating talismans and diagrams to save and protect the earth. He emitted radiant light, universally illuminating all heavens, even to the boundless worlds below.

chunks.original_text: 令彼下元生人，得见光明，开诸愚昧，与道结缘，反本还元，受其威力。 於是，天尊举手弹指，无上宝光，如镜之圆，从掌中出。 彻照下方无量国土，乃至三涂恶趣、九幽苦境，皆得明朗，了了清净。 地狱休息，报对停闲。 聋盲六疾，一切苦恼，皆得除愈。 人畜禽兽，普发善心，不相伤害。 因此光明一切，众生举身，遥见不思议城，如看掌中，无有遗夫。 见其光者，必当得往长生福堂，入宝城中，快乐无极。 我今所演说，一切诸天尊，过去未来，皆同一心力。 十方微尘土，所有诸法王，俱演微妙义，一乘无上经。 若有一人闻，一章一句偈，誓心欲奉持，宣读未来世。 如此善男子，及以善女人，所在经行处，灾疾不敢伤。 若有一心念，五毒尽消摧。 又请说真义，所行奇妙因。 真人所得法，观身如悉空。 苦乐无二相，憎爱悉同因。 高卑无异趣，小大不殊形。 日出非初合，日没讵终亡。 东西本无定，出没亦无方。 又问何因缘，恩惠起虚皇。 北帝尔时说此微妙宝图，告诸来世善男子善女人，有忧之日，勤行不倦，佩吾符篆，万厄消亡，敬而信之，至心奉行。 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第八竟 太上元始天尊说北帝伏魔神咒妙经卷第九 八字消灾品 北方黑帝灵君，尔时告天蓬大将，九元煞童，上清禹余天、大赤天、清微天、大煞神众百亿万人，六丁大神，六甲玉女，高刁北翁，三煞神王，北斗七星真人，驱邪三昧将军，四海龙王，五岳四渎河海大神，三天大魔王，严驾夔龙威剑神王，煞鬼大神，女青诏书，右部大神，吞魔食鬼二十四大神，四目老翁，日月星辰，六丁八史，五方五帝神兵三千万众，四明功曹，通真使者三千六百人，黑煞大兵，九土群灵，山河溪涧一切部众。 吾欲广宣要法，以救天人，绝其呻吟楚痛之厄，汝等谛听。 尔时，阖座灵官，闻帝君欲宣妙典，各各欢喜，一心归命。 北帝曰：北宫秘诀，不可得闻。 救疾禳灾，宁家安国。 吾知下元生人疾苦联积，楚痛难任。 不忍见此愚聋，今欲专行救护。 北帝曰：八字灵篆，宝之上宫。 万劫不传，是为神秘。 切见下元愚俗，苦痛甚多。 若不施行，萎黄无脱。 今当付授，宝而积功。 有灾之日，依法修行。 救度天人，免其忧厄。 尔时，阖座闻帝君欲宣八字，五体投地，踊跃而作偈曰： 圣帝惠恩流，广开金口诀。 救此下元人，疾苦令消灭。 阖座闻法音，五体欣然别。 聋者耳得闻，哑者口能说。 是日六宫动，邪魔知凶吉。 垂赐大光明，重昏遇朗日。 北帝曰：座中真子，若欲修吾八字灵篆，北向再拜，吾当见汝志心耳。 北帝曰：八字灵篆，若下元生人有疾在腹者，以墨书，水吞之一字，加持神咒。 至此八字，即得消散。 若疾在外者，当静思神力，以墨书其肉上且书第一字。 若未消散，更於其侧书第二字，大都不过三字，无不退散。 告诸真子，忆而奉行。 北帝曰：下元男子女人，若治生不益，贫穷困厄，鬼魅相侵，时多疾病，经年累月。 但带此八字灵文，邪疾迸消，治生日益，灾妖止息，六害消亡。 北帝曰：下元生人，若眷属不和，每多口舌，夫妻相克，男女不安。 宜志心虔恳，以六合日素书八字，佩带供养。 精诚之至，当有神童随逐上下卧止之处，不令口舌，男女成长，或梦而示事，万头和合。

Thus shall the people of the Lower Realm behold this radiance, their ignorance dispelled, that they may form karmic bonds with the Dao, return to their original nature, and receive its mighty power.

Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy raised a hand and snapped his fingers—an ineffable, jewel-like light, round as a mirror, issued forth from his palm. It pierced through the boundless lands below, even to the Three Wicked Paths and the Nine Dark Hells, all of which were illumined, bright and immaculate. The torments of hell ceased, and karmic retribution paused. The deaf, the blind, and the sixfold afflictions—all suffering was dispelled and healed. Men and beasts, birds and creatures, universally awakened to benevolence, no longer harming one another. By virtue of this radiance, all beings beheld with their whole bodies the Inconceivable City from afar, as though gazing into their own palms, none left unseen. Those who witnessed this light were destined to ascend to the Hall of Longevity and Bliss, entering the Jeweled City, where joy knows no end.

What I now expound, all the Heavenly Worthies—past, present, and future—share in one mind and power. The dust-mote realms of the ten directions, all their Dharma Kings, together proclaim the subtle and wondrous meaning, the supreme sutra of the One Vehicle. Should even one person hear but a single chapter or verse, vowing to uphold and recite it for future ages—such a virtuous man or woman, wherever they tread, shall be untouched by calamity or illness. If one concentrates the mind, the Five Poisons shall be utterly dispelled. Again, I reveal the true meaning, the wondrous causes of practice: the perfected attain the Dharma, perceiving the body as utterly empty. Suffering and joy are not two, hatred and love share a single cause. High and low are not distinct, great and small differ not in form. The sun’s rising is not its first union, nor its setting its final demise. East and west are fundamentally unfixed; rising and setting know no direction.

Further, it was asked: by what cause did the Celestial August One bestow grace? At that time, the Northern Emperor proclaimed this subtle and wondrous talisman, addressing all virtuous men and women of future generations: in days of sorrow, practice tirelessly, wear my talismanic script, and ten thousand calamities shall vanish. With reverence and faith, devote yourself wholeheartedly to its observance.

The *Supreme Scripture of the Northern Emperor’s Divine Incantations for Subduing Demons*, as Spoken by the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy, Volume Eight—Concluded.
The *Supreme Scripture of the Northern Emperor’s Divine Incantations for Subduing Demons*, as Spoken by the Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy, Volume Nine: The Eight-Character Disaster-Dispelling Chapter.

The Dark Sovereign of the Northern Palace, the Black Emperor Spirit Lord, then addressed Marshal Tianpeng, the Ninefold Yuan Slayer Youths, the hosts of the Upper Clarity Yu-Yu Heaven, the Great Red Heaven, the Pure Tenuity Heaven, the Great Slayer Divine Multitudes—hundreds of millions strong—the Six Ding Great Spirits, the Six Jia Jade Maidens, the High Diao Northern Elder, the Three Slayer Spirit Kings, the Perfected of the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper, the Generals of the Samādhi for Driving Away Evil, the Dragon Kings of the Four Seas, the Great Spirits of the Five Peaks and Four Waterways, the River and Sea Deities, the Three Heavenly Demon Kings, the Divine Kings of the Mighty Sword of the Kui-Dragon Chariot, the Great Spirit Slayer of Ghosts, the Edict of Lady Qing, the Great Spirits of the Right Division, the Twenty-Four Great Spirits Who Devour Demons and Consume Ghosts, the Four-Eyed Elder, the Sun, Moon, and Stars, the Six Ding and Eight Scribes, the Divine Soldiers of the Five Directions and Five Emperors—thirty million strong—the Four Illuminating Merit Officers, the Three Thousand Six Hundred Messengers for Communicating with the Real, the Black Slayer Great Soldiers, the Multitudes of the Nine Lands, and all the hosts of mountains, rivers, streams, and ravines.

The Emperor declared: I now wish to broadly proclaim this essential Dharma to save the celestial and human realms, severing their groans and agonies. Hearken well, all of you.

At that moment, the assembled divine officials, hearing the Emperor’s intent to reveal the wondrous scripture, rejoiced as one, wholeheartedly submitting in devotion.

The Northern Emperor said: The secret arts of the Northern Palace are not lightly disclosed. They heal illness, avert calamity, pacify households, and secure the realm. I know the people of the Lower Realm suffer deeply, their agonies unbearable. Unable to bear the sight of their ignorance and deafness, I now resolve to enact their salvation.

The Northern Emperor said: The Eight-Character Spirit Script is treasured in the Upper Palace. Through ten thousand kalpas, it has not been transmitted—such is its divine secrecy. Yet I see the ignorant and vulgar of the Lower Realm endure grievous suffering. Were I not to bestow it, they would wither without escape. Now I entrust it to you, that you may accumulate merit and treasure it. In times of calamity, practice it according to the method. Deliver the celestial and human realms, sparing them from sorrow and peril.

Upon hearing the Emperor’s intent to proclaim the Eight Characters, the entire assembly prostrated themselves, five limbs to the earth, and joyfully recited this verse:
*The sagely Emperor’s grace flows wide,*
*Broadly opening the golden oral transmission.*
*To save the people of the Lower Realm,*
*Let their sufferings be utterly dispelled.*

The assembly, hearing the Dharma sound, rejoiced with every limb. The deaf regained hearing, the mute could speak. On that day, the Six Palaces trembled, and evil demons knew their fate. The great radiance was bestowed, and deep gloom met the bright sun.

The Northern Emperor said: Perfected disciples here present, if you wish to practice my Eight-Character Spirit Script, face north and bow twice. I shall witness your sincere devotion.

The Northern Emperor said: For those among the Lower Realm’s people afflicted with internal illness, write the characters in ink, swallow one with water, and recite the divine incantation. Upon reaching the eighth character, the illness shall disperse. For external afflictions, calmly invoke the divine power, write the characters in ink upon the flesh, beginning with the first. If it does not disperse, write the second beside it. In most cases, no more than three characters are needed for the illness to retreat. Remember this well, perfected disciples, and uphold it.

The Northern Emperor said: For men and women of the Lower Realm whose livelihoods falter, who suffer poverty and hardship, are assailed by ghosts and demons, or endure chronic illness—merely wear this Eight-Character Spirit Text, and malevolent afflictions shall vanish. Livelihoods shall flourish, calamities and demonic influences cease, and the Six Harms be dispelled.

The Northern Emperor said: If the people of the Lower Realm suffer discord among kin, frequent quarrels, marital strife, or unrest among sons and daughters, they should devoutly and earnestly write the Eight Characters on plain silk on a day of harmonious conjunction, wear and venerate them. With utmost sincerity, divine youths shall attend them day and night, preventing strife. Sons and daughters shall grow in peace, or dreams may reveal matters, ensuring ten thousand harmonious unions.

chunks.original_text: 北帝曰：下元生人，若行江河渡海及入山林，行军战伐。 但以亥子二时，沐浴身心佩此八字，素帛为之，带於身上。 神龙护卫，风伯助持，战胜得通，无不克果。 北帝曰：下元生人，田种连年不收，若五谷灾损。 但受佩此八字真文，佩之身上，所营种植，获利万倍。 若能夏首，祈恩立愿，保至冬收。 用酒脯、饼果、银钱镇信，依科醮奏，答吾神力，则灾虫伏灭，土伯和心。 八字之功，不可思议。 北帝曰：下元生人，若居职位，上至官迁，拘束公途，养他民子。 必令恩威兼备，平断四方，直道至公，无损多益。 当受此经及带八字真文，无不称遂。 北帝曰：下元生人，若求仙学道，访友寻真，烧丹炼药，隐迹山林。 必须受此经，思此妙道，带此八字。 若无斯文，徒费功力。 北帝曰：下元生人，乃至真人，受佩吾此真道。 必欲行法之时，预先盥漱，叩齿三通，闭炁三息，方可下笔书之。 亦当思神念咒，度香噀水，当应神验矣。 醮祭真君法 太微帝君，尔时居玄景宫中，九龙之室。 自然涌出七宝宫殿，其座皆是水晶，碧玉、琉璃、真珠，严诤装饰，世之稀有。 座下侍从无鞅之众，各捧香花，持心供养。 十方来者，各诣帝前，听说妙义。

The Northern Emperor said: For those born of the Lower Realm who traverse rivers and seas or enter mountain forests, or who march in military campaigns—merely bathe body and mind during the hours of *hai* and *zi*, and wear these Eight Characters inscribed on plain silk upon the person. Divine dragons shall guard and protect, the Wind Earl shall lend aid, battles shall be won and paths made clear, with none failing to achieve victory.

The Northern Emperor said: For those born of the Lower Realm whose fields yield no harvest year after year, or whose five grains suffer blight—merely receive and wear these Eight Characters of the True Text upon the body, and all cultivated plantings shall yield ten thousandfold profit. If, at the onset of summer, one prays for grace and makes a vow, pledging to uphold it until winter’s harvest, offering wine, dried meats, cakes, fruits, silver, and coin as tokens of faith, and follows the rites in presenting the memorial, then in gratitude for my divine power, pestilence shall be subdued, the Earth Duke’s heart shall be harmonized. The merit of the Eight Characters is beyond all reckoning.

The Northern Emperor said: For those born of the Lower Realm who hold office, from the lowest ranks to the highest promotions, constrained by public duties and charged with the care of others’ children—let them ensure that grace and authority are balanced, that all four directions are judged with fairness, that the path of impartiality is followed, and that harm is minimized while benefit is maximized. Let them receive this scripture and wear the Eight Characters of the True Text, and none shall fail to attain their desires.

The Northern Emperor said: For those born of the Lower Realm who seek immortality and study the Dao, who visit friends in search of truth, who refine elixirs and concoct medicines, or who conceal themselves in mountain forests—it is essential to receive this scripture, contemplate this wondrous Dao, and wear these Eight Characters. Without this text, efforts shall be in vain.

The Northern Emperor said: For those born of the Lower Realm, even perfected beings, who receive and wear this True Dao of mine—when intending to perform its rites, they must first purify themselves with ablutions, strike their teeth thrice, hold their breath for three cycles, and only then may they take up the brush to inscribe it. They should also visualize the spirits, recite the incantation, pass incense through the smoke, and sprinkle consecrated water, whereupon the divine response shall manifest.

**Rites for Offering to the True Lord**
When the Supreme Tenuity Emperor Lord resides in the Palace of Mystic Radiance, within the Chamber of Nine Dragons, a seven-jeweled palace naturally arises, its thrones fashioned of crystal, jasper, lapis lazuli, and true pearls, adorned with ornaments rare in the world. Beneath the throne, an innumerable host of attendants, each bearing incense and flowers, offer reverent devotion. Those who come from the ten directions all approach before the Emperor, listening to the exposition of wondrous truths.
